loans.name: Cumez Group

texts.en:
Chichicastenango is well-known among travelers for its large and colorful market held twice each week. The women who live in the town wear some of the most beautiful and colorful traditional outfits in Guatemala. The customs and governments of Chichicastenango are based on a mixture of indigenous and Catholic traditions. The beautiful church in the center of town is a perfect example of this mixture. Mayan ceremonies and processions are often seen on the steps and around the exterior of the church while religious ceremonies occur inside.

Friendship Bridge serves over 22,000 impoverished women in the country who greatly benefit from the “Microcredit Plus” Program of the organization that combines education and small loans. In Chichicastenango, the Trust Bank “Cumez” is about to begin its second loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. The ladies have seen how much they have progressed, both economically and personally, in their first loan cycle. They are excited to be requesting a second loan that they hope will be funded by Kiva lenders.

The women in “Cumez” have an average of 6 children and have varying degrees of a primary school education. Sebastiana is 53 years old and a member of the group. She has six children and works hard to meet their needs. She has two businesses including animal husbandry and the embroidering of traditional colorful woven blouses called “huipiles” (pronounced wee-pee-les). She creates them in various styles and designs. Sebastiana also sells chickens and pigs that she raises. She is requesting a loan to purchase 15 pounds of thread, 25 boxes of high quality embroidery cotton in various colors and other supplies. Her goal is to attract more clients and increase her earnings.

The ladies in the “Cumez” Trust Bank want to thank Kiva lenders for believing in them and their goals. They are poised to step into a more prosperous future benefitting themselves, their families and their community in Chichicastenango, Guatemala. Thank you, Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to purchase good quality thread and other necessary supplies for her textiles business.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El socio Carlos se dedica al negocio de venta de choclos, el socio es una persona trabajadora que por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a su familia,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de choclos.El socio solicita el crédito para comprar choclos al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Carlos sells sweet corn. He is very hardworking, and through this business he helps his family get ahead. His dream is to grow his business selling sweet corn. He is requesting this loan to buy sweet corn at wholesale.

Carlos is happy to have this loan, and he is committed to meeting the repayment requirements.

loans.use: to purchase sweet corn at wholesale.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a sari-sari store owner from Bohol, Philippines and is 39. She is married with an eight year old daughter and her husband works hard as a company employee. Regina wants the best for her daughter. She dreams to let her finish her studies and get a good job in the future. She also dreams to renovate their house for a comfortable living.

As for now, she wants to borrow money to continue her business. She will be using the money to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, toiletries, spices, sugar, coffee, laundry soap, soft drinks, drinking liquor and purified water.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, toiletries, spices, sugar, coffee, laundry soap, soft drinks, drinking liquor and purified water.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 57 years old, and has four children. She is a widow, working hard just to provide for the needs of her children. 

She earns income by selling goods in their community  She has been doing this for many years. She always wants to improve her family's living standards. Without hesitation, Anecita has decided to take a loan to buy more goods to sell. 

She is a new member of GDMPC, and with her access to it, her goal of improving her business will become more possible.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jane is 51 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Jane has a handicraft business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her business.

Jane has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette is a 34-year-old married woman with six children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Suzette has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Suzette has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 60 years old, and married with five children.

Lydia is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lydia has been in this business for 15 years, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ma. Liza

texts.en:
Ma. Liza works hard to support her family. She is widow and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Ma. Liza has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Ma. Liza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 33 years old, married, and has one child in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Melanie requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers for her farms.

Melanie has been farming rice for three years now, and she has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Melanie would like to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers for her farms

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John used the previous loan to buy rice, maize, and millet flour to sell. He is farmer and at the same time sells produce which give him more income. With the proceeds from the loan he took, he was able to pay rent for his business, feed his family, pay back the loan and educate his children. Being in his eighth cycle, John is grateful to Kiva that as seen him develop his business to a higher level though he complains of price changes that which affects his returns.

He dreams of having a fully stocked produce store that can supply his customers throughout the year without scarcity. John requests a loan to buy maize flour for selling.

loans.use: to buy maize flour for  selling.

loans.name: Tin's Group

texts.en:
Living in Kampong Cham province, Tin is 36 years old and a married mother of two dependent children. One of them is in school.  

She has been growing rice as her main source of income for 18 years. She also grows cassava to earn additional income. Insects have destroyed much of her crop so that she could only earn 40,000 KHR per day. 

This is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loans, which she repaid successfully, enabled her to improve her family’s living conditions. As the leader of a group of two, Tin will use her portion of the loan to buy rice seed and pay for labor fees to grow her crop.  

She hopes that her farmland can produce more yields, allowing her to upgrade her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and pay for labor fees to grow her crop.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Los Celajes Group

texts.en:
The Maya K’iche are the predominant indigenous people of the Guatemalan State of Quiche. The terrain is mountainous frequently having low hanging clouds swirling about that makes it seem to the people that they live next to the sky. Santa Cruz del Quiche is the capital of the State and this is where seven inspired and industrious women formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Los Celajes”. Recently, they successfully completed repaying their first loan financed by the investors of Kiva. They are very pleased with their success and now they are requesting a second loan.

The always smiling twenty-nine year old Hilda graduated as an executive secretary. She sells underwear and also makes and sells sausages (chorizos, longanizas, pickled beef & chicken). Hilda’s short term goal is to save money so that she can open a market where she can display her products. She is asking Kiva lenders for another loan so that she can buy a variety of clothing to resell. She also wants to buy the raw products to make her sausages. All of these efforts go toward her ultimate goal of being a strong source of income that will provide a good education for her two children, as well as provide opportunities for a good healthy life.

The ladies of “Los Celajes” meet once each month to make payments on their loans and to participate in educational training sessions led by a Friendship Bridge Facilitator. The organization calls the effective combination of loans and education “Microcredit Plus”. Some of the subjects covered include violence against women and women’s rights, self-esteem and empowerment as well as setting goals. Other topics include nutrition, health and hygiene and the use of medicinal plants. The women learn to manage their loans most effectively with information about planning, budgeting, pricing, marketing, customer service and accounting.
All the women of “Los Celajes” are proud to be a part of an important organization like Friendship Bridge. This is especially the case of Gulelia who says “Thanks to the loans from Friendship Bridge, I have been able to buy land and build a house. Before I had to rent. I was able to do this because I learned so much from the monthly classes where I was taught about gender equity, business management and investment, as well as the importance of having savings. Thank you again Kiva lenders for helping to make my life brighter!!”

loans.use: to buy the raw products to make her sausages.

location.town: Santa Cruz del Quiche, El Quiche

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is already 73 years old. To earn a living she promptly put up a sari-sari store business. Her store is earning money, and in fact, she was able to pay her previous loan.

She aims to have a bigger income, so she decided to get a loan to buy more products to sell such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee to supply her customers' demand. This will result a greater income. Anecita's plan for the future to save money to sustain the needs of their family.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell, including canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a 36-year-old woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Theresa has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her  business.

Theresa has been in this business for one year. In the future, Theresa would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is 32 years old, and single with one school-aged child. 

Maricar is in agriculture, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Maricar has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pig.

Maricar has been in this business for three years, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins and other inputs to raise her pig.

loans.name: Chet's Group

texts.en:
Chet, 53, is a farmer living in Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province and a married mother of six children. 

She grows rice as the main source of her family’s income. At the same time, she sells grocery items in the market to earn additional money. She has been  in her job for 35 years. She is able to earn about 53,000 KHR per day. Insect infestations have impacted her rice farming this season, decreasing her yields and working capital. 
 
This is the second loan cycle for Chet and her group with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner); they repaid their past loan successfully. She found that the previous loan enabled her to support her family much better. 

She and her group member will each get a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR. The loan will be used to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizers to increase her crop yields. She hopes to earn and save more money to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizers to increase her crop yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Kuuga Na Gwika Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is called Minnie. She is 28 years old, single and living with her three children. She practices mixed farming business where she farms maize, beans and potatoes and also does dairy farming. She is taking a Kiva loan to buy animal feeds for her dairy cows. She hopes that this will increase milk production to enable her meet her customers demands.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds to increase milk production and meet rising customers demands.

loans.name: Rucenie

texts.en:
Rucenie is 29 years old and has two children. She is single and has two children who are in school.

Rucenie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Rucenie has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Raquila

texts.en:
Raquila is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with eight children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, chips, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming rice.

Raquila dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, chips, etc

loans.name: Big Women Do Big Things - N5Ttiếnqnham Group

texts.en:
Mrs Nga is 58 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. Nga lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the income from this job is unstable because when some diseases on poultry happen, she has nothing to sell and she will be in trouble with finance.

The main hardship that Nga faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Before she had borrowed from Thanh Hoa MFI, Nga knew how to raise her income but she did not have enough money for doing that. In 2013, Nga joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Nga has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
Nga is the leader of N5TTiếnQNham, which consists of 6 members.
With her business profit, Nga hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Friends Of The Sea - 06Thưnghlộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hương is 33 years old and she is married with 3 children. She has operated a food stall, selling fish for six years. Hương lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the place she lives is near the sea and purchasing seafood is popular, so it is very difficult for her to compete with other sellers and raise her income.

The main hardship that Hương faces is a lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to sell.

In 2011, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

She is the group leader of the 06THưngHLộc, which consists of six members.

With her business profit, Hương hopes to pay for her children's study costs. She also hope for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Joesel

texts.en: Joesel  is 33 years old and married with 1 child. He lives in Pan-ay Diot, Clarin Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a transport business in the local community to earn a living. He has been with his business for over 7 years and earns 6,000 PHP every month. He has been with GDMPC since 2009 and is now requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to repair and purchase spare parts. He dreams to help his children complete their education.

loans.use: To buy vehicle parts for vehicle repair.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Her name is Robinia, aged 40, from the province of Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Jayson, an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker) she has one child who is already in school. Although her husband is an OFW, Robinia opened a small general store to keep herself busy and earn extra income to meet their daily household needs and, more importantly, to send her child to a good university.

Robinia has been operating her store for two years already. She also has a boarding house which she rents out to students. Her earnings have greatly helped cover their daily sustenance. She sells dry and packaged commodities directly to consumers. She buys supplies at wholesale prices and sells items retail. Her store means a lot to her since it was their main source of income when her husband was not yet an OFW. 

To help her expand her business, she is requesting a Php 17,000 loan which she will use fill her store with sacks of rice and other grocery items such as canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits, soda, toiletries, etc. It is important that she offers almost all essential food items and household needs to make her store more attractive and serve more customers.

Robinia dreams of having a big grocery store someday and see her offspring finish school. She also hopes to help her less fortunate relatives and friends. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and draw strength and inspiration by studying the Word of God.
 
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 37 years old, and married with four children. She owns a banana farm which she has been operating her business for over two years. 

Mercy is requesting a loan from GDMPC which she will use to purchase fertilizer. She joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her banana farm.

loans.name: Cherimy

texts.en:
Cherimy is a woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cherimy is 40 years old and has one child in school.

Cherimy has a charcoal-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy coconut shells and other supplies to use in her business.

She has been in this business for one year. In the future, Cherimy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy coconut shells and other supplies to use in her business.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana works hard to support her family with her restaurant business. She is married and lives in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, canned goods, eggs, etc. Marciana has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future, Marciana would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina is a woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Gina is 46 years old now.

Ma. Gina has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Ma. Gina requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy underwear, shirts, etc. to sell.

Ma. Gina has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Ma. Gina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy underwear, shirts, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Néstor Salvador

texts.es:
Néstor, de 21 años de edad, se dedica a trabajos de la agricultura y albañilería, estas actividades las aprendió de sus padres, creció desempeñando estas actividades y a lo largo de su vida se han convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos y le han servido para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.- Su familia está formada por su esposa y su hijo de 4 años de edad, que actualmente está estudiando. 

Néstor, se dedica a la agricultura y la albañilería desde hace 4 años, son actividades productivas en las cuales ha desarrollado mucho conocimiento y experiencia gracias a la enseñanza de su padre y su abuelo; en la actualidad se dedica a la construcción, la cual le ha generado los suficientes ingresos para satisfacer compromisos crediticios y necesidades básicas de su hogar.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar insumos agrícolas, también herramientas para la construcción hortícola y para comprar granos de maíz, porque su esposa se dedica a la venta de tortillas  y de esta manera le da un aporte económico a su familia.

Las metas de Néstor, es tener un sistema de riego por todo su terreno, para que se le facilite la plantación de cultivos todo el año.
texts.en:
Néstor, aged 21, works in agriculture and as a builder, trades which he learned from his parents. He grew up working in these trades, and they have become his main sources of income as an adult. He is married and has a 4-year-old son who goes to school.

Néstor has been working for the last four years in agriculture and construction. Thanks to his father and grandfather, who taught him well, he has brought considerable expertise and experience to his work, and has been very productive. He is currently working in construction, and his earnings have allowed him to cover loan commitments and the essential running costs of his home.

He will use the loan to pay for agricultural supplies, tools for horticultural construction, and to buy corn because his wife sells tortillas, and this will allow him to provide economically for his family.

Néstor's goal is to have a watering system for his entire plot which will allow him to grow crops year-round.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, tools, and corn.

loans.name: Chanthan's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Prey Prosorb district of Kratie province, Chanthan, 31, is a married mother of four kids. Rice farming is the main source of income and she has grown cassava to earn extra income to support the family for 13 years. Her daily business earns her about 43,000KHR per day. The crop has not grown well so it sells at a low price, which is the main challenge for her.

Due to a lack of working capital, Chanthan decided to get a Kiva loan via VisionFund, which is the first time for her. As a group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticide to increase the productivity of her crop.

She hopes to earn additional income so that she can improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticide to increase the productivity of her crop.

loans.name: Bina

texts.en:
Bina is a 45-year-old, rural housewife. She is a mother of two sons. Her two sons are very studious students who are studying in M.A. (Master’s in Arts) and B.A. (Bachelor in Arts) grades. She lives with her husband and children in the small village of Burman Para in Dhupguri under the Jalpaiguri district.

Bina's husband runs a small snacks factory. Whatever he earns is spent for household expenses. He finds it difficult to maintain the family and at the same time cover their children's higher education expenses. Bina faces difficulties to pay their fees, nor can she give them necessary educational articles.

Bina’s elder son, Pranay, is a 22-year-old doing his M.A. in the subject of education under Jadavpur University. He is very attentive in his studies and tries hard to score good marks in examinations, with an aim to be a teacher in the future. Bina feels that her son can study better with all his books and other necessary articles, and if all his fees are paid on time.

So, Bina is requesting an education loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase necessary study materials and books, and pay exam fees and private tutors' fees. The loan will help a bright student to continue his education despite financial constraints.

Bina and Pranay (as seen in the photo) are very much thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to pay for her son's education for a master's degree course.

loans.name: Parabhina

texts.en:
Twenty-nine-year-old Parabhina is the mother of two school-going children (a son and a daughter). She lives in a small village of Dhupguri along with her family. Her first priority in life is to provide a good education to her children. Her son reads in grade 9, and her daughter is studying in grade 6. Parabhina is a housewife, and her husband is engaged with a utensils business.

Parabhina’s son, Firoj, is a student of grade 9. He is 15 years old and reads in Dhupguri High School. He is an average student, but tries his level best to give his best in examinations.

Parabhina is facing difficulty to cover her children's educational expenses. Firoj is sincere about his studies and school curriculum; if he is provided with proper guidance, he can perform well in his examinations. Parabhina has been unable to take care of all the things Firoj needs to continue his studies.

Thus, as a responsible mother, Parabhina applied for an educational loan. She thanks BJS (Kiva’s partner) for helping her; this loan amount will resolve her anxiety. She will use the loan to buy education materials and will engage a private tutor for her son, Firoj.

Parabhina hopes this educational support will give a boost to her son’s education. So Parabhina and Firoj (as seen in the picture) are now very happy after getting the loan and thankful to the lenders.

loans.use: to bear the educational expenses of her son’s uninterrupted schooling.

loans.name: Kuibanga Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Lucy. She is 33 years old, married and has three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from the trainings especially enterprise development.

She practices mixed farming mostly poultry farming and crop farming. She is taking a Kiva loan to buy manure and seedlings. This will increase production hence enable her meet rising customers demands and better her living conditions.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy manure and seedlings so as to boost farming production to meet rising customer demands. This will eventually translate to better living condition for her family.

loans.name: Ganmyagmar

texts.en:
Mrs. Ganmyagmar, 51 years old, lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling meat and meat products to local people since 2010. Her husband renders taxi service to the local people.

Using her previous loan, she has renovated her house but after two years, the house's exterior walls have deteriorated. So she is requesting a loan of 2000 USD to buy cements, plastics, fiberglass and foam in order to repair and insulate exterior and interior walls. By doing so her family will live in a comfortable and warm place in winter, where less coal is burned, releasing less pollutant into air.

loans.use: to repair and insulate her house walls in preparation for winter

loans.name: Rosa Judith

texts.es:
La socia Rosa Judith se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant,la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como carne,verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosa Judith continues to run her restaurant. She is a very enterprising woman, who successfully supports her family with her business. Her dream is to expand her business.

She is requesting a loan to buy produce to cook, such as meat, vegetables and chicken.

She is very happy to be granted the loan and pledges to meet all her payments.

loans.use: to buy produce to cook, such as meat, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Women Run Their Homes - N09Mhợpmlộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thủy is 54 years old and she is married with 3 children. She has operated a food stall selling fish for more than 10 years. Thủy lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the place she lives is near the sea and purchasing seafood is popular, so it is very difficult for her to compete with other sellers and raise her income.

The main hardship that Thủy faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase processed fish to resell.

In 2012, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thủy has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the group leader of the N09MHợpMLộc, which consists of 5 members.
With her business profit, Thủy hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy and to have enough money for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase processed fish to resell.

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Sokun is 43 years old and a mother of three children. She earns income by rice growing and selling grocery items to get extra income. Her rice has not grown well, so she can get lower yield than before. She has been involved her businesses for 25 years and she can save her daily income about 27,800 KHR per day.

For Sokun, this is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she fully paid back her past loans. She wisely used her past loans to improved her family with decent household supplies. She will manage her entire new loan portion to buy fertilizer, seed and organic pesticide to use on her rice farm to produce good yield. She hopes that she can increase her income more than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed and organic pesticide to use on her rice farm to produce good yield.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is widowed and has one child. He is a rice farmer. 

Stanley requested a loan from GDMPC, which he will use to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides. He knows that with this investment he will earn multiple returns. He plans to use his income to buy another farm and to improve the general living situation of his family and his child.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and planting materials to improve his rice farm.

location.town: Campo 4, Ramon MAgsaysay Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Than's Group

texts.en:
Than, 36, is living in a rural village of Kratie province and is a mother of four dependent kids. Than can earn income to support the family via growing cassava. Moreover, she grows rice and works for a labor fee to get additional income. She has been involved in her businesses for 18 years.

She can make an income of nearly 60,000 KHR per day. The crops have grown not well, so she must sell them a low price. Than has never been with VisionFund before, and this is the first time she has requested a Kiva loan.

As a group leader, she will manage her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and seeds to produce good yields. She hopes that this loan will help her to get more income to upgrade her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to produce good yields.

loans.name: Rasmani

texts.en:
Rasmani is a married woman of 29 years. She lives with her husband, Prafulya, and three children (a son and two daughters) at their own small house in a small village, Kalipur of Falakata. She and her husband both are illiterate and can sign their names only.

Rasmani’s husband has been engaged in agriculture for many years. He cultivates different crops and sells the gathered harvest in the local markets. After managing all the household work, Rasmani assists her husband in his agricultural work.

Now they are thinking of cultivating a crop which is profitable and in demand in all seasona. So they have decided to grow paddy (rice) on their farmland. Because of having inadequate capital, they need some financial help. So Rasmani has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other farm resources for paddy cultivation.

They hope it will be a lucrative business, as the crop has a tremendous demand in the market. It will greatly help this family to generate more income for the rest of the year. She dreams to expand their agribusiness by purchasing more farmland in the future with the outcome profit.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to buy good quality seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is a widow and mother of three children. She is able to feed her children through her income from a direct selling and retailing business. Fely is selling cosmetics products, underwear, and rice grain in her village. To increase her income, Fely is announcing in her village to offer her products to the most possible new custumers and to her regular customers. Fely wishes to earn bigger income and be able to provide enough for the needs of her children.

With this, she is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy lipstick, make-up, lotion and fragrances. She will also use the loan to buy rice grain to sell in their village. She hopes to attain her wish by availing the loan and use it appropriately for her business.

loans.use: to buy lipstick, make up, lotion and fragrances.

loans.name: Menaka

texts.en:
Twenty-nine-year-old Menaka is a rural woman of a small village, Barogharia in Dhupguri. A mother of two children (a daughter and a son), Menaka is a homemaker who looks after her family and manages all the household chores. Both of her children are students of different classes. Her husband runs a betel nut business to earn their livelihood.

Sampa, 10 years old, is a student of grade 5 in Uttar Boragari Junior Girls’ High School. She is an average student, but tries her level best to score well. So far she has studied alone, but now she needs the help of a private tutor to continue her education further. At present, her father’s business is not in a good position, and so she is deprived of getting adequate study materials and private tuition, as well.

Being a responsible mother, Menaka wants to provide her daughter with a good education, and so she seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to continue her daughter Sampa’s education further. She will purchase books and a school uniform and pay all the schooling fees of her daughter, Sampa, and also enroll her in a private coaching class.

She hopes this will enable her to support Sampa with her adequate educational equipment, which will allow her to go a step closer to her ambition of being an engineer in the future.

Menaka and Sampa (as seen in the photo) are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: to afford the grade 5 education costs of her daughter.

loans.name: Kerto Sato Group

texts.en:
The repayment for the Kerto Sato group is running smoothly. All the members attended the meeting and they made their payment to the staf of MUK. Ni Ketut sold her 2 pigs with weight 80 kg each and the price for 1 kg is 23.000 IDR. Ni Ketut earned 3.680.000 IDR in total and she used it for repayment and also to fullfill her family needs. In general, all member of Kerto Sato group earned a satisfactory result.

To expand the pig business and increasing population of piglets, the group agreed to continue their loan. Each of them received 1.500.000 IDR. Ni Ketut used her loan to purchase superior piglets, feed and renovate the pigpens. Now she has a sow and has plans to become a piglet seller. She hopes her plan will go well. All the profit will be save and used for capital.
2 members could not attend the meeting because of illness.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets, feed and renovate the pigpens.

loans.name: Berioska

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de zapatos,la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los zapatos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar zapatos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Berioska continues to run her business selling shoes. She is a very hard-working woman, who is helping her family get ahead with her earnings from the business. Her dream is to have a store from which to sell her shoes.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy shoes.

She is very happy to have been granted a loan, and pledges to meet all her payments.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Humorous Coastal Ladies - N03Mthọmlộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hiền is 45 years old and she is married with 4 children. She has operated a food stall selling fish for 6 years. Hiền lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this region often suffered by natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea.

The main hardship that Hiền faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to repair her fishing boat to catch more fish.
In 2014, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hiền has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

She is the group leader of the N03 Minh Thọ Minh Lộc, which consists of 5 members.
With her business profit, Hiền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat so as to catch more fish.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 55 years old and has eight children. Teresita is married woman.

Teresita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Teresita has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Conchita is 64 years old now.

Conchita has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Conchita has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Hilda is 43 years old and three of her children are in school.

Hilda has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and tools for abaca weaving.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Hilda has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and tools for abaca weaving

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy is a 40-year-old married woman with two children still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Remy has a personal products business in the Philippines. Remy has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products like body lotion, perfume, underwear, slippers, and shoes.

Remy has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more personal products like body lotion, perfume, underwear, slippers, and shoes.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Forty-four-year-old Rina lives in a small village named Dakshin Altagram of Dhupguri. She has three sons. Her husband is a mason by profession; his income is inconsistent. Rina faces difficulties to bear the educational as well as household costs of her family. Rina tries her best to provide uninterrupted education to her sons. Her all sons are go to school.

Her younger son, Rajib, is studying in grade 8 in Patkidaha Islamia High Madrasah. His half yearly exam is knocking at the door. Thus, he needs proper guidance and study materials to score good marks.

But Rina faces difficulties to bear all the educational expenses of her son with this low family income. Rina thought she should help her son Rajib so that he can do better in his upcoming examinations and pass grade 8 smoothly.

Hence, Rina is requesting a loan from BJS (a Kiva partner) to bear the educational expenses of her son. She plans to use the loan money to pay school and tuition fees, and buy necessary study materials for her son Rajib. The loan will help a bright boy to continue his education without any obstacles.

Rina and Rajib (in the photo) are happy and grateful to BJS and Kiva for their kind support.

loans.use: to pay for her son's educational expenses for grade 8.

loans.name: Sarim's Group

texts.en:
Sarim, 51, is a farmer living in a rural village of Steung Treng province and she has two dependent children. She has been growing cassava for 31 years as the main source of the family’s income. She can earn supplemental income by working for others for a fee. Her daily business earns her nearly 70,000KHR per day. The drought has affected her crops and is the problem for her business.

After successfully repaying the previous loan, Sarim will request the second loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) again. Her past loan helped her to improve the family’s living condition.

As a group leader of three, she will spend her loan portion on fertilizer and pesticide to grow good quality crops.

She hopes to sell it at a better price and get the ability to earn more income to upgrade her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to grow a good quality of crops.

location.town: Steung Treng Province, Sieam Bouk District

loans.name: Chhoeun's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in a rural village of Kampong Cham province, Chhoeun is a 54-year-old mother of two children. To make a living, Chhoeun sells grocery items and grows Pek Kouk (a kind of Khmer fruit) for sale. She has been in these businesses for 36 years. 

Her grocery business is decreasing because of fewer customers. She is able to earn about 57,000 KHR per day. 

She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one cycle already and has paid back her previous loan. The past loan helped her earn money for her family. She is now leading a group of two to apply for a new loan of 1,500,000 KHR, one third of which will go to her. 

She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer to boost her crop yields. She hopes that she can upgrade her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to boost her crop yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Salomat

texts.en:
Salomat is a careful mother. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1957. She is living in a village with her family. She is married and has two children. She is a tailor. She sews traditional Tajik women's dresses. She gets orders at home. Salmon has 25 years of experience making beautiful national dresses. She likes her activity and knows her job well.

Her son is sick. She is willing to treat him at a medical clinic.

She applied to IMON and KIVA asking for financial support to pay for medical services and medicines for her son at the hospital.

She hopes and awaits KIVA lenders' compassion and support.

loans.use: to pay for medical services and medicines for her son at the hospital.

loans.name: Anita Daysi

texts.es:
La socia Anita Daysi trabaja como profesora y tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de tarjetas de cumpleaños y matrimonios,,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las tarjetas de matrimonios y cumpleaños.La socia solicita el credito para comprar tarjetas de cumpleaños y matrimonios.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Anita Daysi is a teacher and also has a business selling birthday and wedding cards. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell birthday and wedding cards. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase birthday and wedding cards.

She is happy to receive the loan, and pledges to meet all her payments.

loans.use: to buy birthday and wedding cards.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 46 years old, and married with four school-aged children. Mercy's dream has been to own a motorcycle to run a transportation business. She was able to make her dream a reality through hard work and determination. 

She works with her husband who actively drives passengers and gets them to their destination safely. This business allows them to support the needs of their family. 

Recently, Mercy borrowed a loan to buy tires and finance the cost of renewing her husband's license. She hopes to sustain her family's daily needs and further improve their service capacity with the help of her husband.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires and finance the costs of licenses.

loans.name: We Need Your Help - N2Plongtlĩnh Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tứ is 42 years old and she is married with 3 children. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for 3 years. Tứ lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Tứ faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to build breeding facilities and purchase chicks to raise and sell in the future.

In 2013, Tứ joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Tứ has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the group leader of the N2PLongTLĩnh, which consists of 3 members.

With her business profit, Tứ hopes for her business to do well, to earn enough money to provide for her kids and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to build breeding facilities and purchase chicks to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 42 years old, and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal.

Marivic has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF. She has been running her business for 15 years and earns an income from a general store.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 56 years old and married with six children.

Isabel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like personal products, home products, and food items.

Isabel has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 39 years and also earns income from food vending.

Isabel aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like personal products, home products, and food items.

loans.name: Kanha

texts.en:
Kanha runs a furniture shop with husband living with 4 children in Ta Nguon Village. Running a shop, Kanha needs to get up early and stand in the shop till night time. Her family needs to consume a lot of energy everyday, which cost her a lot of money and time because she needs to spend on going to the charging station and charge the battery frequently.

Seeing the difficulty of using a car battery, Kanha decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a solar power home system. She believes this decision will improve her energy to run her business and also save on utility fees.

loans.use: to pay for a solar power home system.

location.town: Ta Nguon Village, Dar Commune, Chetr Borei village

loans.name: Agnes Nieves

texts.en:
Agnes Nieves is 42 years old and single. Agnes Nieves works very hard to provide for them.

Agnes Nieves runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Agnes Nieves has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Agnes Nieves would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins and pearls of various colors for her husband's embroidery business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing inventory in bulk for her husband's business.

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
Remegia works hard to support her family. Remegia is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Remegia has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Remegia would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Iroda

texts.en:
Iroda was born in the northern part of Tajikistan into a family of workers. She was interested in textile and tailoring, since her childhood. When she was grade 9th at school, she went to sewing classes. Now she is a graduator of secondary school and has plans to do business offering beautiful dresses to Tajik women.

But she had not money to buy the necessary items to sew. She appealed to IMON to get a help. IMON provided a three day training for startup clients, where she actively participated and was informed. She was satisfied with the new information and necessary knowledge. Now she is ready to start her business. She requested a loan to buy a sewing machine, textiles, threads, needles, etc. She is willing to achieve her goal and do efficient work.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, textiles, threads, needles, etc. and start a new business

loans.name: Luis Keylor

texts.es: Luis Keylor se desempeña en su propio taller en el cual fabrica diversos diseños de muebles y puertas de madera. Él solicita un préstamo de seiscientos mil colones (₡ 600 000), para la compra de una sierra de mesa con la cual podrá realizar de una forma más eficiente la elaboración de dichos muebles.
texts.en: Luis Keylor has his own workshop where he makes furniture and wooden doors. He is requesting a loan for six hundred thousand Costa Rican colones (₡ 600 000) in order to buy a table saw which will allow him to work more efficiently.

loans.use: buy a table saw.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
The air conditioning business is Ruel's main source of income. Managing employees is not an easy job since he needs to supervise and train them how to do their work to avoid injuries. 

His previous loan with Center for Community Transformation (CCT) helped his business a lot. He was able to buy the equipment he needed and to pay the salaries of his employees. 

Ruel’s dream is to travel around the world with his family. It might be impossible now, however he believes that God is preparing them for a blissful future. He has three children. One is in college and the other two are currently working and able to help their father financially. He is thankful for having a loving family and a stable job as well. However, Ruel still needs to have supplementary capital in order to run the business. He is thankful for having CCT as God’s extension of blessing. He applied for a Php 30,000 loan and plans to buy materials and tools for fixing air conditioners and to pay for the salary of his employees.

Ruel regularly meets with his co-fellowship members to share his life’s testimony and experience in the business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listening to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy equipment or tools for fixing air conditioners and pay the salary of his employees.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is 40 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and six children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for one year.

Shamshad's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories e.g. pieces of cloth, laces, needles and sewing machine accessories. But due to financial constraints her husband is not in suitable condition to buy these items for his business purpose. Therefore Shamshad has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount she will financially assist her husband to above these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that her husband can earn more profitable income.

On this financial assistance Shamshad is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: increase her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 45 years old and married with two children.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for five years and also earns income from food vending.

Jocelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home care product, and other groceries.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Eusebia, de 37 años de edad, está casada, tiene 2 hijos, los cuales están en la escuela, su esposo se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas y al negocio de ganado, ella depende de una familia humilde y desde pequeña se ha crecido trabajando en los cultivos de maíz y en la elaboración de petates.

Eusebia, vive en una zona en donde solo se dedican al cultivo y a la elaboración de petates, este es un trabajo único en el país, donde de una planta sacan las pencas y elaboran el petate.- Este tipo de trabajo se lo enseño su mamá desde que tenía 12 años de edad y desde entonces se dedica a este tipo de trabajo; para elaborar un petate se tarda un día completo, tiene que empezar desde las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 5:00 de la tarde y luego sale a venderlo en la zona y le pagan $5 por cada petate.

El dinero del crédito lo necesita para comprar material para elaborar petates (tule), pues es de ahí que mantiene a sus hijos.

Ella sueña con un futuro mejor para sus hijos, también sueña con una vivienda más grande y en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Eusebia is 37 years old and married. She has two children who go to school. Her husband works in agriculture and livestock commerce.

She comes from a humble family. Eusebia grew up working in the corn fields and making petate [matting]. She lives in a zone where they only engage in the cultivation and production of petate. This is unique work in the country, where leaves are taken from a type of palm to make this product.

She has been doing this work since she was 12, when her mother taught her. To make a mat takes her the whole day, she has to start at seven in the morning until five in the afternoon. She then goes out to sell in the area, and she gets $5 per petate.

She needs the loan to buy the material to make petate (tule). This work gives her the income to support her children. Eusebia dreams of a better future for her children, and she also dreams of a bigger home in better condition.

loans.use: to buy material to make petate (tule).

loans.name: Nirmala

texts.en:
Nirmala is a responsible mother of two children, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 15 years. Her husband needs to do maintenance of his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good and it requires more maintenance charges on daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Nirmala has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Nirmala's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn the profitable income. Nirmala also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.
Nirmala is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe es un productor de café en una comunidad de Jinotega, departamento de Nicaragua. Cuenta con una pequeña parcela de café de 1.05 hectárea la cual ha venido mejorando desde hace 10 años, junto a su esposa con quien tiene 4 hijos de 2 a 16 años. Además de cultivar café, cultiva granos básicos para el consumo de su hogar. 

Para garantizar las actividades de mantenimiento de su café este ciclo, él está solicitando un financiamiento que le permita asegurar la compra de insumos y fertilizantes que se requieren para asegurar una buena cosecha, la cual proyecta sea de unos 35 quintales de café pergamino. 

Guadalupe dice que este rubro es rentable y que la inestabilidad del mercado se puede enfrentar con los precios mínimos que ofrece el mercado Fairtrade, por lo que su objetivo es incrementar su producción y con ellos sus ingresos a fin de ir aumentando el área de su pequeña finca, y con ello mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a coffee grower in the community of Jinotega, department of Nicaragua. He has a small coffee parcel, measuring 1.05 hectares which he has been improving for 10 years with his wife, with whom he has 4 children, aged 2 to 16. In addition to growing coffee, he grows basic grains for household consumption.

In order to guarantee the maintenance activities for his crop this cycle, he is asking for a loan that will allow him to ensure the purchase of materials and fertilizer required to ensure a good harvest. He projects about 35 quintals of parchment coffee.

Guadalupe says that this work is profitable and that the instability of the market can be faced with minimum prices offered by the Fairtrade market, so his goal is to increase his production and with them, his income. His aim is to increase the area of his small farm, and therefore his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy materials and fertilizer to apply to his coffee to ensure a good harvest.

loans.name: Simeon

texts.es:
Simeón es un productor de café de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en su pequeña finca de  1.4 hectáreas, en las que produce café bajo los criterios de certificación Fairtrade. 

En los últimos años, este productor ha logrado una cosecha de aproximadamente 46 quintales de café pergamino, lo cual para este año ha tomado como un reto, proponiéndose incrementar este rendimiento productivo y alcanzar una cosecha de al menos 60 quintales. Para esto, Simeón  está solicitando un financiamiento que le permita la compra de insumos y fertilizantes, lo cual contribuirá a asegurar la demanda nutricional de su plantación. Esta inversión se sumará al esfuerzo y trabajo que él y su familia vienen realizando en su finca para alcanzar mayores resultados y de esa forma mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
Simeón is a coffee grower in northern Nicaragua. He lives with his wife and their two children on their small 2.5 hectare farm. He grows coffee according to the Fairtrade criteria.

In the last few years, this grower has achieved a harvest of approximately 46 quintals of parchment coffee. This year, he has taken that as a challenge, setting a goal of increasing this performance and reaching a harvest of at least 60 quintals. To do this, Simeón is asking for a loan that will allow him to buy materials and fertilizer. This will contribute to ensuring the nutritional demand of his farm. This investment will be added to the effort and work that he and his family have been doing on the farm to reach better results and in this way improve their financial condition.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials for his coffee farm.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La socia Maria Isabel se sigue dedicando al negocio de salon de belleza,la socia es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de salon de belleza.La socia solicita le credito para comprar tintes y tijeras.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel continues working at her beauty salon business. She is a very hard-working woman, who helps her family get ahead with her earnings from the business. Her dream is to be able to expand her business.

She is very happy to receive this loan, and pledges to meet her repayments.

loans.use: buy hair dyes and scissors.

loans.name: Hoàn

texts.en:
Mrs Hoàn is 35 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall selling fish for more than 7 years. Hoàn lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the income from this job is unstable because if the weather condition is not good, catching and selling fish will become more difficult.

One of the most critical difficulties is that her latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

This is Hoàn first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could hep her improve her family life standards.
With her business profit, Hoàn hopes her family to be healthy and happy and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is married and has three children to support. Marivic has for many years owned and operated a transport service to earn a living and support his family's daily needs. He also has to send his children to school. 

Recently, he took a loan to cover the cost of repainting and repairing the motor of the motorcycle used for his transportation business. He plans to buy a sidecar for his motorcycle to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc..

Analyn has been in this business for 2 years. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future Analyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell

loans.name: Hen

texts.en:
Hen, a farmer, lives with his wife and child in Damnak Sasar, a village that is far from the power grid. Beside farming, Hen brews wine to earn extra money for his family. As a farmer and also businessman, Hen wants to expand his business with 11 hectares of land and make his family living in a comfortable condition.

However,his house has no reliable energy source. He has to go to charge a car battery every 2 or 3 days for daily usage. Sometime because of busyness he doesn’t have time to charge the battery and the whole family is in pitch black condition for the whole day. He is applying for a Kiva loan to buy high quality home solar energy. After using solar home energy, he believes his family condition will be better and safer. He also can save time and money on utilities.

loans.use: to pay for a solar power home system.

location.town: Damnak Sasar Village, Thma Andoeurk Commune, Chetr

loans.name: Zarqa

texts.en:
Zarqa is 36 years old woman, and mother of 3 children and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a food stall, her husband sells different types of eatable items e.g samosa, vegetable rolls, chicken tikka, Kabab paratha etc.

Zarqa's husband needs to purchase different types of eatables and other items for his business purpose. so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position her husband is not in condition to purchase these items for his business purpose.

Therefore Zarqa has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purpose.
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's food stall business.

loans.name: Norsita

texts.en:
Norsita is 45 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like sacks of rice, shampoo, sugar, salt, oil, soft drinks groceries, etc. to sell.

Norsita has been in this business for 10 years.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like sacks of rice, shampoo, sugar, salt, oil, softdrinks groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Turiza

texts.en:
Turiza is a responsible mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been a taxi driver for eight years. He is responsible for supporting the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to make repairs to his taxi, but currently lacks the funds to pay for the repairs. Therefore Turiza has applied for a loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Turiza's husband can easily afford the maintenance costs. And then he will be able to provide a better ride and earn a profitable income. Turiza plans to save with profits to meet her family's needs in the future.

Turiza is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Elbe

texts.en:
Elbe is a married woman, 27 years old with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Elbe has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Elbe requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials such as cloth,thread and needles and other materials.

Elbe has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials such as cloth,thread and needles and other materials

loans.name: Violango

texts.en:
Violango has been operating her beach cottage for four years. She earns enough to support her family and has repaid her previous loan. Aside from this business, her sari-sari store also is operating. 

Violango used a previous loan to buy additional wood. She joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to enable her to engage in business activities. Recently, Violango took a new loan to purchase bamboo to repair her cottage. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to cover the maintenance and repair of her beach cottage.

loans.name: Always Keep The Faith - N2T6Qtrungbsơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Sang is 50 years old and she is married with 2 children. She has worked in agriculture planting fruit trees for more than 10 years. Sang lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Sang faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and seedlings to raise and be able to sell good fruit in the future.

In 2014, Sang joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Sang has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

She is the group leader of the N2T6QTrungBSơn, which consists of 4 members. With her business profit, Sang hopes to build a new house, to maintain a successful business and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings to raise and then sell the fruit in the future.

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
Pinky is 41 years old with one child in school, Pinky works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a prepaid mobile load in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional load to sell.

Pinky has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future Pinky would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional load to sell

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transportation services by driving a taxi for ten years. Her husband is responsible for supporting her entire family. He needs to make repairs to his taxi because its currently not in good shape. He has been unable to make the repairs due to insufficient funds. Razia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Razia's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide better transportation services to earn a profitable income. Razia also plans to save the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Razia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the repairs to her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a printer and toner.

loans.name: Ada Luz

texts.es:
Ada Luz es una pequeña productora de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Se dedica principalmente a la caficultura, con lo cual ha sacado adelante a sus 4 hijos de 7 a 17 años. Desde hace 8 años ella  está a cargo de su pequeña finca de 0.52 hectáreas, la cual ha venido mejorando y maneja bajo los criterios de certificación de Fairtrade, UTZ y C.A.F.E Practices.

La producción promedio de café que ha obtenido en los últimos tres años es de 21 quintales de café pergamino. El mayor desafío que ha enfrentado en la producción de café, es la presencia de plagas y enfermedades, lo cual está segura logrará mantener bajo control con un plan de fertilización adecuado. Por tal razón, está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes que le permitirá darle un adecuado mantenimiento a sus plantaciones. 

Su meta es continuar mejorando su finca bajo un plan de manejo integrado que le permita continuar invirtiendo gradualmente en el desarrollo y diversificación de su finca, lo cual está segura logrará con una buena toma de decisiones y su dedicación al trabajo para poder seguir sosteniendo a su familia.
texts.en:
Ada Luz is a small farmer in northern Nicaragua. She mainly grows coffee, and with it she has gotten her 4 children ahead, aged 7 to 17. For 8 years, she has been in charge of her small, 0.52 hectare farm, which she has been improving and managing according to criteria for the certificate for Fairtrade, UTZ and C.A.F.E Practices.

The average yield of coffee that she has obtained in the last three years has been 21 quintals of parchment coffee. The biggest challenge that her coffee crop has faced is the presence of pests and disease. She is sure she will be able to keep it under control with an adequate fertilization plan. For that reason, she is asking for a loan to buy materials and fertilizer, which will allow her to give sufficient maintenance to her crops.

Her goal is to continue improving her farm under an integrates management plan, which will allow her to continue gradually improving the development and diversification of her farm. With this, she is sure she will achieve good decision making and her dedication to her work to be able to keep supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy materials and fertilizer to help have a better coffee harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her vegetables.

loans.name: Golden Pigs - N01T9Qhải Group

texts.en:
Mrs Trần is 49 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising pigs for more than 10 years. Trần lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the income from this job is unstable because when some diseases happen on her pigs, she has nothing to sell and she will be in trouble with finance.

The main hardship that Trần faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell them in the future.

In 2013, Trần joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Trần has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the leader of N01T9QHải, which consists 5 members.

With her business profit, Trần hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Availing loans has been a typical practice for small business entrepreneurs like Adelaida. You can never improve your business without getting into credits, unless you have enough capital or investments. Adelaida paid all her loans availed through CCT and she is very much confident to apply for new ones.

She would now like to request for PHP 30,000 worth of loan. Just as she did with her previous loans, she will buy assorted grocery items to increase her income from her sari-sari store. She believes that you will never fail her request. Once she gets the assistance, she assures that she will repay you in due time.

Adelaida aims to send her youngest child to the best schools that would give him quality education. She dreams of business expansion and continuously flourishing profit. She is an active community partner of C.C.T. She meets with her fellowship* group every Wednesday.

*All C.C.T. community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to provide stocks of grocery items for her store in large quantities

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden works hard to support her family. Eden has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets and gasoline.

Eden has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Eden would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets and gasoline

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky supports her family through her general store in the Philippines.

The accompanying photo shows Vicky with her daughter, Honey Grace, who is 18 years old and the second of four children in the family.

Vicky is borrowing 8,300 PHP to pay the tuition fees of Honey Grace who is studying for Bachelor of Science in Hotel and Restaurant Management. Honey Grace is currently in her second year of this four-year course. 

When she graduates, Honey Grace plans to be a chef and help her mother send her younger siblings to finish college as well.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Thol, an 50 years old man, earns a living by farming in Khnorng Pos village. Spending day and time rising 2 children, now he has no burden anymore because his 2 children have jobs and build their own family. He wants to have a comfortable life. Currently he is still keeping on farming and brews wine during his free time. Thol has difficulty in using a battery for home energy. He needs to recharge the battery every week.

Seeing the difficulty of using a car battery, Thol decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy solar home energy. He believes solar home energy can enhance his living lifestyle in a comfortable condition.

loans.use: to pay for a solar power home system.

location.town: Khnorng Pos Village, Dar Commune,Chetr Borei Distr

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 42 and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children; three of them sit idle at home.

Her husband has been running a restaurant for many years and handling the financial condition of his house. This restaurant has been supporting his whole family for many years. Nowadays, he wants to offer more menus to his valuable customers, so that he can grow his income.

Shamim is requesting a loan for the restaurant establishment. Her husband wants to buy chicken, beef, pulses, bread, butter, yogurt, etc. She is hopeful that this loan would be the cause to generate more profit and savings, as well.

SHAMIM thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.
