loans.use: to buy chicken, beef, pulses, bread, butter, yogurt, etc. for her husband's restaurant.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Yolanda is 56 years old and has one child still in school.

Yolanda has a Ice cream making business in the Philippines. Yolanda requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for ice cream making like milk, cream, sugar and other materials for her food production business.

Yolanda has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for ice cream making, like milk, cream, sugar and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 37 years old, married, and has one child who attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She operates a water vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. 

Flora requested a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more containers of water to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase containers of water to sell

loans.name: Freddy Antonio

texts.es:
Freddy es un productor de café del departamento de Jinotega, Nicaragua. Posee una finca de 4.2 hectáreas, de las cuales 2.1 son de café. Tiene más de 12 años de estar trabajando su pequeña finca, la cual ha ido mejorando. La meta de este pequeño productor es incrementar el rendimiento productivo del área de café con que cuenta actualmente, lo cual se propone realizar con la implementación de un plan de manejo integral en su finca.

Para este ciclo de café, Freddy está solicitando un financiamiento para garantizar el suministro de insumos y fertilizantes que requieren sus plantaciones, lo cual realizará con el acompañamiento técnico de la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria a la cual pertenece. Confía en que su dedicación al trabajo y la disponibilidad de estos recursos le permitirán pasar en este ciclo de 40 a 60 quintales de café pergamino, lo cual le permitirá mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en: Freddie is a coffee producer in Nicaragua's Jinotega province. He has a 4.2 acre plantation, on 2.1 acres of which he grows coffee. He has worked his small plot for 12 years and it has gone from strength to strength. His ambition is to grow more coffee on his plot than he does currently and, to do this, he plans to employ an integral management plan on his plantation. For this coffee crop, Freddy is seeking funding to ensure that he can obtain the supplies and fertiliser needed for his plantations; he will do this with technical assistance from the Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria association, of which he is a member. He is confident that his dedication to his work, and having these resources available, will enable him to increase his yield from 40 to 60 quintals of parchment coffee, which will then make it possible for him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy the agricultural supplies he needs for his coffee plantation and to ensure a good harvest

loans.name: Umida

texts.en:
Umida was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1974. She is married and has three children. She has two years of practice sewing traditional women dresses. She participated at “Women entrepreneur – achieve success” training. She made her business plan and is ready to start her business. She is planning to develop her tailoring service and also do traditonal baking for sale. She is asking a loan to buy an oven and also a complex sewing machine.

She hopes Kiva lenders will support her and she can start her business.

loans.use: to buy an oven and also a complex sewing machine.

loans.name: Saily

texts.en:
Her name is Saily, aged 45, from the province of Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Zaldy, a driver and has two children of which one is in College and the other one is still in the elementary level. Her husband's salary as a driver is barely enough to meet the family's growing needs  which led Saily to go into food vending business.

Saily has been into food business for three years already. She buys several packs of "chicharon" (deep and crispy fried chicken and pork skin) and biscuits from wholesalers. "Chicharon" is so flavorful that it is a favorite snacks of Filipinos. She also started selling frozen foods like marinated pork and beef and hot dogs to augment her income which helps cover their daily sustenance and school needs of her children.

To help her expand her business, she is humbly asking for a Php 20000 loan which she will use to buy large quantities of "chicharon" packs, biscuits and frozen foods to sell. Saily is more than glad that aside from her regular customers she has increased advanced orders from her neighboring community.

Just like most mothers Saily for her business to grow so she could send her children to good schools in College. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for several packs of "chicharon", biscuits and frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Pia

texts.en:
Pia is a 46-year-old member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT). She is from the Muntinlupa branch and is married to Larry. Together, they are engaged in a computer rental business and variety store business. They usually generate a Php 9,000 monthly income from the computer shop. Their variety store or "sari-sari" store, on the other hand, offers cheap items. Basically, sari-sari stores can be found in every town and city. Products here are cheap, since for only P1.00 you can buy a piece of candy or sweet, compared to supermarkets where most products are sold wholesale. You  can even buy a sachet of shampoo, powdered drink or other small item. They earn approximately Php 20,000 each month from the variety store.

Managing more than one business is enjoyable for Pia since she and her husband work together to make a living. They have children to raise; one in high school and the other one in grade school. Pia wants to take advantage of the seminars and lectures for aspiring entrepreneurs that CCT provides. She decided to apply for a loan of Php 18,000 to add grocery items to her variety store and upgrade/repair each of her computers. She also wants to thank lenders for helping entrepreneurs like her. She is hopeful that you will consider her story. 

Pia believes that if you want success to come, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending a weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gains spiritual strength from members' life changing testimonies, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays micro finance loans and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to upgrade and repair the computers and to add grocery items for her variety store.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elna works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell charcoal.  Elna is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Elna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 48 years old, married and has four children.

Juvy is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Juvy requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Juvy has been in this business for 18 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Rubia Dolores

texts.es:
Rubia, de 49 años de edad, dejó de estudiar porque desde muy pequeña se dedicó a vender tamales, yuca, pasteles de carne y enchiladas con su madre, porque eran de escasos recursos económicos, se casó cuando tenía 20 años y procrearon tres hijos, el mayor de ellos está casado, su hija estudia segundo grado y su hijo tercer grado, su esposo es promotor en una unidad de salud.

Rubia, es una persona muy trabajadora, se dedica a vender en el cafetín de la escuela, donde vende productos saludables como refrescos naturales, frutas, pupusas, chilaquilas, todo lo realiza desde hace 5  años y con sus ventas aporta a los ingresos de su casa, para dar a su familia lo necesario; además durante los días que no hay clases, ella se dedica a confeccionar ropa, porque tiene una maquina con la cual generar ingresos extras.

Rubia, necesita el crédito para harina, quesillo, tela para hacer trajes, manteles para mesa, cortinas e hilo de esa manera tener mejores ingresos para seguir trabajando y luchando para darle a su familia lo necesario.

Rubia, sueña con ampliar más su negocio y hacerle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rubia, aged 49, stopped her education because she helped her mother sell tamales, yuca, meat pies and enchiladas from an early age, as her family had very limited financial resources. She got married when she was 20 years old, and had three children, the eldest of whom is married. Her daughter is in second grade and her son is in third grade. Her husband is a representative for a health clinic.

Rubia is very hard-working, and for the last five years has worked in the school cafeteria selling healthy products such as natural drinks, fruit, pupusas and chilaquilas (filled tortillas). With her earnings, she is able to help out with household necessities. When there is no school, she makes clothing, as she has a sewing-machine, and is able to make extra money in this way.

Rubia is requesting the loan to buy flour, cottage cheese, and fabric and thread to make clothing, tablecloths, and curtains. She hopes in this way to improve her earnings and continue working and being able to provide for her family.

Rubia dreams of expanding her business, and making improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy flour, cottage cheese, and fabric and thread for making clothing, tablecloths, and curtains.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 55 años de edad, y junto a su esposa se dedica a la producción de café en su pequeña finca ubicada al norte de Nicaragua. Esta actividad la realiza con el soporte de los técnicos de la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC), a fin de lograr mejores resultados en la calidad y obtener mejor precio de su cosecha, para aumentar los ingresos económicos de su familia. 

Para este ciclo productivo, él está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes y abonos que requiere su plantación de café, y continuar incrementando la productividad de su finca que es una de sus metas.
texts.en: 55-year-old Pedro and his wife both grow coffee on their small plantation in the north of Nicaragua. They do this with the support of technicians from the Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC) association, which helps them produce better quality coffee, get better prices for it and boost the family's income. For this season, he is seeking a loan to buy the fertiliser and manure needed for his coffee plantation and to continue increasing his plantation's productivity, which is one of his ambitions.

loans.use: to buy the fertiliser and manure needed for his coffee plantation

loans.name: Babangida

texts.en:
Babangida is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Rika Village. Babangida joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Babangida suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to repair his house or move into a bigger home.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Babangida will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Babangida now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Rafiki Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising hand the photo is Zipora, a member of Rafiki Self help group. She is thirty three years old, married and a mother of three. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014.

She does dairy farming and poultry keeping as his main business. She has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) training on enterprise and record keeping that has enabled her to manage her business well. She is borrowing from Kiva to purchase quality dairy and chicken feeds that will consequently increase her productions and income. This will assist her to cater for the family needs such as food, medicine and in paying school fees for her children.
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy quality dairy and chicken feeds that will increase production and thus more income.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Vanna is 35 years old living in Takeo province and she has three children. Rice farming is the main source of income for 10 years. Moreover, she has a small music band to play in some ceremonies and wedding party to get a fee to earn supplement income. These days, she can earn income around 48,000KHR per day and she is able to save only 10,000KHR each day.

Due to drought, her crop did not grow well and lackof working capital, these cause her to apply for a new Kiva loan. This is Vanna’s third loan cycle via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she will seek for the amount 3,400,000KHR and the past loans, which enabled her to improve her living standard, were repaid successfully.

Vanna will use her loan to buy pesticide, seed and fertilizer for her crop to grow well. She hopes to earn more income to support her family living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pesticide, seed and fertilizer for her crop to grow well.

loans.name: Lenita

texts.en:
Lenita is a 45-year-old woman from Maribojoc, Bohol. She is married with two children. She and her husband work together to earn a living by doing photo framing. They have been doing this for 12 years.

Lenita is asking a loan of PHP3000 to buy materials in framing such as glass, plywood and matting board. In the future, she dreams to be successful in her business to have a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy glass, plywood and matting board

loans.name: Good Wood, Good Guys - N03T8Đminhđsơn. Group

texts.en:
Thắng is 26 years old and he is single with no children. Mr. Thắng has a manufacturing business making wood furniture. Thắng has been involved in this business for 5 years.

The main hardship that Thắng faces is lack of capital. He is requesting a loan to purchase more timber to resell and for woodworking.

In 2014, Thắng joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve his business. Thắng has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. Thắng is the group leader of the N03T8ĐMinhĐSơn, which consists of 3 members.

With his business profit, Thắng hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, to improve his business and life standard and to remodel his house.

loans.use: to purchase more timber to resell and for woodworking.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jean works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jean is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Jolita

texts.en:
Jolita works hard to support her family. Jolita is married and has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Jolita has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Jolita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Pazilat

texts.ru: Пазилат, 58 лет, замужем, воспитывают 2 детей. У нее среднее образование и хороший сельскохозяйственный бизнес. В хозяйстве есть 3 овцы, на 0,45 Га земли выращивает картофель. Ежемесячная прибыль - 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Пазилат обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) для покупки коровы на увеличение поголовья. Доходы от кредита Пазилат планирует вложить в постройку большого дома для семьи.
texts.en: Pazilat is 58 years old, married, and raising two children. She has a secondary education, and she has a good agricultural business. She has three sheep, and she grows potatoes on 0.45 hectares of land. Her monthly income is 13,000 som (KGS). In order to increase and expand her business further, Pazilat has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 65,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow to increase her herd. Pazilat plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in building a big house for her family.

loans.use: to buy a cow in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 27 years old married woman. She lives in Batumi with her husband and 2 children. Tamar has been working in Turkey as a sales lady at a local clothes shop. She is very experienced in this field and decided to start trade clothes from Turkey to Batumi.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 900 USD. With the received credit she will purchase a stock of clothes and will resell in Batumi to generate income. Tamar hopes that the business will be profitable and awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trading clothes imported from Turkey to provide an income for her family

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
Bernardo es un pequeño cafetalero de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Con 61 años de edad, es un productor apasionado por lo que hace. Junto su esposa, y dos hijos, trabaja su pequeña finca para mejorar sus condiciones de vida. 

La actividad agrícola a la que se dedica fue herencia de su padre, y es algo que está duplicando para con sus hijos, enseñándoles el amor y entrega a la caficultura. En los tres últimos ciclos, ha logrado mantener una cosecha con calidad y volumen estable, esto a pesar del ataque de la plaga que atacó a Centroamérica llamada “Roya”; la cual es considerada una de las enfermedades de plantas más devastadoras. 

Para mantener el buen desarrollo de su producción, Bernardo está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas que le ayuden a mejorar la nutrición de sus plantas, lo cual le permitirá conseguir resultados que impactarán positivamente en su familia.
texts.en:
Bernardo is a small coffee farmer from northern Nicaragua. He is 61 years old and passionate about what he does. Together with his wife and two children he is working on his little farm to improve their living conditions.

He inherited the trade of farming from his father and he is passing it on to his children by showing them love and devotion for growing coffee.

In the last three seasons, he managed to maintain a crop of stable quality and volume, despite being hit by the "roya" plague [coffee leaf rust], which circulates in Central America and is considered on of the most devastating plant diseases.

To maintain the great development of his production, Bernardo is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies, which will help him to improve his plants' nutrition, which will allow him to get results that positively impact in his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to use on his coffee farm.

loans.name: Arlen Felipe

texts.es:
Arlen es un joven productor con 29 años de edad y caficultor desde hace 5 años. Desde pequeño ha estado relacionado a las actividades agrícolas, siendo su sueño contar con una finca productiva y sostenible. 

Para lograrlo, él ha venido trabajando en el cumplimiento de recomendaciones técnicas que le brinda el equipo técnico de la asociación a la cual está afiliado, logrando en el último año incrementar en un 20% su producción de café.

Para continuar mejorando la productividad de su finca, Arlen está solicitando un financiamiento para comprar los insumos que requiere su cafetal y lograr mejores resultados este nuevo ciclo, con lo cual logrará también darle mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Arlen is a young 29-year-old coffee producer. He has done this activity for 5 years. Since he was a little kid he has been involved in some kind of agricultural activity.

His dream is to have a productive and sustainable farm. In order to make that happen, he has been working in the execution of the technical recommendations that the technical team of the association to which he is affiliated to has given him. Thanks to these recommendations, in the last year he has increased his coffee production in a 20 percent.

With the purpose of continuing with the improvement of his farm productivity, Arlen is requesting a loan to buy supplies for his coffee crops and with this have better results in this new cycle. This will help him to give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to apply on his coffee crops.

loans.name: Gye-Nyame Group

texts.en:
The group Gye-nyame is loan group and will begin its first loan cycle with ID-Ghana, as part of Teshie-branch loan system. It is made up of five members and is represented by Augustina. The businesses which the members of the loan group carry out are varied and among them are cassava and corn dough, beans, sweet potato, palm oil, plantain, gari (cassava flour).

The loan that they are getting will help the small business owners of whom Augustina is one. She says that a year ago, she joined ID-Ghana, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Now, she has a business baking bread and pastries and is also into cake decoration. She comments that she learned her business from her mother.

The loan that she is now getting out is to increase her capital to purchase flour, margarine, cooking oil, yeast, flavor and nut milk from the wholesalers to bake bread and pastries which she will later sell in her sales location. This manner of working allows her to get resources to support her family economically since she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she says that she likes business and nutrition training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase flour, margarine, cooking oil, yeast, flavor and nut milk from the wholesalers to bake bread and pastries.

loans.name: Good Loan, Good Chance - N05T9Qhải Group

texts.en:
Mrs Khanh is 38 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall selling fish for more than 10 years. Khanh lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this job is unstable because the amount of fishes they catch belong to the weather conditions.

The main hardship that Khanh faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell at the market.

This is Khanh first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could improve her life standard. She is the group leader of N05T9QHải, which consists of 3 members.

With her business profit, Khanh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy and to have enough money for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell at the market

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes fish to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes fish to sell

loans.name: Francisca De Jesús

texts.es:
Francisca, de 46 años de edad, está acompañada, su compañero de vida le ayuda en el cuido de los pollos de engorde y las reces que poseen, porque esa es la actividad económica a la que se dedican, ella solo estudio hasta cuarto grado, ya que sus padres desde niña la pusieron a trabajar cortando algodón y arroz; tiene 3 hijos, pero todos son independientes y solo vive con su mamá. 

Francisca, trabaja como empelada doméstica desde hace 6 años, también se dedica a criar pollos de engorde y ganado desde hace 15 años, este oficio lo aprendió por la misma necesidad de sobrevivir junto a su familia; para ir a su trabajo tiene que caminar a pie diez minutos, para esperar el auto-bus que la lleva a la ciudad, en donde trabaja desde las 7:00 de la mañana a las 5:00 de la tarde, todos los días.

Francisca, está solicitando el préstamo para comprar 3 novillas de engorde en repasto, las cuales pastoreara durante varios meses, para luego venderlas y obtener así alguna ganancia, para la alimentación de su familia.

Francisca, sueña con hacer más grande su casa, para que su familia viva más cómoda.
texts.en: With the help of her husband, 46-year-old Francisca looks after the chickens for fattening and the cows which they own as this is the business they run. She only had four years' education at school because, from a young age, her parents needed her to work picking cotton and rice. Her 3 children have now left home and so she lives alone with her mother. Francisca has worked as housemaid for 6 years and has also raised chickens for fattening and livestock for 15 years, a job which she learned because of her need to ensure that she and her family get by. To et to work, she walks for ten minutes and gets the bus into town, where she works from 7am to 5pm every day. Francisca is seeking the loan to buy 3 heifers for fattening. She will allow them to graze for a  few months and then sell them to earn an income with which to support her family. Francisca dreams of being able to extend her home so that her family can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy 3 heifers for fattening in the pastures.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 54 years old and married with one child in school, Meriam works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell bamboo in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of bamboo to sell.

Meriam has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future Meriam would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of bamboo to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine, 38, is a married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. For two years, Josephine has had a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 6000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan es un pequeño productor de café que se dedica a la caficultura desde hace más de 15 años. Su finca la maneja bajo los criterios de certificación de comercio justo, UTZ y C.A.F.E Practices. 

Para mantener las certificaciones y mejorar día a día, Juan ha diseñado un plan de mejora nutricional para sus plantas, para ello está solicitando un financiamiento con el que adquirirá abonos y fertilizantes necesarios para cumplir con su meta. La aplicación oportuna de estos insumos le ayudarán a tener una buena cosecha en este ciclo productivo y con ello mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is a small producer of coffee who has been growing coffee for more than 15 years. He manages his farm according to the various criteria of Free Trade, UTZ and CAFE Certification.

In order to keep his certifications and to improve day by day Juan has designed a plan of improving the nutrition for his plants. So he is requesting financing which he will use to acquire manure and fertilizer needed to achieve his goal. The timely application of these inputs will help him have a good harvest in this production cycle and with it greater income for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer needed for his coffee crops to assure a good harvest.

loans.name: Favio Alexander

texts.es:
Favio es un emprendedor visionario, dedicado a las actividades agrícolas. En su pequeña finca, además de café, también se dedica a la siembra y cosecha de frijol y maíz; logrando diversificar su propiedad para aprovechar los recursos. 

Para el nuevo ciclo, él ha decidido implementar un plan para mejorar la nutrición de sus cafetos, por lo que, solicita el financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas que le ayudarán a incrementar la producción agrícola, lo cual es una de sus metas a fin de mejoras las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Favio is a visionary entrepreneur dedicated to agriculture activities. On his small farm, besides coffee, he also plants and harvests beans and corn, managing to diversify his property to take advantage of his resources.

For the new season he has decided to implement a plan to improve the nutrition of his coffee plants. So he is requesting the financing to buy agricultural inputs which will help him increase his agricultural production which is one of the goals with the aim of improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to apply to his coffee crops.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a married man. He describes himself to be innovative. He operates a retail business where he sells mobile phones, flash drives, and memory cards . He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a competitive place, and his primary customers are locals. He will use the 90,000 KES loan to buy more phones and flash drives to sell. This will enable him have more inventory, which will increase his sales and profits. His business goal is to operate a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future he will expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more phones and flash drives.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man. He has one child and describes himself to be innovative. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes, clothes, and bags. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a competitive place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. He will use the Kes 95,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes and bags. His business goal is to open other business outlets within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes and bags.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie works hard to support her family. She is married and has been in the fishing business for seven years in the Philippines. She requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net and other fishing equipment. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 48 years old and has four children who are in school.

Judith has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy gasoline and other supplies to use in her business.

Judith has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and other supplies to use in her business

loans.name: Saron's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in a rural village of Battambang province, Saron is 28 years old and a mother of two dependent children who are in school. She can earn income to support her living standard via selling grocery items and she has been in this job for 7 years. To make additional income, she is growing rice for sale.

Lack of working capital to support her rice farming is the main challenge for her business. She is now leading a group of two members to take a new loan and this will be her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).

As a group leader for this new loan, she will manage her loan portion to buy fertilizer, seed and pay her worker fees for supporting her farmland to produce good yields. She hopes to earn more income to enhance the family living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed and pay workers fees for supporting her farmland to produce good yields.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 30 years old and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and four children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 3 years.

Rukhsana's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories e.g. pieces of cloth, laces, needles and sewing machine accessories. But due to financial constraints her husband is not in suitable condition to buy above these items for his business purpose.

Therefore Rukhsana has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount she will financially assist her husband to above these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that her husband can earn a more profitable income.
On this financial assistance Rukhsana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a 21-year old Palestinian entrepreneur who lives in Ramallah, where unemployment is very high. She decided to start her own business buying cosmetics in bulk to resell to friends, neighbors and acquaintances.

Hiba chose Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to take a USD loan that will enable her to buy makeup and cosmetics to sell. She dreams to be a professional and have her own business, help her family and serve her country

loans.use: to buy a cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Siony

texts.en:
Siony is 24 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school. Siony works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, milk, etc.

Siony has been in this business for five years. In the future Siony would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, milk, etc.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 48-year-old mother of eight children, two in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Susana has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Susana requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell .

Susana has been in this business for one year. In the future, Susana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Ana Lilian

texts.es:
Ana, de 54 años de edad, no estudio, porque sus padres la dedicaron al trabajo agrícola desde niña, porque la situación de pobreza en que vivían era muy grave; ahora está casada, su esposo le ayuda en sus cultivos de maíz y yuca, tiene 3 hijos y todos se dedican a trabajar en sus cultivos.

Ana, tiene gran experiencia en el cultivo de maíz y yuca, porque desde niña siempre a trabajado en esas actividades, este trabajo lo aprendió por la misma necesidad de sobrevivir, ya que no tiene ninguna oportunidad de tener un empleo formal; ella se levanta todos los días a las 5:00 de la mañana, camina un kilómetro hasta llegar a su cultivo, permanecen todo el día haciendo labores de limpieza, controlando plagas y regando sus sembradíos y a las 4:00 de la tarde regresan a casa a hacer los oficios del hogar y otras actividades.

Ana, solicita el crédito para perforar un pozo, que le servirá para regar 42,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y yuca, porque la época lluviosa está terminando y no ha llovido; ellos esperan que con este pozo sus cosechas estarán seguras y podrá alimentar a su familia y el resto de los granos los podrá vender a los vecinos y en el mercado local.

Ana, sueña con hacer más grande su casa, para que su familia tenga más comodidad y privacidad.
texts.en:
Ana is 54 years old. She did not study as her parents had her working in agriculture since she was a child. The poverty they lives in was very serious. Now she is married and her husband helps her with her corn and yucca crops. She has three children who also work in her crops.

Ana has great experience in growing yucca and corn because as a child she always worked with these. She had to learn this work from the simple need to survive as she had no opportunity of having formal employment. She gets up every day at 5 in the morning and walks a kilometer to get to her crops. She spends all day there doing cleaning, pest control and watering her plants until 4 in the afternoon when she returns home to do housework and other things.

Ana is requesting the loan to drill a well which will serve to irrigate her 42,000 square meters of corn and yucca sine the rainy season is over and it has not rained. She hopes that with this well her harvests will be protected and she can feed her family. The rest of the grains she will sell to her neighbors and on the local market.

Ana dreams of making her house bigger so that her family has more comfort and privacy.

loans.use: to drill a well.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a married mother of three children. She describes herself as focused. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour, milk, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds to buy more stock. Rosemary will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more maize, wheat flour, soap, sugar, cooking oil and other items. Her business goal is to have more business outlets within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more maize, wheat flour, soap, sugar, cooking oil and other items

loans.name: Denys Carolina

texts.es: Denys de 28 años es una microempresaria que asumió la administración del almacén misceláneo de su padre, heredado hace siete años tras su fallecimiento; bajo estas circunstancias tan difíciles de afrontar, acató este rol comercial motivada por continuar aportándole bienestar a su familia.  Diariamente su almacén está disponible al público a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m., un horario propicio para que los habitantes del sector puedan realizar sus compras.  Denys siempre está atenta a mantener un variado surtido en su almacén y con esta finalidad aplicó una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en pulseras, adornos, productos de cuidado corporal y útiles escolares.  Esta inversión garantizará que los residentes del barrio en donde está ubicada su Miscelánea en Cartagena de Indias, encuentren todo tipo de artículos de uso personal, escolar y detalles para toda ocasión.  Su meta a futuro es rentar un local en un centro comercial y vender productos de mayor especificación.
texts.en:
Denys, aged 28, is a micro business owner, who took over the business from her father seven years ago, after his death. Under these extremely difficult circumstances, she accepted this commercial role, keen to continue providing for her family's well being.

Her store is open to the public daily from 8 am to 6 pm, hours that allow the people living locally to do their shopping. Denys makes sure to maintain a varied selection in her store, and with this aim she requested a loan, her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will invest in bracelets, ornaments, body care products and school supplies.

This investment will guarantee that the residents local to the store in Cartagena de Indias will be able to find all types of objects for personal use, school use and gifts for all occasions. Her aim for the future is to hire premises in a shopping center and sell higher quality products.

loans.use: to buy bracelets, ornaments, body care products and school supplies.

loans.name: Ilbea Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe, de 24 años de edad, estudio bachillerato opción contador, no siguió en la universidad porque no tenia los recursos económicos, está soltera y vive con sus padres.

Guadalupe, desde hace 12 años se dedica a la venta de pupusas y comida, este negocio lo aprendió con su mamá y la necesidad la llevo a colocar ese negocio, se levanta a las 3:30 a.m. porque el comedor está ubicado a 7 kilómetros de su casa y para llegar espera un vehículo que pasa a las 4:30 a.m. porque a las 5:00 a.m. tiene que estar en el comedor, porque tiene que preparar los desayunos, para abrir a las 6:30 a.m. y regresar a casa a las 4:00 p.m.

El crédito sera invertido para comprar maíz para su negocio, porque al comprar pequeñas cantidades es muy caro y si compra en grandes cantidades tiene más ganancias para ella.

Ella, desea poder ampliar su negocio y mejor su vivienda y sueña con seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 24 years old. She studied accounting but didn’t continue because she didn’t have the economic resources. She is single and lives with her parents. 

Guadalupe has made a living selling pupusas [a traditional snack] and food for the last 12 years. She learned this business from her mom and began the business out of necessity. She wakes up at 3:30 am because the kitchen is located 7 kilometers from her home. Her transportation goes by at 4:30 in the morning and she has to be at the kitchen at 5:00 am to prepare breakfast. She opens at 6:30 am and goes home at 4:00 pm. 

The loan will be invested in buying corn for her business because buying small quantities is very expensive and if she buys in large quantities she will have bigger profits. 

She hopes to expand her business and make improvements to her home. She also dreams of continuing her studies.

loans.use: to buy corn for her business.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 61 years old and married with seven children, two in school. Teodora works very hard to provide for her family.

Teodora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like condiments, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Teodora has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of grocery items. 

In the future, Teodora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like condiments, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Nosheen

texts.en: Nosheen is a 24-year-old mother of two children who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband provides local rural transport service to the people of his community. For the last 12 years, he has been using a horse cart for his rural transport business. Now, he wants to provide transport services by running an auto rickshaw. He hopes he would be able to get more income to support his family. However due to a lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new auto rickshaw. Therefore, Nosheen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help him to cover the cost of a new auto rickshaw. Nosheen is very thankful to Kiva and brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an auto rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 45-year-old responsible mother of two sons and a daughter. Her husband has been running a tailoring shop for many years. He takes orders from boutique keepers and sews ladies clothes to order. 
His shop is situated near his house in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Due to low earnings; he is unable to provide better living conditions for his family. He has been facing tough times and is not skillful in any other profession so he decided to expand his current enterprise. 
Zubaida's husband wants to buy his own fine cloth for sewing garments and then sell directly in the market.   
Therefore, Zubaida has requested a Kiva loan through BRAC Pakistan so her husband can buy fine cloth for sewing garments. She seems happy after receiving the loan and thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fine cloth for her husband's tailoring shop.

loans.name: La Inmaculada Concepcion Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN” y está conformado por 07 socias comprometidas y responsables. BENJAMINA de 53 años de edad es VIUDA con 4 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en un puesto de mercado hace más de 15 años. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su negocio y le va bien se siente feliz porque gracias al préstamo mejora cada día más su calidad de vida. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de abarrotes como arroz azúcar lentejas y pallares. El grupo “inmaculada concepción” agradece a las personas de kiva por hacer posible éste crédito. Benjamina es la primera del lado derecho viste polo color celeste.
texts.en:
This is the “Inmaculada Concepcion” group which is made up of seven committed and responsible members.

Benjamina is 53 years old, a widow who has 4 children. She has worked selling groceries in a market stall for more than 15 years. With much effort she has manged to improve her business and things are going well. She feels content as thanks to the loan her quality of living has increased day by day. This latest loan will be used to buy groceries like rice, sugar, lentils and lima beans.

The “Inmaculada Concepcion” group is grateful to the people at Kiva for making this loan possible. Benjamina is the first on the right wearing a blue colored shirt.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as rice, sugar, lentils and lima beans.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo is 58 years old and a resident of Carles, Iloilo. He is married and has nine children. The youngest child is fourteen.

Rodolfo engages in a buy-and-sell business selling fresh and dried fish. This is his source of income. He has been engaged in this business for more than fourteen years now. He is asking for a loan to buy more fresh fish that he can dry and sell. Since dried fish is in high demand, he can anticipate a good income in his business.

In the future, Rodolfo would like to live a comfortable and abundant life.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla and his wife own a small grocery shop with 2 dependent children. He and his wife need to stay in the shop the whole day and so consume a lot of energy to run their business till night time; however, the car battery is not reliable. Sometime the battery runs out without notice. Phalla's family has no choice but stay in pitch black for 1 day until morning; which disturbs not only his family living lifestyle but also his business.

Therefore, he decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a solar power home system for substaining his business’s energy usage and also his family usage. With a solar home system, he doesn’t have to be concerned about sudden loss of power anymore.

loans.use: to pay for a solar power home system.

location.town: Achen Village, Kampong Cham Commune, Sambo Distric

loans.name: Jlg-011-V.pudhur Group

texts.en:
Sivagami is a 50 year old woman and a mother of a child. She leads a group of 4 in Kulithalai, Tamil Nadu. They come from similar backgrounds, working hard to sustain their families. Sivagami and her family have no access to toilets, and therefore have to resort to open defecation using the false privacy of nearby fields and surrounding shrubbery. The family members, especially their women and daughters, are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites.

Seeking to improve their situation, the group seeks a loan of Rs. 56000 to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will provide these 4 families the privacy of using their own toilet, which will be a big step towards a better standard of living for them. Higher standards of hygiene will also lead to reduced medical expenses, and hence, more savings in the long run.

loans.use: to fund the installation of toilets in their homes.

loans.name: Sadaf

texts.en:
Sadaf is 35 years old woman and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her three daughters, who are in school. Her husband has been running her own business of clothes selling for 12 years. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these clothes.

Therefore Sadaf is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.
Sadaf is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's clothing business.

loans.name: Yaneth Cristabel

texts.es:
Yaneth, de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, se acompaño cuando tenía 18 años de edad, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y tiene 3 hijos.

Yaneth, cuando tenía 15 años comenzó a vender pupusas, este negocio lo aprendió con su mamá, pero actualmente tiene una venta de tortilla; pero además le gusta la crianza de ganado.- Ella le ayuda a su pareja en la siembra de maíz y maicillo, él comienza a las 4:00 a.m. para coser el maíz y a las 8:30 a.m. hay que ir al molino porque a las 10:00 a.m. los clientes ya están esperando tortillas, ella termina su jornada a las 2:00 p.m.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar 3 novillas.

Su sueño es ver a sus hijos graduarse de la universidad, también desea colocar una tienda, renovar su pupusería y tener 5 vacas lecheras.
texts.en:
Yaneth is 38 years old, she studied until 9th grade, and she begin living with her partner at 18 years old. Her partner makes a living in agriculture and has 3 children.

Yaneth began selling pupusas [a traditional snack] at 15 years old, a business which she learned from her mom. However, she currently sells tortillas. She also likes raising cattle. She helps her partner cultivate corn and sorghum. He begins harvesting the corn at 4:00 am and goes to the mill at 8:30 am because at 10:00 am the customers are already waiting for tortillas. She finishes her shift at 2:00 pm. 

She is asking for this loan to buy 3 heifers. 

Her dream is to see her children graduate from university, to open a store, rekindle her pupusa shop, and have 5 milk cows.

loans.use: to buy 3 heifers.

loans.name: Zain

texts.en:
Zain, a 21 years old married lady who faced with her husband some financial obstacles in the beginning of their marriage. Zain and her husband chose not to surrender to anything and find ways to survive, so Zain started a small home business selling bed sheets and blankets.

She now wants to add selling clothes after noticing that there are no clothing stores close to where she lives which makes the demand on them higher. So she applied to this youth loan in order to buy a collection of clothes that can be sold in the neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy a collection of clothes that can then be sold in the neighborhood.

loans.name: Behruz

texts.en:
Behruz was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1997. His mother and father are divorced. His mother brought up her three children alone and works at a medical clinic, where she is a nurse.

Behruz graduated his high school with excellence in 2015. He passed exams for the university at the faculty of Tax and Taxation. He is a contract student now. The contract says that he has to pay his tuition fee on time.

He appealed to IMON asking financial support to pay his educational costs for his studies. He hopes to be understood and supported by Kiva lenders. He thanks them for this.

loans.use: to pay his educational costs for a B. Sc. in Tax and Taxation.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as being committed.

She operates a farm where she grows vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 14 years. Her business is located in an area with good climate and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in weather.

Josephine will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Wendi Witu Shg Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Janet, sixty three years old and a mother of five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2014 and has been trained on enterprise development and financial management by HiH EA.

She practices mixed farming of maize, beans, and vegetables. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy fertilizer for her farm produce. This will lead to increase in production hence increase in income to cater for her family basic needs.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase production and enable her to cater for her family basic needs.

loans.name: Zaib Un Nisa

texts.en:
ZAIB UN NISA is a 30-year-old lady living with her spouse and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She wants to save so that she can provide a better living for her children but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her husband has been driving a moto rickshaw for several years but his income is insufficient to feed their entire family. He has to maintain the motorbike and rickshaw’s body but does not have sufficient cash on hand to fix it. 

Therefore, ZAIB UN NISA has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her husband will be able to buy the moto rickshaw’s body. She hopes that she will be able to save enough to meet the sudden needs of her family.

loans.use: to help her husband purchase a moto rickshaw's body for his transportation services.

loans.name: Ma. Christina

texts.en:
Paint Merchandising and managing a variety store are the sources of income of Ma.Christina. Seventeen years on the variety store and one year on paint merchandising. They are earning for approximately Php 15,000 every month excluding the salary of his husband Robert, an Overseas Filipino Worker. Raising her three children alone is not easy. That is why she’s trying her best to succeed on her chosen industry. If that's the case, her husband don't have to work abroad again, but instead he can just stay in the Philippines to manage their business together.

Ma. Christina is requesting for a loan amounting to Php 50,000. One of the challenges that she encounters on the business are customers having issue in paying the products on time which affects her daily profit. If granted, the amount will be a supplementary capital for her to buy grocery items for her variety store business and stocks of paint as well. 

She believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. Ma. Christina is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony , share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and  hear God’s word that  was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her variety store and stocks of paint.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es: ELIZABETH de 36 años de edad es soltera y tiene 1 hijo dependiente. Ella Pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal “mujeres luchadoras” la cual lo conforman 08 socios con deseos de  trabajar honradamente y progresar. Ella hace más de 5 MESES que se dedica al negocio de venta de ROPA lo cual lo realiza ambulatoriamente. Gracias a su constante dedicación logro sacar adelante a  su hijo. Su mayor deseo es tener su casa propia. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de ropa como casacas polos y pantalones. La Alcancía “mujeres luchadoras” agradece a los Inversionistas de Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Elizabeth es la tercera del lado derecho y viste chaleco color anaranjado.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 36, is single and has one dependent child. She belongs to the Mujeres Luchadoras communal bank. It is comprised of eight members who wish to work honorably and progress. She has been in the business of selling clothes in an itinerant manner for five months. Thanks to her constant dedication she managed to get her son ahead.

Her biggest wish is to have her own house.

She requested a loan to buy clothes like jackets, polo style shirts, and pants.

The Mujeres Luchadoras communal bank is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the support provided. Elizabeth is the third person on the right, and she is wearing an orange vest.

loans.use: to buy clothes like jackets, polo style shirts, and pants.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man, with 3 children. He describes himself to be faithful. He operates a retail business where he offers printing services and also sells stationery. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are individual companies.

He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of printing materials and stationery. He hopes that in the future, he will expand the business to other countries.

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of printing materials and stationery

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen runs a grocery shop in Achen Village living with his husband and 1 grown up daughter. Yen's husband and daughter works as an employee of a company while Yen stays in the shop. She needs to get up early to prepare their shop before the sun rises. Currently, she is still using car battery to light her business and for home energy; however, a car battery is not reliable. It has a short life span and is easily damaged. Sometime car battery runs out during night time.

After getting good recommendation from neighbors that uses solar home systems, she decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a solar home system. She believes this decision will improve her energy to run the business and also save utility fees.

loans.use: to pay for a solar power home system.

location.town: Achen Village, Kampong Cham Commune, Sambo Distric

loans.name: Jlg-008-V.pudhur Group

texts.en:
Lakshmi, a 40 year old woman and mother of a child, from rural Tamil Nadu has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. Lakshmi's family is one of the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Without access to a toilet, her family is forced to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. These unsanitary practices make them vulnerable to infections, and the lack of privacy exposes them to molestation or worse. Joining hands with 4 other women whose families faces similar problems, Lakshmi has formed a group and is hoping to address this issue.

Seeking to improve their situation, they seek a loan of Rs. 56000 to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help these 4 hardworking rural Indian families to access basic sanitation, and consequently, safety, improved health, medical savings, and improved productivity.

loans.use: to fund the installation of toilets in their homes.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 51-year-old store owner from Poblacion Muntinlupa, Philippines. She runs a sari-sari store business since Filipinos prefer to buy goods in a place that’s near to their homes rather than waste money in fares going to markets. Basically, sari-sari stores can be found in every neighborhood where it has grills or screens for protection against theft. Products here are measured by volumes, kilos or by the piece.

She has run the business for ten years already. It has helped her cover the needs of her family and support her children’s education. She has also added dried fish to her variety store aside from grocery items. She earns approximately Php 30,000 every month. However, the profits that are supposed to be used to buy stock for the store have been used for their daily needs. To add products, Lucia decided to apply for a Php 35,000 loan to buy stocks of products like bottled drinks, assorted grocery items, sacks of rice, and dried fish.

Lucia is consistent in attending the weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gains spiritual strength from members' life changing testimonies, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays micro finance loans and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: To buy stocks like bottled drinks, assorted grocery items, sacks of rice, dried fish and other products.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman, with 6 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes and clothes. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are of all kinds.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes, clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: buy more stock of shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 44 years old, married and has five children, two of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising ducks in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her ducks.

Susan has been raising ducks for 4 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Susan would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her ducks

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.  Teresita is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to purchase of gasoline, fishing net, wood, etc for her fishing business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase of gasoline, fishing net, wood, etc

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Alejandra works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Alejandra is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to  buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, flour, cooking oil and other materials for her food production business.

Alejandra has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, flour, cooking oil and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Aghavnik

texts.en:
Aghavnik is 54 years old from Akhalkalaki district. She works at the local library and gets a small monthly salary. As the salary is not enough to cover all expenses, Aghavnik decided to start a new business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 900 USD.

With the received credit she will purchase a stock of clothes at wholesale price and will resell at higher price. This will increase her income. Aghavnik hopes that the business will be profitable and she will increase her monthly income. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trading in clothes in order to increase income

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim, a farmer over 20 years, lives in Yeav Village with 3 children and wife. As a farmer, he wants to expand his business with 2 hectares land and making his family living in comfortable condition. However, his house has no reliable energy source. He has to go to charge car battery every 2 or 3 days for daily usage, which takes a lot of money and time. Sometime because of busyness he doesn’t have time to charge battery. The whole family is in pitch black condition for the whole day.

As a result, he is applying for a Kiva loan to buy high quality home solar energy. After using solar home energy, he believes his family condition would be better and safer. He also can save time and money on utilities.

loans.use: to pay for a solar power home system.

location.town: Yeav Village, Kampong Cham Commune, Sambo District

loans.name: Shoruq

texts.en:
Shoruq is a 24-years-old single lady from Ramallah city, located in the West Bank. She lives with her family in a small house. Because it’s difficult to find a job in the West Bank, she wants to open her own business, which is a mobile phone store. She has experience from her previous job about selling mobiles and providing maintenance and she also has a great entrepreneurial spirit.

In order to get started, Shoruq took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy mobile phones and accessories for her new store to resell. This will make her independent.
Shoruq appears in the photo in her new store.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories for her new store to resell.

loans.name: Las Rositas Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “LAS ROSITAS” y está conformado por 08 socias comprometidas y responsables. Francisca de 27 años de edad es conviviente con 1 hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de billeteras y monedores lo cual lo realiza ambulatoriamente desde hace más de 3 años. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su calidad de vida gracias al préstamo podrá implementar más su negocio. Su último crédito lo destinará para  la compra de billeteras y monederos. El grupo “las rositas” agradece a las personas de kiva por hacer posible éste crédito. Francisca se encuentra en la parte posterior es la segunda del lado derecho viste casaca jean.
texts.en:
This is the group "LAS ROSITAS" and is made up of 8 committed and responsible members. Francisca, who is 27 years old, lives with her son, who depends on her. She has been selling wallets and coin purses in the streets for over 3 years. She has improved her life working hard, and thanks to the loan she'll be able to establish her business.

She'll use the last loan to buy wallets and coin purses. Las Rositas group thanks the Kiva members for making this loan possible.

 Francisca is second from right on the top row, she is wearing a jean jacket.

loans.use: to buy wallets and coin purses.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie has been in a car wash business for 8 years now. It is just located beside their house in Camarin Caloocan City. It’s her love for vehicles that made her chose this line of business. Moreover, her husband Ronald who is a driver is helping her with the business. They also have two helpers. With the right location, quality service and good marketing strategy you can draw numerous of customers who wants their cars washed quickly. Every month for an approximate net earnings of Php 11,000, it helped them indeed on their daily expenditures.

Not all of the earnings have been put back on the business as some were also used for their day-to-day expenses including support for their children’s education. With this, Ana Marie and her husband are striving their best to as well have savings for their future and provide not just those that are essentials might as well provide their children’s wants at times.

The car wash business helped them a lot but it’s unstable during rainy season. That’s why Ana Marie wants to run an alternative business during months of June until October to still have earnings or might as well run the two businesses at the same time. With this, Ana Marie as a Center for Community Transformation (CCT) member decided to apply for a loan of Php 10,000 to be capable of buying materials or equipment for her cars wash business and a capital for an added business that she will be establishing.

On a weekly basis, Ana Marie regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to be capable of buying materials and equipment for her car wash business.

loans.name: Hta Ni Pat Village Group 2 A

texts.en:
The featured borrower, Tun, is 47 years old, married, and supports a family of nine. Tun is proud that all of his seven children are either working or in school. He owns nine acres of crop farm and raises ducks to sell their eggs for extra income. He is looking forward to purchasing the necessary farming supplies for his farm. With the additional income, he hopes to expand his crop farm and buy his own farming machines.

Pictured above are the members of Hta Ni Pat Village Group 2 A, named Tun, Kyaw, Chu, Ko, Myo, and Than. A CBO leader oversees the group members, and the fund will help each member purchase supplies for their farm such as fertilizer and rice.

Hta Ni Pat Village is located in Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region in Myanmar. Most families focus on crop farming and raising livestock. They also plant seasonal foods such as coconuts and betel leaves for additional income.

loans.use: to purchase necessary farming supplies for his farm.

borrowers.first_name: Hta Ni Pat Village Group 2 A

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is a father of four, who operates a poultry business, growing and selling chickens to earn a living. He has been in this business for many years, and he earns well for his family. 

By selling live chickens in the villages, he was able to earn more profit than selling it in whole. He has successfully repaid  his previous loan, which was used to buy feeds. He took a new loan recently from GDMPC micro credit to buy feeds for his chickens.

He plans to build another cage for his poultry as expansion for his piggery in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds for his chickens.

loans.name: Khy

texts.en:
Khy works as a village chief in Yeav village, living with two children and his wife. As a village chief, he needs to do a lot of paperwork. Sometimes he needs to work until night. Therefore, he needs energy to light his house at night.

Currently, he uses a car battery to provide his house with energy. However, a car battery is not reliable. It has a short life span and is easily damaged. Sometimes, the car battery runs out during the night.

After getting a good recommendation from a neighbor that uses a solar home system, Khy decided to apply for Kiva loan to buy a solar home system. He believes this decision will improve the energy needed to run his business and also save utility fees.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Yeav Village, Kampong Cham Commune, Sambo District

loans.name: Rashad

texts.en:
Rashad, a 28 years old working as a counselor at one of the treatment centers for the disabled in Irbid. Working at the center was not enough for Rashad, so he opened a small café where he serves hot and soft drinks in addition to sheesha (hooka).

Having his own business was his dream from the beginning that is helping Rashad increase his income and build his future. Now Rashad is applying to a youth loan to bring in new chairs and tables to expand the seating area in the café.

loans.use: to bring in new chairs and tables to expand the seating area in his café.

loans.name: Khet

texts.en:
Khet, a farmer with 3 children, is living in Yeav village that is far from power grid. Khet gets up early and come back late to do farming. However, he has difficult using car battery as his home energy. Because he has to spend time connect from battery to appliance before preparing his equipment to the farm. He has to go to charge car battery every 2 or 3 days for daily usage. Sometime because of busyness he doesn’t have time to charge battery the whole family is in pitch black condition for the whole day.

Seeing the difficulty of using car battery, Khet decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy high quality solar home energy. After using solar home energy, he believes his family condition would be better and safer. He also can save time and money on utilities.

loans.use: to pay for a solar energy home system.

location.town: Yeav Village, Kampong Cham Commune, Sambo District

loans.name: Jlg-004(A)-Kurichi Group

texts.en:
The sanitation crisis in India is a result of poor infrastructure and lack of education. This is a group of three, led by Periyakkal, a 50 year old woman living in the state of Tamil Nadu. Periyakkal realizes the importance of having a toilet at home but she does not have the means to build one.

Without a toilet at home, her family has to walk long distances just to relieve themselves. They go to isolated locations just to find a private spot. This puts them at risk of infection, molestation and many such evils. The group of three faces similar problems. Seeking to improve their situation, the group seeks a loan of 42,000 INR to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help their families access basic sanitation, improved health, and safety.

loans.use: to build toilets in their homes.

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly is a fifty-seven-year old CCT member from Payatas Quezon City. She is a housewife managing a buy and sell business mainly focused on organic soap and kiddie soap. 

Others think that what she does is easy, but she needs capital to run the business, and moreover, passion. If these elements are not there, her efforts would be senseless. Like any other business, those are the key factors that one needs to have in order to be successful. 

We all know that soap is one of the main needs in a household. Here in the Philippines, every Filipino takes a shower once a day, others more than once as they would not feel comfortable otherwise. Jelly sees the opportunity in that need. 

With this in mind, Jelly decided to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan as additional capital for her direct sale business. She believes that one of the secrets to increasing the profit of a business is to add to the quantity of products, that is why she asks for your help to increase her income.

Being a longtime member of the CCT, Jelly has been consistently attending the CCT fellowship group. The group consists of 15 to 30 members, and during the meetings she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners. This has made Jelly become strong spiritually and dependent to God on every occasion.

loans.use: to buy additional personal products for her direct sale business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy livestock and start doing business.

loans.name: Gulbarg

texts.en:
Gulbarg is a nice and gentle woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1967. She is living in big, busy city. She is married and has four children. Their family is big and in order to ensure and feed his family her husband is working in Russia. Gulbarg has been a family nurse since 1986. She is well known among colleagues and friends. She works at a medical clinic.

Gulbarg's husband, after hard work, became sick. She worries and takes care of him. She did not have money to pay for the treatment of her husband and appealed to IMON to get a loan. She is planning to treat her husband at the medical clinic. She hopes her husband will be healed and Kiva lenders will support them.

loans.use: to treat her husband at a medical clinic.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a married man, with 4 children. He operates a retail business where he sells paper bags, open shoes, baseball caps and other items. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are of all kinds. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations.

He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of caps, paper bags, open shoe and other items. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of baseball caps, paper bags, open shoes and other items.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is single and she works hard to support herself.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Nenita is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell in her fish vending business.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a married woman with three children. Leonida is 62 years old now and is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Leonida has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. Leonida requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Leonida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Maria Alma

texts.en:
Maria Alma is 42 years old and widowed with six children. With two of her children in school, Maria Alma works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Alma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, and other groceries.
