Your loan will provide these three families the privacy of using their own toilet, which will be a big step towards a better standard of living for them. Higher standards of hygiene will also lead to reduced medical expenses, and hence, more savings in the long run.

loans.use: to construct a toilet and improve sanitation facilities at her home.

loans.name: Benta

texts.en:
Benta is a married woman and describes herself to be hopeful. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of charcoal. Her business goal is to sell in wholesale within 5 years.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stocks of charcoal.

loans.name: Khalel

texts.en:
Khalel is a 29-year-old married man from Khan Younis city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, which has had an economic blockade imposed by the Israeli authorities since 2007. He works as an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income.

Khalel also has a grocery store where he sells basic grocery products. Khalel took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new goods for his grocery store.

With this loan, Khalel can buy more goods for his store to resell. Khalel appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new goods for his grocery store.

loans.name: Falaha's Group

texts.en:
Falaha and Nidal are a married couple who live in one of the under privileged areas in Jordan. Falaha started a small business at home selling snacks and juices. She started with one box of chips and one box of bottled juices.. Then expanded it by time by increasing the quantity she sells. Then Nidal retired and decided to open with his wife a small shop where they can sell food products and detergents outside their house.

Now both of them are working on improving the store since there are no mini markets in the area that can serve the neighborhood. By adding more types of food products, specially essential ones, plus detergents and other housekeeping products, in addition to increasing the stationary section to prepare for the back to school season. For that they applied to this loan.

loans.use: add food products, plus detergents and other housekeeping products and also to increase the stationary section, to prepare for the back to school season.

loans.name: Anima

texts.en:
42-year-old Anima lives in the small village of Barogharia in Dhupguri, West Bengal. She is a careful mother of four children (one daughter and three sons). She has a great determination to provide her children a good education because she ended her education in grade 5 due to her family issues. Thus she works hard to provide every support to her children for their education. Anima is a homemaker while her husband is associated with agricultural activities.

Anima’s eldest son, 18-year-old Rajnarayan, is studying in grade 11 in Vidyasram Divyojoti Vidyaniketan, a local school in Dhupguri. He has chosen the arts stream. He is serious about his studies and tries to score good marks in his final Board examination.

Anima faces difficulties in bearing the educational expenses of her son after meeting the household costs with her husband’s sole income from agribusiness, yet she is striving hard to provide uninterrupted education to her son.

Hence, as a responsible mother, Anima is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to bear the continual educational expenses of her son. She plans to pay educational fees and buy study materials for her son’s grade 11 year. The loan will help this bright young boy to continue his education without any obstacles so he can fulfill his dream of joining the army.

Anima and Rajnarayan (in the photo) are grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to bear her son's educational expenses for grade 11.

loans.name: Minati

texts.en:
31-year-old Minati lives in a small village of Dhupguri in West Bengal. She is a careful mother of three children (one son and two daughters). She has a great determination to provide her children a good education. Thus she works hard to provide every support to her children. Minati is a housewife while her husband is a mason to earn a livelihood for his family.

Minati’s daughter, 16-year-old Kalpana, is studying in grade 9 in Dhupguri Uccha Balika Vidyalaya. She is serious about her studies and tries to score good marks in her final Board examination.

But Minati faces difficulties in bearing the educational expenses of her children after meeting the household cost with the sole income of her husband, yet she is striving hard to provide uninterrupted education to her children. Minati realizes that Kalpana will go ahead with further education if she gets proper help.

Hence as a responsible mother Minati is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to bear the educational expenses of her daughter Kalpana. She plans to pay educational fees and buy study materials and a cycle for her daughter, so that Kalpana can easily go to school by saving the time and conveyance cost. The loan will help this bright young girl continue her education without any obstacles.

Minati and Kalpana (in the photo) are grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to bear her daughter's educational expenses for grade 9.

loans.name: Shefali

texts.en:
Shefali, a 30-year-old lady, lives in a small village named Vemtia in the Jalpaiguri district of West Bengal. She lives there with her husband, one son, and one daughter. Her children are studying in different grades. Shefali is a homemaker and her husband is engaged in the scrap goods business.

Shefali's son, 12-year-old Bikram, is a student in grade 7 in Dhupguri High School. He is an average student but obtains passing marks in all his regular subjects. He wants to be a teacher and make his career in the teaching sector.

The family income is very low so it is difficult to manage costs for Bikram's education. Shefali is short of money to pay the fees and purchase the text books all together at the same time for her son. Bikram loves to study and doesn’t want to drop out of his school at any cost.

Thus Shefali is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to help her son to fulfill his dream. She will pay Bikram's course fee and purchase books and other necessary materials with the loan money. The loan will help a hardworking student not to discontinue his education just because of financial limitation.

Shefali and Bikram (standing side by side in the photo) convey their gratitude to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase study materials and pay the fees for her son’s education.

loans.name: Lowela

texts.en:
Lowela is 38 years old with four children ages 10, 8, 6 and 4 years old. Her husband is an on-call construction worker with no regular salary and most of the time they had difficulty to support even their most basic needs. Lowela wanted to help her husband, so she started to put up a sari-sari store (grocery store) in front of her house but without good management and budgeting, Lowela's store is often used for consumption.

Lowela came to know about SEED* through a savings program organized in their community accompanied with various trainings in business and financial management. Lowela became a member and her determination is to save even a small amount such as PHP 20 per week with the goal that it's for the expenses of her children's projects and other activities in school.

Lowela wanted to open her store again to help with their needs especially now that their children are growing up and most are schooling.

She is now requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to buy groceries such as coffee, canned goods, sugar, bottled goods, snack foods and laundry soap to sell to her customers.

Lowela hopes that through the loan and hard work she can open and grow her business. Lowela's dream is not just to make ends meet but to see her children finish their education.

*The SEED start-up loan program loans are no interest bearing and for the underprivileged individuals with no knowledge in business but wanting to put up a business. It is accompanied with Intensive business coaching and continued business and financial training support.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as coffee, canned goods, sugar, bottled goods, snack foods and laundry soap to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter 47 years old, is married and supports one child. He is a small scale farmer. He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Visionfund Kenya to purchase certified fertilizers, seeds and herbicides to improve his farming activity.

He plans to use the gained profits to repay his loan and expand his farming activity. He hopes to improve his family health care as well as living standards.

loans.use: to purchase certified fertilizers, seeds and herbicides to improve his farming activity.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima, 29 years old, lives in her own house with his husband. She has had a tailoring shop located in his house for the past 2 years. She began with her work because of her husband's low and unstable income.

She has many customers due to the quality with which she does her work. She is asking for a loan to purchase thread, needles, a variety of fabric, buttons, elastics, etc. This way she will be able to continue with her work, which generates good earnings for her.

loans.use: to purchase thread, needles, a variety of fabric, buttons, elastics, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for farm labor and purchase fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia has been running her business for 15 years. It has been earning a lot and allowed her to be able to repay her previous loan. Now she is, again, raising a small number of pigs to cover her daily needs. While both parents are busy with their work, her children may help in raising a few piglets until the pigs reach their marketable age.

Virgilia wants to earn more so now she is taking a new loan to buy feed for her piglets in order to provide for the needs of her customers and produce a quality product that she is going to sell in the market.

Virgilia may realize profitable production and improve the quality of her family's lives as well as provide for the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her small number of piglets.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Meet Eunice, one of the most hardworking women on planet earth. She is 45 years of age, very hardworking and a go-getter. She hails from Sumerwa, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. This is an area of limited resources, where scarcity of employment opportunities and resources with which to survive causes people to practice farming. Her primary sources of income are crops,poultry and animal farming. She also gets some income through personal business.

Eunice is contented with the farming way of life. She is a very enterprising woman, and although she never had formal education or formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her children and family of a decent meal. The Kitale area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business. Being a woman from Africa and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Eunice feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her.

Eunice is well disciplined with finances and she plans that through the accumulated profits, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children who are in college. Please help Eunice so that her horticulture farming can flourish!

loans.use: to start horticulture farming and provide a better income for her children.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 48 years old and married with five children, two of whom in school.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Gloria is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Gloria has been farming sugarcane for 7 years and also earns additional income from buy and sell rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul he is a hard-working and brave smallholder farmer who has a will of iron. He is a super incredible farmer! He certainly ranks among the top successful smallholder farmers on Juhudi Kilimo's client list. Born in 1981 into a humble family, Paul’s upbringing was difficult. He attended school and cleared secondary, after which he got into mixed farming 10 years ago. He also married a beautiful and loving wife and they have 3 children.

Paul practices farming on a 4-acre farm that is owned by the family in the village of Kaptoror. On the farm, he grows vegetables, beans and maize. He also keeps more than two highly productive dairy cows for milk production. The 34-year-old farmer sells his produce in bulk to the nearby market. His key clients are his neighbours and local people. He is a member of Sangat self-help Group, a group formed to help members, who are smallholder farmers, to save and use the savings to access loans from financial institutions.

Paul is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to build a greenhouse and also to start milk vending business. He needs greenhouse technology to continuously improve the productivity, profitability and sustainability of his major farming systems. A greenhouse will provide a favorable environment for his plants. It will also protect the plants from adverse climatic conditions such as wind, cold, precipitation, excessive radiation, extreme temperature, insects and diseases.

With your lending, Paul will have a year-round production of crops and off-season production of vegetable and fruits. He will also save on the use of natural resources such as water. Water requirement of crops is very limited and easy to control with this technology. Through the loan he will be able to sell milk to his neighbours and also to the nearby market hence making more money. Paul has a great credit history he took a KES 65,000 loan and successfully serviced it. This will be his second loan with Juhudi Kilimo. After successfully clearing the previous loans, he stated that this loan will change his life. Profits from this investment will be be plowed back into the business to fuel further growth. There still remains so much space on his land for future growth. If there ever was an opportunity to invest a $25 loan in someone's future, it is here! You won't regret it!

loans.use: to build a green house for increased diversity on his farm and start a milk vending business.

loans.name: Everest

texts.en:
Everest is a 44 year old hardworking married man with four children. They all attend school in Kamwenge, Uganda. He grows food crops alongside working as a builder to earn a living. He intends to be a modern and prominent business man and to develop himself, but has seen failure due to inadequate capital and seasonal contracts. Everest is working hard to ensure that he cares for is family that brings him so much joy.

He is requesting a loan to finish up his residential house.

loans.use: to finish up his residential house and put roofing on it.

loans.name: Krishna

texts.en:
Krishna is a housewife from Dhupguri in the Jalpaiguri district. She is a 31-year-old woman and mother of two children (one daughter and one son). Her daughter is studying in grade 10 and her son is in grade 8. Krishna’s husband runs a stationery goods shop but the income is insufficient to cover all the household costs of a family of four.

Krishna's son, 13-year-old Sudeb, studies in grade 8 in Dhupguri High School. He is a studious boy. If he gets proper guidance and adequate study materials, then he can do much better in his upcoming exam. In spite of having limited education, Krishna pays more attention to her children's education.

Due to a lack of money, Krishna was feeling helpless about managing her son's educational equipment, tuition fees, school fees, etc. She wants to avail a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase books, pens, exercise copies, etc., and to pay all educational fees for her son. Now Krishna is rather comfortable about her son's education as BJS and Kiva came forward to help her economically.

Krishna and her son Sudeb (in the photo) thank BJS and Kiva for this educational loan.

loans.use: To bear the educational costs for her son.

loans.name: Galenur

texts.en:
Galenur is a 27-year-old lady of Barogharia village in Dhupguri of West Bengal. She is a mother of three children (a daughter and two sons). Her children are studying in different grades in local village school. Galenur has a keen interest in providing her children a good education so that they do not face any obstacle in leading their lives.

Galenur’s husband has been associated with the fish vending business for many years. His earnings are hardly enough to cover the educational expenses of their children after meeting the household costs for their family.

Galenur’s daughter, 14-year-old Reshma, is now studying in grade 9 in Vidyashram D.V.High School(XII) and is very serious about her studies. She aims to become a nurse in the future. Now she needs the help of private tuition to score good marks in her examination; otherwise she could not proceed further.

Galenur learned about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and applied for a loan for her daughter’s uninterrupted education. With the loan, she will pay the private tuition fees and school fees and buy necessary educational articles and school uniforms for her daughters.

Galenur and her daughter, Reshma, are very grateful to Kiva and BJS for this loan.

loans.use: To pay the tuition fees and buy necessary articles for her daughter’s education in grade 9.

loans.name: Making Wood, Making Life - 14 Pnhihlộc Group

texts.en:
Mr Toàn is 39 years old and he is married with 4 children. He has been working as a carpenter for more than 10 years. Toàn lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
His family is a low-income household in village, moreover his work is hard. It takes a long time to create a whole product and the carpenter has to make sure that the customers like it or he earns nothing.

The main hardship that Toàn faces is lack of capital. He is requesting a loan to purchase more wood for expanding his business.

In 2014, Toàn joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve his business. Toàn has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. He is the group leader of 14PNhiHLộc, which consists of 3 members.

With his business profit, Toàn hopes for his business to do well, for his family to be healthy and happy and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more wood for expanding his business.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 39 years old, married and has three children. She is managing a store for income. She is very patient in attending all her customers needs in her store. She wants to improve her earnings but she needs additional capital to invest in her business.

She is now asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy canned goods, breads, eggs, and soft-drinks to sell. This will help increase her sales and she will save additional profits for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, breads, eggs, and softdrinks to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is  32 year old and married. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Irene has a buy and sell personal product care business in the Philippines. Irene requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like lotion, roll on, etc..

Irene has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Irene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like lotion, roll on, etc.

loans.name: Angélica Osneidy

texts.es: Angélica dio su primer paso a la independencia económica, cuando encontró la oportunidad de proyectarse como una comerciante exitosa al analizar los beneficios que a largo plazo obtendría;  su prima fue su principal motivadora quien por años ha ejercido esta actividad y le recomendó que se arriesgara y emprendiera su negocio. Así que se puso en la marcha y compró sus primera prendas de vestir y calzado, aperturando su lista de clientes encabezada por sus amigos y referidos a quienes les ofreció facilidad en sus pagos. Poco a poco ha incrementado su base de clientes y su capital ya no es suficiente para cumplir con todos los requerimientos de mercancías, por eso Angélica está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en nuevo surtido de suéteres, camisas y calzado.  Con esta inversión podrá comprarles a sus proveedores a precios especiales y sus ganancias serán impactadas positivamente.  Su meta a futuro es abrir un almacén y comprar su propio apartamento para ofrecerle bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Angélica took her first step towards economic independence when she found the opportunity to become a successful merchant, upon analyzing the long-term benefits that she would obtain. Her main motivator was her cousin, who had been engaged in this occupation for years, and recommended that she take the risk and start her business.

So she got started, and purchased her first articles of clothing and footwear, starting her list of customers with friends and referrals at the top, offering them easy payments. Gradually, her customer base has increased, and her capital is no longer sufficient to meet her merchandise requirements. That is why Angélica is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest it in a new stock of sweaters, tops, and footwear. With this investment, she will be able to make purchases with her vendors at special prices, and her earnings will be impacted positively.

Her future goal is to open a shop, and to purchase her own apartment in order provide for her family's wellbeing.

loans.use: to invest in a new stock of sweaters, tops, and footwear.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell medicine business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of medicine to sell for her buy and sell medicine business.

Gilda has been in this business for 8 years. Gilda earns more income from buy and sell livestock and farming sugarcane.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of medicine to sell

loans.name: Airyn

texts.en:
Airyn is 32 years old, married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like noodles, rice and coffee to sell.

Airyn has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like noodles, rice and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Sarafe

texts.en:
Sarafe is a single woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Sarafe is 24 years old and has one child who is in school.

Sarafe has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Sarafe requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish, sacks of salt, nets and other materials for her dried fish making business.

Sarafe has been in this business for 4 years. SHe would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish, sacks of salt, nets and other materials for her dried fish making business.

loans.name: Francita

texts.en:
Francita is 50 years old and married with three children.

Francita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, school supplies, personal product care, and other groceries.

Francita has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from vegetable vending.

Francita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, school supplies, personal product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Luz Salome

texts.en:
Luz Salome is 45 years old, married and has one child in school.

She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Luz Salome requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds and rice barns for her pigs.

Luz Salome has been pig fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and rice barns for her pigs.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is a hard-working married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to hire workers to clear the bush on his farmland and plant more bananas. He still deals in agriculture and has continued to grow sugar cane and bananas as his main sources of income. He also rears cattle, does piggery and earns a monthly salary. He has been able to educate his children with profits from his businesses an repay his loan very well. He still faces the challenges of unpredictable weather and inadequate capital. However, he has a vision of expanding his farm to a modern one and educating his children to the university level.

Ben is requesting a loan to buy mulch and manure for his garden.

loans.use: to buy mulch and manure for his garden.

loans.name: Edith Maribel

texts.es:
Edith, de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casada, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura y también como albañil, tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales solo dos viven con ella y están estudiando, los otros viven en hogares aparte.

Edith, tiene una tienda donde vende todo lo necesario para la cocina como azúcar, arroz y aceite, ella tiene 10 años de tener la tienda y fue la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingreso, la que la motivo a tomar la decisión de colocarla y le dio resultado.- Antes de poner la tienda se dedicaba solo a los quehaceres del hogar.

El préstamo será invertido para comprar productos para surtir la tienda como arroz, frijoles, pan y café, ya que tubo gastos que la han dejado sin capital para invertir y está perdiendo de vender.- 

Los sueños de Edith, son cubrir las necesidades de la familia y continuar invirtiendo en su tienda.
texts.en: Edith, 40 years old, studied up to third grade. She is married. Her husband works in agriculture, and also in construction. She has four children, two of whom live with her and go to school. The others live in their own homes. Edith has a store where she sells all that is needed for cooking, such as sugar, rice and oil. She has had the store for ten years, and it was the need to have an income source which motivated her to open it, and it was successful. Before starting the store, she used to work in household chores. She will invest the loan to buy products such as rice, beans, bread and coffee, to stock up the store, because she had expenses that left her without capital to invest and she has lost money for not having things to sell. Edith's dreams are to cover her family's needs and to continue investing in her store.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, beans, bread and coffee, to stock up the store.

loans.name: Nallayamapatti Jlg 001 Group

texts.en:
Valarmarthi is a 35 years old woman who lives in Namakkal district of Tamil Nadu. Valamarthi lives with her family and usually engages in work that involves daily wage earning. She lives with her family of 7 members and the total household income doesn't go beyond Rs. 10,000 a month which makes it difficult to make ends meet. Valamarthi wishes to help the family financially by starting her own business.

As she is trained in saree stone work, she wants to buy the raw materials required and start the business. Valamarthi believes that the increase in the income generation will help her family to live a better life. The rest of the members in her group have joined her in seeking a loan to start their businesses. They are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: to buy the raw material required for saree stone work and kickstart her business.

loans.name: Kaikaye

texts.en:
Kaikaye is a 46-year-old married lady and a mother of two daughters. She lives in ward number 4 in Dhupguri. She studied up to grade 10 and due to her family’s poor economy she has to drop out of school then, but she is very eager to give her daughters the best education which they deserve. Kaikaye’s husband runs a modest grocery shop, which is the only source of revenue for the family. Her elder daughter is married.

Kaikaye's younger daughter, Rita, is 21 year old. She is pursuing her bachelor's degree from Tejpur Dorang College. She is in the third year. In the future she wants to become a teacher. She needs proper guidance and reference books to score good marks in her final year examination.

However the income of the family is mostly spent for household expenses and they cannot afford the whole educational cost for their daughter. The cost of bachelor degree course fees and educational materials is high. Sometimes they cannot even provide necessary books for their daughter. As such, providing Rita with private coaching is too difficult for them to bear.

To solve this problem, Kaikaye applied for an educational loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). The loan will be utilized to purchase her daughter's necessary books, pay the course fees, and enroll her in a private coaching class. Kaikaye is hopeful that the loan will help her daughter to go one step closer to her goals.

Kaikaye and Rita (in the photo) express their gratitude towards their generous lenders.

loans.use: to cover all the education related costs for her daughter.

loans.name: Malati

texts.en:
Malati is a 42 year old married woman. She is illiterate and can sign her name only . She lives with her husband and two children (a son and a daughter) at their own small house in the small village of Chuakhola in Falakata, Alipurduar districts, West Bengal, India. Her daughter has got married and her son is engaged in the gas supply business.

Malati's husband is a farmer; he is a hard worker and a very enterprising man and earns money for their livelihood. Malati also helps her husband financially by running her animal husbandry. She rears cattle and sells milk to the local villagers. She has been doing this business for many years and acquired many customers.

There is a huge demand for her milk in her local area. To use this opportunity, Malati wants to expand her business for more income. Thus Malati requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a dairy cow for her animal husbandry.

Malati's dream is to develop their business to give good financial support to her family and a better life to their children. In the future, she dreams of a concrete house with the profit from her business.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk selling business.

loans.name: Siring's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le premier cycle du banc villageois et il composé de femmes issues du même quartiers unies par de bonnes relations de voisinages.
Madame Siring la présidente est une femme mariée âgée de 43 ans et mère de 9 enfants dont 6 filles et 3 garçons.
Elle s'activa dans l'aviculture et elle dispose d'une expérience dans ce domaine.
Avec son nouveau crédit de cinq cent mille francs CFA Elle va acheter des poussins ,des sacs d'aliments de volaille de la patte d'arachide et de l'huile de palme.
Les bénéfices tirés de son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires de sa famille et de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group was established during the banc villageois' first cycle and is made up of women from the same neighborhoods, united by strong neighborhood relationships.

Mrs. Siring, the [group's] president, is a married 43-year-old woman and the mother of nine children, six girls and three boys. She is active in poultry farming and has experience in this industry.

With her new loan of 150,000 CFA francs, Mrs. Siring is going to purchase chicks, sacks of poultry feed, ground nut paste, and palm oil. The profits from her business will allow Mrs. Siring to see to her family's dietary needs and to increase her savings with the banc villageois.

loans.use: to purchase chicks that she will raise, and to run a small business [selling] various goods.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 44 years old and married with five children, one of whom in school.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Leonida is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds.

Leonida has been pig fattening  for 1 year and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds

loans.name: Abakoranabushake Group

texts.en:
Christine is a group leader, aged 32. She is married without children. The group is called Abakoranabushake, which means “Volunteers” in English. They sell different products, and they wish to expand their business for changing their future for the better. 

She sells clothes and has been doing so in a business for the past six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and make savings for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
Saraswati is a housewife who depends on her husband’s income for her daily needs and to manage her household. Her spouse is the only wage earner of the family. She is 48 years old and a mother of four daughters. One of her daughters, Aparna, is 20 year old and reads in grade 12 at Gosseirhat Rajamohon High School. Saraswati lives in Dhupguri in the Jalpaiguri district.

Saraswati looks after the household chores daily, and three of her daughters are married. Her husband is a driver by profession. The small income he derives from his work hardly meets their household requirements. It is difficult for a low income family to manage the annual tuition fees for their daughter for each new session.

Her daughter Aparna got good marks on the grade 11 exam. She has a dream to be a teacher in the future, so she wants to join coaching classes to score good marks on her grade 12 examination. She also needs different reference books and other educational materials for her present academic year.

Thus, Saraswati is applying for an education loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). With the Kiva loan, she will pay her daughter Aparna’s educational costs. Sarawati is very happy to avail the loan and said that now her loads are lightened.

Saraswati and Aparna (in the photo) are very happy for the loan and convey thanks to the lenders.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's grade 12 education.

loans.name: Raksmi

texts.en:
Raksmi is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 18 years old. She lives in a wooden pile house with her 20 years old sister, her 15 years old brother and her parents. Her brother is studying, her sister and her parents work in the fields. Her family owns 6 hectares of rice fields and 2 hectares of cassava fields.

In 2013 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Raksmi makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe.

She uses her weaving income to pay for her own expenses and to help her parents cover fees related to the fields. Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is the age of 40, living with her three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
Her husband has been providing floor polishing services for newly constructed houses. He polishes the concrete and marble floors by using his grinding machine.

A few days ago his polishing machine has become out of order due to fluctuation in electricity. For this is reason he wants to buy a new machine but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy new grinding machine.

Therefore, Najma has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy new grinding machine and can continue his services smoothly.
She thanks Kiva's honorable lenders and BRAC Pakistan over this support.

loans.use: to buy new grinding machine for her husband's floor polishing services.

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en:
Fadia is a 34 year old mother of four living with her husband in Chouf. Her children, two sons and two daughters, all go to school and her husband is a full time construction worker.

Four years ago, she started dedicating herself to working in embroidery and selling her handmade products in the area. Having always been ambitious, she sees it as a way to support her husband in improving her family's financial situation and providing their kids with decent living conditions. She now needs to upgrade her toolkit and buy some fabric to improve her products' quality.

Fadia is asking for a 1,851,680 Lebanese pounds loan from Kiva's field partner Ibdaa. This amount will allow her to buy a new set of scissors and needles as well as good quality fabric.

loans.use: to upgrade her toolkit with new scissors, needles and good quality fabric for her handmade  embroidery business.

loans.name: Herieth

texts.en:
Herieth, who is in her late 50's is married with four children, two of them are grown-pups and two are still in school. She has been running a pharmacy for ten years now. She works from 08am to 09pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Herieth's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase medicines in the pharmacy and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan, bought a plot of land, a TV set, a radio and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy the best selling medicines for her pharmacy. She dreams of building her own house.

Herieth will make sure she pays back the loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy stocks of the best selling medicines for her pharmacy,.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 36-year-old, married man from Jabalia city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, next to the Refugee Camp with the same name. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Mahmoud will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Mahmoud’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Mame Yacine's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois et il est composés de femmes unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Madame Yacine en est la responsable elle est mariée ,âgée de 60 ans et mère de 9 enfants.
Elle s'active dans le commerce par la vente de produits cosmétiques.
Avec son nouveau crédit de 500000 francs cfa elle va se payer de de s produits composés de lait de toilettes parfums et le reste des tissus qu'elle va revendre au détails au niveau de son quartier.
Elle capitalise beaucoup d’expérience pour avoir pratiquée cette activité depuis bientôt dix ans.
texts.en:
This group was established during the banc villageois' first cycle and is made up of women united by good personal and professional relationships.

Mrs. Yacine, the group's leader, is married, 60 years old, and the mother of nine children. She runs a business selling cosmetics. With her new loan of 500,000 CFA francs, Mrs. Yacine is going to purchase scented lotion/cream products, and will spend the rest on fabrics that she will resell at retail prices in her neighborhood.

Mrs. Yacine benefits from considerable experience, having been involved in this business for nearly 10 years.

loans.use: To purchase bales of fabric and cosmetics in order to run an income-generating activity.

loans.name: Upendo Gataro Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand is Naomi. She is fifty three years old with five children. She is married and lives with her family . Naomi farms beans and potatoes. She is grateful for the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa enterprise training she received, this equipped her with knowledge on enterprise management.

She is taking a loan from Kiva to buy fertilizer to boost her potato farming business. This will enable her to improve her production and thus more profits. She intends to use part of profit in providing food to the family and pay school fees.
Naomi is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to boost her potato farming business. This will enable her to improve her production and thus more profits.

loans.name: Githima Lower Hort Group

texts.en:
The person featured in the picture raising his hand is Bernard, 49 years old, married and has two children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to access financial management and enterprise development training. Since then Bernard has been able to acquire new skills and he has been able to manage his daily finances to provide for him and his family effectively. He operates a boda boda (motor cycle transport) business and farming which provides for his family's daily needs.

Bernard is applying for a loan to enable him diversify by purchasing seedlings, fertilizers and pesticides which will improve productivity in his farm. This will see an increase in his income and he will be able to utilize his farm by adding more crops which will boost his income. This will also be a source of employment for his wife who is a housewife. A portion of the income will be re invested in the business and the rest in improving their day to day living and getting better education for his children.
He is thankful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay back promptly.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertlizer to improve production on his farm thus more income for school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers for top dressing her crops to improve on the yields.

loans.name: Say's Group

texts.en:
Say, a farmer living in Kampong Thom province, is 59 years old and a mother of five children. She grows rice as her main source of income. She can get little yield from her rice farm because of her rice crop is not growing well. She has involved with her farming business for 20 years and it earns her only 15,700KHR per day.

For Say, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of seven members to get this Kiva loan and she will use her portion of loan to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can upgrade her family living to be better than before.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine to improve her family's standard of living and health.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 46 years old, married with six children, two of whom in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods to sell.

Jocelyn has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buy and sell rice.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Tichao's Group

texts.en:
A mother of seven children living in Kratie province, Tichao is 49 years old. Nowadays, she needs to support on five children, three of whom are still in school. Her main sources of income are from cassava growing and working as a labor on her co-villager's farm to get a fee. Her cassava was destroyed by insects, so she could not sell it in high price. She has involved with her cassava farming for ten years.

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of three, she is the group leader. She will manage her entire loan portion to buy organic pesticide to improve her cassava farming to produce more yields. She hopes that she can get a good yield, so that she can sell it in higher price than before.

loans.use: to buy organic pesticide to improve her cassava farming to produce more yields.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is 31 years old, separated with two children ages seven and three years old.

Melissa works in her children's school as a helper with no regular salary. Melissa used to sell breakfast such as (pancit) noodles, spaghetti, fried spring rolls (lumpia) and porridge (lugaw) in their community, but because her youngest child is hospitalized due to congenital illness and no support from her husband, the capital is used to pay for hospital expenses.

Melissa came to know SEED from the Savings Program organized in their community accompanied with business and financial management training. Melissa became a member to save for her children's school expenses and for unplanned events with a small amount of 20 PHP per week. Melissa's savings now is 2,000 PHP. 

She now wanted to start and open again her breakfast food vending business, and this time she wanted to sell her food in the school premises so she still can continue her work as a helper and watch her children while they study.

Melissa is requesting a loan amounting to 5,000 PHP to buy pork, chicken, pasta, vegetables, spices and other ingredients to cook breakfast and snacks to sell to her customers in the school area.

Melissa is hoping to increase her income and save more for the future of her children.

*SEED start-up loan program are loans with no interest bearing and for the underprivileged individuals with no/limited knowledge on business but wanted to put up a business. Accompanied by intensive business coaching and continued business and financial training support.

loans.use: To buy pork, chicken, pasta, vegetables, spices and other ingredients to cook breakfast and snacks to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Wega Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Gladys, a member of Wega Self Help Group. She is sixty one years old, married and blessed with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014.
Gladys is a farmer who grows maize, potatoes and beans. Prior to joining Hand in Hand Eastern Africa she was doing subsistence farming. However, after undergoing HiHEA’s training on enterprise development and financial management, she has since commercialized her farming business.

She is borrowing from Kiva in order to buy fertilizer and seeds so as to increase her farm produce and increase income from the sale of potatoes and maize to her customers. She hopes this extra income will enable her cater for her family’s needs such as food, shelter and school fees for her children.
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds so as to increase her farm produce.

loans.name: Mujeres Forjadoras Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “mujeres forjadoras” y está conformado por 06 socias comprometidas y responsables. Gélida de 34 años de edad es conviviente con 2 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos lo cual lo realiza desde hace más de 15 años. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su calidad de vida gracias al préstamo podrá implementar más su negocio. Su último crédito lo destinará para  la compra de zapatos de temporada otoño invierno. El grupo “mujeres forjadoras” agradece a las personas de kiva por hacer posible éste crédito. Gélida se encuentra en la parte posterior es la primera del lado derecho y lleva en brazos a su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
This is the group Mujeres Forjadoras, and it is made up of six responsible and committed members. Gélida, 34 years old, lives with her partner and her two children.

She sells shoes for a living, which she has done for over 15 years. By making sacrifices, she has been able to improve her quality of life. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to expand her business. She will use her last loan to buy shoes for the fall and winter season.

The group Mujeres Forjadoras is very grateful to the people at Kiva for making this loan possible. 

Gélida is the first one on the right in the back row. She is holding her small daughter in her arms.

loans.use: to buy shoes for the fall and winter season.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell herbal medicine business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of herbal medicine to sell for her buy and sell herbal medicine business.

Lucia has been in this business for 18 years. Lucia earns more income from general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of herbal medicine to sell

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz de 50 años es una habitante de un barrio ubicado en el municipio de Cartagena que luego de enfrentarse a una situación dolorosa por el fallecimiento de su cónyuge, tuvo que emprender su propio negocio para poder sustentarse.  Aunque no pudo tener un amplio proceso de adaptación emocional luego de pérdida de su cónyuge, logró salir adelante gracias a sus conocimientos culinarios y la incorporación a las ventas por catálogos.  Ella ofrece servicio de banquetes y eventos, y para contar con otro ingreso adicional comercializa entre sus conocidos, familiares y amigos, productos para aseo en el hogar y una línea amplia de cosméticos, cremas para el cuidado de la piel y demás artículos de la demanda del catálogo.  Actualmente está aplicando a una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  que invertirá en una estufa de mayor capacidad, utensilios de cocina, víveres y productos del catálogo.  Con esta inversión tendrá la indumentaria necesaria para su negocio de comidas y responderá a encargos de sus clientes.  Su meta es mudar su microempresa a un local propio y costearle los estudios profesionales a su hijo.
texts.en:
Luz is a 50 year-old inhabitant of a  neighborhood in the city of Cartagena. After experiencing a painful situation due to the passing of her husband, she had to learn her own business in order to support herself. Although she didn't have ample time for emotional adjustment after the loss of her husband, she was able to get ahead thanks to her culinary knowledge and the addition of catalogue sales. 

She offers banquet and event services. In order to get additional income, she will market grooming products, an ample line of cosmetics, skin creams, and other items in demand from the catalogue among people she knows, family members, and friends. 

She is currently applying for a loan, which is her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest it in a higher capacity stove, cooking utensils, food products, and catalogue products. With this investment she will have the necessary inventory for her food business and will be able to fulfill her clients' orders. 

Her goal is to move her micro-enterprise into her own shop and pay for her son's education.

loans.use: to invest in a higher capacity stove, cooking utensils, and food and catalogue products.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 32 years old and married with three children, who are in school, Juliet works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soap, shampoo, rice, etc. to sell.

Juliet has been in this business for 3 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soap, shampoo, rice, etc. to sell

loans.name: Philis

texts.en:
Meet Philis, a very hardworking, energetic young farmer. Although she has only farmed for the past ten years, she is working hard and learning good farming practices. Through the profits she makes from keeping cows and goats, she has been able to take care of her family and provide the basic needs for her parents. Philis lives near Matisi in the Kitale area of Kenya, an area with good weather patterns and favorable weather conditions that support farming.

Maize is a very common crop in Kenya and is a staple food for many who regularly eat “ugali,“ or hard porridge cooked from maize. One can usually buy sifted maize flour in the market, but its cost is higher because of the processing. Flour can be less expensive, however, if it is milled directly using a posho mill. The Matisi area has only one diesel posho mill that serves a great number of people. The main problem here is that the posho mill keeps breaking down so farmers cannot grind their maize.

Philis intends to change this by buying another posho mill to serve the area. She will buy an electric, rather than diesel, posho mill, as they are more reliable. To accomplish this, Philis is applying for a 60,000 KES loan through Juhudi Kilimo to buy a mill. Profits derived from the mill will be used to comfortably repay the loan. In the next two years, Philis sees herself established and running more than one posho mill. She patiently waits for your kindness.
You can help Philis fulfill her dream and improve her business with a loan that could change her life.

loans.use: to buy an electric posho (cornmeal) mill.

loans.name: Davidine

texts.fr: Davidine remercie beaucoup tous les emprunteurs de son prêt précédent avec lequel elle a pu acheter quelques produits et matériels supplémentaires pour satisfaire les besoins et demandes de ses clients. Elle voudrait encore continuer à améliorer et développer son salon, c'est pourquoi elle demande un autre crédit, avec lequel elle va acheter 2 tables coiffeuses et 2 fers supplémentaires et quelques produits comme masques et shampoo de bonnes marques. Son désire d'avancer et de devenir professionnel dans ce domaine ne cesse pas de la  motiver à continuer à lutter ainsi que l'amélioration du niveau de vie de sa famille en générale.
texts.en:
Davidine sincerely thanks all the lenders to her previous loan, with which she was able to purchase several additional products and materials to meet the needs and requests of her customers. She would like to continue to improve and grow her salon, which is why she is requesting another loan, with which she will purchase two salon stations and two additional irons, as well as several products like masks and good quality shampoos.

Davidine's desire to continue to move forward and to become a professional in this industry keeps her continually motivated to fight for improvements to her family's general quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase two salon stations, two irons, masks, and Elsève shampoo.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is 43 years old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two sons and two daughters, who are in school. Her husband has been running her own business of clothes selling for 7 years. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these clothes.

Therefore Nargis is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. She can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.
Nargis is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's clothing business.

loans.name: Jennife

texts.en:
Jennife is 34 years old with 2 children ages 9 and 3 years old.
Her husband is a helper in a clothes store in the market with below minimum wage which barely supporting their needs. 

She tried to find work to help her husband but she still needs to take care of her 2 children and her educational status also makes also it difficult for her to find work.

Jennife came to know SEED through a Savings Program organized in their community. Jennife became a member and also attend financial and business management training. Jennife saves for her children school expenses such as projects, school materials and tuition.

Jennife wanted to put up a buy and sell clothing business in their area to gain an income to help with their expenses.

Jennife is requesting a loan amounting to PhP 5,000 to buy 5 dozen shirts, 3 dozen shorts and other clothes to sell.

Jennife is hoping that with the loan she will able to put up a business to help them in their basic needs and also to save for her children education.

Jennife's dream is to provide better future for her family and education for her children.

*SEED start-up loan Program are loans with no interest bearing and for the underprivileged individuals with no/limited knowledge on business but wanted to put up a business. Accompanied with Intensive business coaching and continues business and financial training support.

loans.use: To buy 5 dozen shirts,  3 dozen shorts and other clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fehmi

texts.en:
Fehmi wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan he was given. With the help he was able to replace his doors and windows, improving his living conditions for his family. Now, he is requesting a loan in order to restore the facade on the outside of his home. He hopes that this loan will complete the work needed on his house and improve the general living conditions. He also believes that it will help to further insulate his home and help to keep his utility costs down in the winter season and his family healthier.

He is very grateful for the second opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to rebuild the facade on the outside of his home.

loans.name: Raja Group

texts.en:
In February 2014 Laiza realised that she could take advantage of the fact that she has a passport by crossing to South Africa for procuring clothes for resale. Business started to grow gradually until she decided to rent a flea market table in town. The flea market table is located in a very busy place with high completion of sales. For her to survive the competition she has to have larger quantities of stock and a different variety. Sometimes the cost of transporting her goods from South Africa to Zimbabwe can be so high especially the duty aspect such that she suffers from losses.

Laiza and three zealous women with the same need as hers joined together and formed the Rajo group. They were trained and have gained so much knowledge especially on the aspect of keeping savings as financial security. With the loan she hopes to restock more quantities at once and she is looking forward to growing her business so that she moves from a flea market into a boutique.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers and herbicides to spray her crops to improve on the yields.

loans.name: Bright Ideas Group

texts.en:
Stembeni, aged 47 is a married mother of two. Her principal activity is tailoring and she makes school uniforms, mattresses and bags. She started her tailoring business in 1996. Back then, she used to operate in the Central Business District of Harare. As time went by, rents and rates at her workplace began to rise and this increased her cost of sales. She then got a residential stand in the town of Dzivarasekwa and after building a temporary structure, she started operating from home. This has helped her to reduce her cost of sales and increase her profits. She has supplemented the income she gets from her husband and that from the business to construct her house which is about to be complete.

After having been told about Thrive by other members in the neighbourhood, they formed their group of four mature ladies and named it the Bright Ideas group. The have since started to attend training offered at Thrive and these have been helpful in that they have improved in marketing their products form the marketing trainings offered at Thrive. Stembeni and her group have applied for a loan and she believes that with this loan she can increase her supply of mattresses to meet her increasing demand for bedding.

loans.use: to purchase mattresses and other bedding materials for resale.

loans.name: Nazareth Group

texts.es:
la asociación comunal Nazaret esta conformada por nueve integrantes seis mujeres y tres hombres padres y madres responsables con quince hijos menores de edad, son originarios de Malpaisillo lugar que esta ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracteriza por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal, como todas las  personas tienen metas y objetivos como es brindarles estudios a sus hijos, hacer crecer el negocios, etc.
gracia a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Lilliam y tiene por actividad económica la crianza y venta de cerdos en pie, en la actualidad luchan para salir adelante el objetivo del crédito es invertir en la compra de un lote de cerdos para la venta, ella tiene cinco años de tener el negocio, actividad que la desempeña en su casa de habitación. la asociación comunal Nazaret agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos  y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Nazareth communal bank is made up of nine members; six women and three men, responsible fathers and mothers, with fifteen children who are minors. They are from Malpaisillo, which is located in the northern part of the region. They are known for being hardworking and responsible people, with a desire for personal success. Like anybody else, they have goals and ambitions such as enabling their children to study, growing their business etc.

Thanks to her desire to succeed, the coordinator is Lilliam. She raises and sells live pigs. Currently, she is struggling to get ahead. The purpose of the credit is to invest in a batch of pigs to sell. She has been running this business for five years, which allows her to repay her house. The Nazareth communal bank would like to thank Kiva lender for the help that they are offering to low-income people and poor countries such as Nicaragua so that people can have a decent livelihood.

loans.use: to invest in a batch of pigs to sell.

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.en:
Ulugbek was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1997. He graduated from highschool with excellence and entered the university and has decided to become a doctor.

His parents are workers. His father is an emigrant and works in Russia. His mother is a trader, she works at domestic market.

He is a responsible well known student at university and among friends. He likes to study and wants to be professional. He wishes to be helpful for social change in his country.

He appealed to IMON and Kiva asking for a loan to pay his tuition fees in his medical studies. He hopes to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay his university fees for studying to become a doctor

loans.name: Intelligent Group

texts.en:
Ongai is a married mother of 4, she is 39 years old and lives in a cottage attached to a school where her husband works as a security guard. After realising that her husband’s income was not enough for the family, Ongai decided to start her own business in 2009.

She is in the business of recycling PVC material. She goes to dumpsites and collect PVC litter usually in the form of hosepipes, rubber boots and drip cables. She then transports them to a grinding mill where they are refined into fine PVC substances which she then sell to a local shoe manufacturing company.

Ongai together with her other group members joined Thrive in June 2015 and received business advice which she said were very helpful to her and is very appreciative for these trainings. They have applied for a combined loan of $US 1,450 and she wants to use her portion of the loan amount to transport many tonnes of PVC material from dumpsites to the grinding mill and also to pay for the refinery charges. Ongai said she has a long term plan of buying her own grinding mill and start to refine PVC on her own selling to shoe manufacturing companies.

loans.use: to transport PVC waste in bulk for recycling.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гульнара, 51 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитали 3 детей. У нее - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 21 год назад, с 7,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гульнары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 0,32 ГА земельной доли, на которой она ежегодно выращивает картофель, также есть 2 коровы, 5 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 14,800 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульнара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку породистой дойной коровы для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Гульнара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Gulnara is 51 years old, married, and she and her husband have raised three children. She has a secondary education. She rears animals and grows crops as the main source of income for her family, having started 21 years ago with 7,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulnara's hard work, today she has 0.32 hectares of land on which she grows potatoes each year. She also has two cows and five sheep. Her monthly income is 14,800 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, Gulnara has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy a purebred dairy cow to increase her organic milk sales. Gulnara plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further increasing her number of domestic livestock.

loans.use: to buy a purebred dairy cow in order to increase her organic milk sales.

loans.name: Mateus

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Masssinga Província de Inhambane, tem 42 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é pai de 6 filhos que se encontram a estudar, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
É negociante a mais de 10 anos. Com este empréstimo pretende aumentar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo produtos da primeira necessidade como: açúcar, amendoim, feijão e mais. 
Futuramente pretende abrir um estabelecimento comercial em sua casa, iniciar um negocio de estaleiro para venda de material construção.
texts.en:
He was born in Massinga, Inhambane province. He is 42 years old, married, and the father of six children who go to school. He is not responsible for anyone else.

He has worked as a businessman for more than ten years. With this loan, he is planning to expand his business by purchasing essential products such as sugar, peanuts, beans, and corn.

In the future, he is planning to open a commercial establishment at home, and start a business selling construction materials.

loans.use: to buy sugar, peanuts, beans and corn.

loans.name: Raheela

texts.en:
Raheela is 37 years old woman, who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with with her one son and one daughter, who are in school. Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for 7 years.

Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Raheela is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.

Raheela is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's clothing business.

loans.name: El Tule Sur Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACIÓN COMUNAL TULE SUR ESTA CONFORMADA POR OCHO INTEGRANTES SIETE MUJERES Y UN HOMBRES, SON ORIGINARIOS DEL SAUCE, LUGAR QUE SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADOR, RESPONSABLE CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL,TODOS TIENEN DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES ECONOMICA, PERO LUCHAN DÍA  A DÍA PARA PODER SALIR ADELANTE Y VENCER CUALQUIER OBTACULO QUE SE LES PRESENTE, A TRAVÉS DE SU PERSEVERANCIA HAN DESARROLLADOS SUS NEGOCIO Y SU CRECIMIENTO PERSONAL, Y LE HA AYUDADO A CUMPLIR METAS Y OBJETIVOS COMO BRINDARLES ESTUDIOS A SUS HIJOS, TERMINAR SUS CASAS, Y PRINCIPALMENTE HACER CRECER SUS NEGOCIOS.

LA CORDINADORA ES NIDIA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA DE GRANOS BÁSICOS EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN DESDE HACE DIES AÑOS,QUE DESEMPEÑA DICHA ACTIVIDAD, LA RUTINA DE TRABAJO DE ESTA MUJER ES DE UNAS OCHO HORAS DIRÍAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS. EL NEGOCIO CONSISTE EN VENDER GRANOS COMO: ARROZ, FRIJOLES, AZÚCAR, CEREALES, ACEITE, JABÓN, DETERGENTES. ETC.
texts.en:
The Asociación Comunal Tule Sur is made up of eight members (seven women and one man). They are originally from El Sauce, a place which is known for its hard-working, responsible people who have a desire to improve themselves. They all do different economic activities, but they fight day by day to be able to get ahead and to overcome any obstacle which presents itself. Through their perseverance they have developed their businesses and grown in themselves, and that has helped them to achieve goals and objectives like providing an education for their children, completing their homes, and primarily growing their businesses.
The group coordinator is Nidia and her business is selling staple products. Her business is run from her home, and for the last ten years that she has been performing this activity her work schedule has been offering her products for eight hours per day. The business consists of selling staple products such as rice, beans, sugar, cereals, oil, soap, detergents, etc.

loans.use: to buy staple products such as sugar, rice, beans, cereals, oats, soap, etc.

loans.name: Adelia

texts.pt:
A Sra. Adélia tem 55 anos de idade, solteira, mãe de cinco filhos dos quais quatro na sua responsabilidade e 1 maior de idade e está no lar. Sustenta ainda 4 netos que frequentam o ensino primário.
Trabalha como operadora de máquinas de refrigerantes há 33 anos e com o empréstimo de 40.000,00mts pretende comprar material de construção como: cimento, varões, pedra, área, tinta para dar continuidade da sua obra.
Ela sonha em concluir a sua casa de modo a melhorar as condições habitacionais e confortar a sua família, assim como melhorar as condições da dieta alimentar.
Esta senhora tem o desafio de reembolsar o empréstimo o mais rápido possível e solicitar outros financiamentos.
texts.en:
Adélia is 55 years old, single, and the mother of five children; four of them are under her care, and the other one is an adult and has his/her own home. She currently sustains four children who attend primary school.

She has worked as a refrigerating machine operator for 33 years. With a loan of 40,000 MZN, she is planning to buy construction materials such as cement, beams, gravel, sand, and paint to continue with the construction works.

She dreams of finishing building her house in order to improve her living conditions and give her family a comfortable home, and of improving their food intake.

She faces the challenges of paying off the loan as soon as possible, and applying for more loans.

loans.use: to buy cement, beans, gravel, sand and paint to continue with the construction works.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
Osman is 33 years old and the father of 5 children, living together in the Ashkali community. As with all of the Ashkali community members, they live in very poor conditions in old homes. He is very fortunate to be employed and is the main source of income for his family, working for a furniture company delivering purchases to customers.

The house that he is living in is very old and is in urgent need of renovation before the winter season comes. The improvements in his home will help to keep his family safe and healthy, creating better insulation and living conditions. He also hopes that it will help him to save money on utility costs and keep his family from getting ill in the cold and wet season. He promises to pay on time and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to renovate his house before the winter season comes.

loans.name: Robelyn

texts.en:
She is Robelyn, a 48-year-old resident of Manila, Philippines. She operates her own “sari-sari” (variety) store and she profits well from this. Robelyn values the security of the future of her family so she is working hard to help provide for their daily needs and have enough savings at the same time.

A variety store looks like a typical small convenience store which offers groceries, toiletries, beverages and other items at cheaper price. Aside from these items, Robelyn also offers different varieties of Filipino rice like Sinandomeng, dinorado, angelica, malagkit (sticky rice), etc. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

There are times that her income is insufficient. She is even struggling when her children are sick and she has to use part of her working capital for their medication. This is why Robelyn is asking for an additional loan assistance worth Php 10,000 which she will be using to purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries, beverages and varieties or rice needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Robelyn wants her store to become a supermarket. She dreams to give her family a good life and a stable source of income. She also aims to establish additional business which she can pass on to her children in the future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies. 

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of grocery items and varieties of Filipino rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow for milk supply and for income.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase five gallons of palm oil and bag of pepper for her business

loans.name: Fareeda

texts.en:
Fareeda is 50 years old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her one son and one daughter. Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for 10 years. Her husband needs clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these clothes.

Therefore Fareeda is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. She can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.
Fareeda is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's clothing business.

loans.name: Suman

texts.en:
Suman was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1997. She graduated from her high school with excellence. After her graduation she entered university and has chosen to become a doctor and help people. She wants to be a specialist on pharmacy.

Her parents are workers. His father is a tutor and mother is a housekeeper. She is willing to work for a higher degree education and appealed to IMON to get a loan to pay her studies at college. She awaits your compassion and support.

loans.use: to help pay her university studies to become a doctor.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.pt:
A sra Albertina tem 30 anos de idade, separada e mãe de um filho. Vive em casa dos pais juntamente com o seu filho que frequenta 3a classe. Tem mercearia numa das ruas movimentadas da cidade e com o empréstimo pretende comprar, refrescos, sumos, lâmpadas, arroz, pão, amendoim, farinha de trigo e de milho, peixe, frangos pra revender para revender.
Ela sonha em ampliar o seu negócio e  construir a sua casa. O seu desafio é reembolsar o empréstimo dentro do prazo estabelecido
texts.en:
Albertina, 30, is separated and has a son. She lives with her parents, together with her son, who is in third grade. She has a store located in a transited street in city.

With the loan, she is planning to buy beverages, juices, light bulbs, rice, bread, peanuts, wheat and corn flour, fish, and chickens for resale.

She dreams of being able to expand her business and build her own house. She faces the challenge of paying off the loan according to plan.

loans.use: to buy beverages, juices, light bulbs, rice, bread, peanuts, wheat and corn flour, fish, and chickens for resale.

loans.name: Norie

texts.en:
Norie is married with one child and works hard to support her family. She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish, sacks of salt, and other materials for her business.

Norie has been in this business for three years now and also earns income from fish vending. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish, sacks of salt, and other materials for her business

loans.name: Mayssaa

texts.en:
Mayssaa's first loan from Kiva field partner Ibdaa successfully allowed her to boost her sales and number of clients served in her grocery store located in a Palestinian camp in North Lebanon.
