She used the first loan to increase her shop's supplies, satisfy the demand, and maintain a good reputation among her clients. With this income increase, she was able to support her husband in providing better living conditions to their three children, who still go to school.

Mayssaa is now asking for a 2,313,998 LBP (Lebanese pounds) loan from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She will be using the amount to once again increase her supplies and diversify her products, hoping to see her business expand and her children succeeding at school.

loans.use: to diversify her grocery store's supplies

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene es una confeccionista con una gran trayectoria y experiencia, cuya inclinación por esta profesión fue motivada por su padre quien le propuso estudiar un arte y la inscribió en una academia mientras se encontraba cursando el bachillerato.  Tiempo después la emplearon en un hotel, sin embargo el rol que desempeñó no era de su agrado y fue su motor para arriesgarse a iniciar su taller de confecciones, en el que su éxito no se hizo esperar. En la actualidad cuenta con treinta años de funcionamiento y  todos los días inicia su producción a partir de las 6 a.m. elaborando ropa para damas, caballeros, niños y uniformes para empresas, sus prendas son elaboradas a la medida del cliente y de acuerdo a sus especificaciones; manteniendo diseños innovadores y de excelente calidad. Marlene está aplicando a una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en adecuaciones al local para ampliarlo, comprar nuevas vitrinas y materias primas.  Es muy importante esta inversión puesto que manejará un mejor costo de las materias primas al adquirirlas al por mayor y sus ganancias serán más representativas. De esta manera se acercará más a su meta de tener su propia boutique en su residencia.
texts.en: Marlene is a clothing maker with an outstanding work history and long experience. Her pursuit of this profession was inspired by her father, who suggested that she study one of the arts and signed her up for an academy while she was finishing secondary school. A little while later, she worked in a hotel, but she wasn't satisfied with the position she occupied there, and this was her impetus to take the risk of setting up her own dressmaking workshop, where she didn't have to wait to achieve success. She has now been doing this work for thirty years. Every day she starts production at 6 a.m., creating clothing for men, women and children as well as company uniforms. Her garments are made to order for each customer, according to his or her specifications, while maintaining innovative designs and excellent quality. Marlene is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will invest the funds in improving her shop in order to expand it, purchasing new display cases and raw materials. This investment is very important, since she will be able to buy her materials wholesale at a lower cost, and her profits will be more respectable. In this way, she will get closer to her goal of having her own boutique in her home.

loans.use: to invest in buying new display cases and raw materials to improve and expand her workshop.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 55 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and 3 children. Her husband is an electrician and he has been running his electrical store.

Asia's husband has to purchase electronic merchandise e.g wires, tube lights, plug shoes, and other electric devices but due to insufficient financial means her husband cannot afford to purchase these items for business purposes.

Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. So that she can help her husband to purchase these merchandises as per his business needs. This loan will also help her husband to increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit.
Asia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's electrical business.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 32 years old. He is married with four children. He has had a business of selling tea for seven years. He will be using the loan to purchase more tea and hopes this will help him pay school fees.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to purchase more tea for sale to help him pay school fees.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
Her name is May, aged 41, from the province of Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Jonathan, an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker) and they have two children of which one is in College and the other one is in High School. Although her husband is an OFW, she thought of putting up a small general store not only to keep herself busy but also to earn extra income to adequately meet their daily household needs and more importantly to send her children to private schools. school. 

May has been operating her store for eight years already. Her earnings has greatly helped cover their daily sustenance. She sells dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. All products are essential food items. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store means a lot to her since it has been their main source of income when her husband was not an OFW yet.

To help her expand her business, she is requesting a Php 19000 loan which she will use to buy additional sacks of rice and other grocery items such as can goods, instant noodles, biscuits, soda, toiletries, etc. Although there are times she has difficulty collecting her receivable from some of her customers she still maintains a positive and understanding attitude towards them. 

May dreams of having a big grocery store someday and of course to see both her children finish college and become successful professionals. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda works hard to support her family. Florenda is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, coffee, milk, sugar, etc.

Florenda has been in this business for 20 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Florenda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, coffee, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Jack Pot Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Aminata is 45 years old, married, and has two children age 20 and 18 years old. She is a member of Jack Pot Solidarity Group (see group picture; Aminata stands on the left). She sells powdered milk.

Aminata has been selling milk for the past five years. She uses proceeds of her business to pay for her children’s education and to provide a livelihood for her family. She has been able to assist her family with some domestic problems from savings she made from her business. She hopes that her business continues to exist so that she can save enough money to build a dwelling house and educate her children well.

Aminata and the other group members of Jack Pot Solidarity Group are requesting their first loan. They are in need of a group loan of 4,000,000 SLL. Of this amount, Aminata will personally receive 1,000,000 SLL, which she will use to purchase another two bags of powdered milk for her business. Aminata and her group members thank you for financing their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase another two bags of powdered milk for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy five gallons of palm oil, one carton of fish and two bags of rice for her business

loans.name: Balasamuthiram Jlg-002 Group

texts.en:
Sharmila is the leader of the Balasamuthiram JLG 002 group and the group has 4 other members. Sharmila is 21 and married. She earns her daily wages by doing manual labour on agricultural fields. She wants to supplement her income and ensure there is a more steady source of income to support her family. The current household income would not sustain her family in future. This is why she underwent a training from GMF in making masala powder. Now she, along with other members of the group has applied for a loan to start her own small business.

The loan amount will be used to purchase bulk stock of raw materials required for the business. They are confident that earnings post the loan will be much better and will go a long way in helping their families.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making masala powder.

loans.name: Sisi Kwa Sisi Group

texts.en:
Paulina who is in her late 40s is single with three children, two of them are still in school and one is grown up. She has been a food vendor for three years now and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Paulina’s 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to increase on her food stock and serve more customers. She dreams of being an international business woman.

Paulina will share this loan with her loan group Sisi kwa Sisi which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on food stock and serve more customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add a dairy cow to improve on milk production for supply to the local creamery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain and service his motorcycle to be able to serve his customers satisfaction.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell sacks business in the Philippines, She also earns additional income from buy and sell rice, frozen food and general store. Helen is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks to sell for her buy and sell sacks business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks to sell

loans.name: Jlg-006-Sooriyanur Group

texts.en:
Devi has formed a self-help group with her friends in Kulithalai, in the rural part of Karur, Tamil Nadu. She works hard to support her family, and saves diligently to secure the future. However, the household income is not adequate for them to access basic necessities like toilets in their home. They have to trek long distances at dawn to use the fields to relieve themselves. This puts them at risk of infection, molestation or attack, and even insect or animal bites.

So, taking advantage of the awareness initiatives, the group now seeks a loan of Rs. 56000 to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will provide these 4 families the privacy of using their own toilet, which will be a big step towards a better standard of living for them. Higher standards of hygiene will also lead to reduced medical expenses, and hence, more savings in the long run.

loans.use: to build toilets in their homes.

loans.name: Immaculate Group

texts.en:
Isha is a member of Immaculate Group. She is married with three children, ages 13, 11 and 7 and all in.school. In the group picture, Isha is in the middle..
Ten years ago Isha established her medicine business to support her children in school.  She pays school fees, buys learning material and provides food from the profit she gets from the business. She sells six days per week from 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.

Isha plans to use the loan to buy 10 dozen different types of drugs/medicines for resale. She will use the proceeds from the business to open a savings account which will be used to pay her children's school fees.
Isha and her group members need a loan totaling 5,000,000 SLL of which Isha is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL.
Isha plans to give her children the best education, build a house and live a happy life.
Isha and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy 10 dozens of different types of drugs/medicines for resale

loans.name: Jlg-001-Kottaiyar Thottam Group

texts.en:
The sanitation crisis in India is a result of poor infrastructure and lack of education. This group of four, led by Vani, living in Kulithalai in the state of Tamil Nadu understands the importance of having a toilet at home. Vani is 31 years old and has a family size of two. They do not have the means to build a toilet. With no access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private: in dense bushes or isolated fields. The women and girls, seeking privacy, often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves. They are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites.

Taking matters into their own hands, Vani and her group want to build toilets for themselves in their own homes. They seek a loan of 56,000 INR to cover the cost of raw materials and labor for constructing these toilets. Your loan will provide these four families the privacy of using their own toilet, which will be a big step towards a better standard of living for them. Higher standards of hygiene will also lead to reduced medical expenses, and hence, more savings in the long run.

loans.use: to construct a toilet and improve sanitation facilities in her home.

loans.name: Jlg-007-Veeravalli Group

texts.en:
The sanitation crisis in India is a result of poor infrastructure and lack of education. This group of four, led by Rani, lives in Kulithalai, in the state of Tamil Nadu has understood the importance of having a toilet at home. Rani is 43 years old and has a family pf five. They do not have the means to build a toilet. With no access to a toilet, their families have to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private: in dense bushes or isolated fields. Their women and girls, seeking privacy, often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves. These families, especially their women and daughters, are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites. 

Taking matters into their own hands, Rani and her group members want to build toilets for themselves in their own homes. They seek a loan of 56,000 INR to cover the cost of materials and labor for constructing these toilets. Your loan will help their families access basic sanitation, improved health, and safety.

loans.use: To construct toilets and improve sanitation facilities in her home

loans.name: Bomba Stars Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Kankoh is a 42-year-old business woman. She is a member of Bomba Stars Solidarity Group, which has four members who are all women. (In group picture, Kankoh at the far left).
Thirty five years ago, Kankoh established her pepper business to support her children in their schooling. She pays school fees, buys learning materials and provides food for her children. She opens her business six days in a week from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. 

Bomba Stars Sollidarity Group needs a total loan of 8,000,000 SLL.  Kankoh is entitled to 2,000,000 SLL which she will use to buy five bags of pepper and 50 rubbers of palm oil for her business.
She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Kankoh is married with three children, ages 18, 12, and 7 and all in school. 
In the feature, Kankoh plans to save more money to provide for her children’s university education. She believes educating her children to university level will better their lives.
Kankoh and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy pepper and palm oil for her business

loans.name: Maxam Solidarity Group

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Marie, who is married with seven children. Some of her children go to school.

Marie belongs to a solidarity group of five women who have come together to complement each other in achieving their individual dreams. “Maxam” is the name of Marie’s solidarity group. (See group picture; Marie is in the middle).

Maxam Solidarity Group needs a total loan of 7,000,000 SLL. Marie will receive 1,500,000 SLL, which she needs in order to purchase 15 gallons of cooking oil for her business.

Marie established her cooking oil business 15 years ago to ensure her family gets enough money for their basic needs. Marie uses profit from this business to provide a livelihood for her family and support her children’s education. Marie is a hardworking women. She opens her business Monday through Saturday every week from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

In the future, Marie plans to build a house and to support her children to acquire university education. She thanks you for supporting them.

loans.use: to purchase 15 gallons of cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 37 years old, is married and has three children. She keeps cows and also operates a retail shop and has been in the business for 15 years. This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya.

She will use the loan to buy stock of milk, sugar, salt, cooking oil etc. for her shop. She will use profits from expanded business to service the loan and increase her savings account to enable her borrow a bigger loans.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to be financially stable

loans.use: to buy animal feeds and stock of sugar and cooking oil for her shop.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en: Everline, a 30-year-old mother, is a wise farmer who is respected by her neighbors and fellow farmers as a mentor. Last year, she experienced a great joy in life: she became a mother for the fourth time. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kitale, which is in the Rift valley region of Kenya. Everline is happily married and is blessed with a lovely family. For the past 10 years, she has been involved in maintaining dairy cows and growing maize and vegetables. Everline has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She earns profits selling a variety of food crops, but she is faced with the challenge of delivering the produce in a timely manner to the market. This challenge has not made her give up, and she states, “I have to do something for my family.“ Everline joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a micro finance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She requests a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Everline is from a remote village that has poor roads, and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge. She has suffered many losses of perishable products (milk, vegetables, and tomatoes) that require timely delivery to the market. This loan will help Everline to achieve her dream and reach her goals. Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Everline feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva that help women to gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. The benefits of this loan are significant because Everline will never suffer losses due to delay in delivering produce to the market. She will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. Her income will increase. Everline is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike and help with farm work. Everline will use the loan to improve her living conditions and assure her children of a secure future. With your contribution this farmer will be able to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport her farm products to market.

loans.name: Heidy Yamileth

texts.es:
Heidi, de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casada y su esposo al igual que ella se dedica al comercio de pan, tienen un hijo de tres años de edad.

Heidi, tiene una venta de pan y esta actividad la realizan desde hace cinco años y ellos trabajan todos los días desde muy temprano y salen a repartir el pan en una motocicleta.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar insumos para la panadería y para reparar la motocicleta en donde salen a vender, porque es la herramienta que ellos utilizan para poder distribuir el pan.

Sus sueños son, tener su propia vivienda y que su hijo tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Heidi, age twenty, studied until the sixth grade. She is married and her husband sells bread, as does she. They have a three-year-old son.

Heidi sells bread. They have been doing this work for five years. Every day they start working very early and go out on a motorcycle to distribute the bread.

She needs the loan to purchase baking supplies, and to repair the motorcycle on which they go out to make their sales because that is the tool that they use to distribute the bread.

Her dreams are: to have her own home, and that her son may have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase baking supplies and to repair the motorcycle that she uses to go out to make her sales.

loans.name: Asel

texts.ru: Асель, 45 лет, не замужем, есть ребенок - школьник. У нее высшее образование,  уже более 10 лет работает проводником на железной дороге. Заработная плата Асель - 9,990 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS), на полученные средства она планирует утеплить свой дом, установив теплый пол, пластиковые окна и сделав мелкий косметический ремонт. Свои доходы Асель будет направлять на дальнейшее улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en:
Asel is 45 years old, not married, and has a school-aged child. She has a post-secondary education, and has worked for more than 10 years as a railway conductor. Asel's salary is 9,990 som (KGS).

Asel has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS). She plans to insulate her house with the borrowed funds, installing a warm floor, plastic windows, and do some small cosmetic repairs. Asel plans to use her profits to further improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to install plastic windows, a warm floor and make some improvements to insulate her house.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 27 years old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her 3 children. Her husband has been working in public sector organization for many years.

Saima is also providing sewing services and earns an income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.

She is need of different kinds of goods e.g needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil etc for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Saima is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Asel

texts.ru: Асель, 36 лет, в разводе, есть сын. У Асель среднее образование, работу в селе найти очень тяжело, однако надо содержать семью. Поэтому уже 15 лет, она занимается сельским хозяйством - разводит дойных коров и бычков для реализации молока и мяса. На сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 11 овец. На арендованном участке мерою 11,60 ГА она выращивает ячмень для реализации. Также занимается торговлей продуктами питания в павильоне около дома. Ежемесячная совокупная прибыль - около 23,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Асель обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 90,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Асель планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Asel is 36 years old, divorced, and has a son. Asel has a secondary school education. It's very difficult to find work in the country, but she needs to support her family, so she has done agricultural work for 15 years now. She raises dairy cows and bulls so she can sell milk and meat. Asel's farm currently has 4 cows and 11 sheep. On a rented plot of land measuring 11.6 hectares, she raises barley for resale. She also sells drinks at a pavilion near her house. Asel's monthly income is around 23,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her business, Asel has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 90,000 som (KGS) to buy steers to fatten and resell. Asel plans to use the profits from her loan to continue increasing her number of livestock, and to save money to repair her home.

loans.use: to buy additional steers to fatten and resell.

loans.name: Aladdin

texts.en: Aladdin is 37 years old and married. He is the father of two sons. Aladdin is from Agjabadi and he doesn’t work. He knows that the most important thing in life is health, but he is sick. A few years ago he gave up his bad habits, and now he is very positive about his life ahead . He is looking to cure his damaged liver, but he requires a loan to get medical treatment. He will use this money to buy medicine. Aladdin is hoping KIVA lenders will support him.

loans.use: to get medical treatment.

loans.name: Jlg-018-Mettumarudhur Group

texts.en:
Chandra leads a group of 4 in Kulithalai area of Tamil Nadu (India). They come from similar backgrounds, working hard to sustain their families. Chandra has no access to a toilet at home, and her family has to therefore resort to open defecation, using the false privacy of nearby fields and surrounding shrubbery. Her family, especially the women and daughters, are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites.

So, taking advantage of the awareness initiatives, the group now seeks a loan of Rs. 56000 to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help these 4 hard working rural Indian families to access basic sanitation, and consequently, safety, improved health, medical savings, and improved productivity.

loans.use: to build toilets in their homes.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph 26 years old is married and supports one child. He is a small scale farmer. He has applied for his first loan of KES. 25,000 from Visionfund Kenya to buy certified fertilizers and herbicides to spray his crops to improve production.

He plans to use the gained profits to repay his loan and educate his children. He hopes to improve family health care.

loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers and herbicides to spray his crops to improve production.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice lives in a humble home in the town of Kitale, along with her husband and their 5 children. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education. She has been doing agriculture for 7 years now. She makes money selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs, and crops. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her and also poor productivity.

She is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. With the loan, she plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about the culture of saving and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way in changing the life of Beatrice and her family. Kindly loan to her today!

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as good quality fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Mourine

texts.en:
Mourine is a 27-year-old smallholder farmer from Kitale in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Mourine owns a small parcel of land. On the farm, she practices mixed farming. This loving mother keeps dairy animals and grows maize and vegetables and has 10 years of experience in farming.

Mourine is seeking a loan to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farm. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output. Loans for smallholder farmers with little irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. Few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Mourine. Through a group of 15 members called Nalolingo sunshine, Maurine has access to income-generating asset loans from Juhudi, which use the group-based savings as collateral. According to Juhudi Kilimo, horticulture represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Mourine because the institution believes that women too are actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers and herbicides to spray and top dress her crops to improve yields.

loans.name: Mallumachampatti Jlg 002 Group

texts.en:
Kamala is the leader of the Mallumachampatti JLG 002 group. Valarmathi, Nirmala, Selvarani, and Mohanpriya are the other members of the group. Kamala is 26 and lives with her husband in Tamil Nadu, India. She earns her daily wages by doing manual labour on agricultural fields. She wants to supplement her income and ensure there is a more steady source of income to support her family.

She underwent training from Gramalaya Microfin Foundation in embellishing sarees with semi-precious stones. Now, she, along with the other members in the group is seeking a loan to start a business from home. Kamala and Mohanpriya will pursue the same business in semi-precious stone-work on sarees while the other members will start a foot mat making business The income from the business will help them boost their income and save more in the long run for their children's education and for any emergencies that may arise.

loans.use: to buy semi-precious stones and sarees for embroidery work

loans.name: Laura Esmeralda

texts.es: Laura es una mujer emprendedora que ha logrado sus sueños con poco capital y con la ayuda de su esposo el cual tenía una panadería y con las ganancias obtenidas comenzó a vender ropa y zapatos adquiriendo cada día mayor variedad.  Laura quiere expandirse geográficamente y poder llegar a más clientes, pero para lograr la expansión y ofertar más productos requiere de un préstamo para comprar ropa y zapatos para mujeres, hombres y niños. Dentro de los planes futuros de Laura se encuentra poner un salón de belleza ya que actualmente se encuentra estudiando belleza de esta manera podrá combinar los dos negocios su tienda de ropa y el salón.
texts.en:
Laura is an enterprising woman who has achieved her dreams with a little capital and the help of her husband, who had a bakery. With the earnings, she started selling clothing and shoes, acquiring more variety each day.

Laura wants to expand geographically, and be able to reach more customers, but in order to achieve the expansion and offer more products, she needs a loan. It is for the purchase of clothing and shoes for women, men, and children.

Included in Laura's future plans is opening beauty salon, as currently, she is studying beauty. In this way, she will be able to combine the two businesses, her clothing store and the salon.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and shoes for women, men, and children.

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACIÓN COMUNAL EL TRIUNFO ESTA CONFORMADA POR OCHO INTEGRANTES SIETE MUJERES Y UN HOMBRE, MADRES Y PADRES RESPONSABLES DE QUINCE HIJOS, SON ORIGINARIOS MALPAISILLO LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA NORTE DE LA REGIÓN SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL, LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR Y SE VIERON EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR A TEMPRANA EDAD PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR.
GRACIAS  A SUS PERSEVERANCIA LA CORDINADORA ES AMPARA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA DE COSMÉTICOS EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN Y DE FORMA AMBULANTE, TIENE TRES AÑOS DE DEDICARSE A DICHA ACTIVIDAD, LA CUAL REALIZA CON MUCHO GUSTO YA QUE EL SUSTENTO DE SUS HIJOS. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE COSMÉTICOS COMO: LABIALES, SOMBRA DE OJOS, RUBOR, DELINEADORES, BODY, CREMA HIDRATANTES DE DÍA Y DE NOCHE, BRONCEADORES, CORRECTORES DE OJERAS ETC. PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. EL TRIUNFO AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
There are eight members, seven women and one man, in El Triunfo Community Association . Between them they have fifteen children for whom they are responsible. They are from Malpaisillo, located in the north part of the region and are known for their hard work, sense of responsibility, and desire to get ahead,

Sadly because of lack of financial resources they were not able to go to school but had to start work at an early age to help pay for household expenses.

Because of her dedication the coordinator is Ampara who earns her living selling cosmetics from her home and in the streets. She's had this job for three years and enjoys the work since it supports her children.

A para plans to use the loan money to buy cosmetics such as lipsticks, eye shadow, blush, liner, night and day body lotion, sun lotion, cream to correct dark circles on eyes etc. Then in the not too distant future she will be able to earn more money.

El Triunfo is grateful to Kiva lenders who provide poor people from poor countries such as Nicaragua the means to have meaningful work.

loans.use: buy and sell cosmetics such as blush, eye shadow, liner, body lotions etc.

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es: Aurelio se dedica a la siembra y comercialización de plátano. Solicita un préstamo de cuatrocientos cincuenta dólares ($450), para la compra de semilla e insumos agrícolas lo cual le permitirá aumentar su producción y mejorar los ingresos de esta actividad.
texts.en: Aurelio works planting bananas and bringing them to market.  He is asking for a loan of four hundred fifty dollars ($450) to buy seeds and fertilizer which will permit him to grow production and improve income.

loans.use: buy supplies to cultivate bananas.

loans.name: Zhamby

texts.ru: Жамбы, 53 года, замужем, мать 5 детей. У нее среднее образование. В качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав в 1993 году с суммы 20,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду, Жамбы на сегодняшний день имеет 5 коров, 30 овец, 7 лошадей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Zhamby is 53 years old, married, and the mother of 5 children. She has a secondary school education. As a source of income for her family, she raises animals, which she began in 1993 with 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Zhamby's very hard work, she now has 5 cows, 30 sheep, and 7 horses on her farm.

In order to further develop her business, Zhamby has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock to increase her headcount of livestock. She plans to use the profits from her loan to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Iveth María

texts.es: Iveth de 33 años, inspirada por su hermana quien es una comerciante independiente de carnes frías, observaba los argumentos de ventas que utilizaba con sus clientes, cuando ofrecía estos productos y al considerar que en su barrio podría tener oportunidad de consolidarse en esta actividad, tomó un capital y lo invirtió en una variedad de embutidos que son de constante consumo en la Región Caribe.  No obstante amplio la gama de alimentos incluyendo en su oferta carne de pollo y huevos criollos.  Lo que más disfruta de su trabajo es que solo realiza esta actividad cada quince días y dispone del resto del tiempo para cuidar de sus cuatro hijos menores de edad y atender las labores del hogar.  Actualmente está aplicando a una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  para comprar una nevera y surtido de embutidos; salchichón, butifarra, mortadelas y demás.  Con esta inversión podrá mantener mayor surtido y las condiciones de conservación necesarias. Su meta a futuro es ampliar su base de clientes y en lo personal desea continuar ofreciendo bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Iveth, aged 33, used to watch her sister—an independent merchant selling cold meats—delivering her sales pitch to her customers while offering those products. Inspired by this experience and considering that she could set up this type of business in her neighbourhood, Iveth invested some money in the purchase of a variety of cold meats that are always in demand in the Caribbean region. She also expanded the range of products by including chicken meat and eggs. 

What she enjoys the most about her occupation is that she only works every two weeks and has the rest of the time to look after her four minor children and do her household chores.

Currently, she is asking for a loan—her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo—to buy a fridge and an assortment of cold meats such as spiced sausages, "butifarra" [a type of Colombian sausage], mortadella, and other products. With this purchase, she will be able to maintain a broader range of products in the appropriate storage conditions.

Her future goals include increasing her customer base and, on a personal level, continuing to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy a fridge and an assortment of cold meats such as spiced sausages, "butifarra" [a type of Colombian sausage], mortadella, and other products.

loans.name: Auxiliadora

texts.es:
LA SRA. AUXILIADORA DE CINCUENTA Y CINCO AÑOS DE EDAD, ORIGINARIA DE LEÓN ,MADRE SOLTERA CON HIJOS MAYORES DE EDAD, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADORA, RESPONSABLE CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL, LA CUAL A TRAVÉS DE SU NEGOCIO HA LOGRADO MUCHOS DE SUS OBJETIVOS PROPUESTOS COMO, HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO, MEJORAR SUS CASA, Y SOBRE TODO TENER INDEPENDENCIA ECONOMICA. YA QUE ATREVES DE SU TRABAJO PUEDE MANTENERSE ECONÓMICAMENTE.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA DE PAN DE FORMA AMBULANTE Y EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN  TAMBIÉN POR ENCARGOS FIJOS A CLIENTE DE PULPERIA, Y VENTA DE LA LOCALIDAD, INCLUSO LE VENDE A KIOSKO DE UN COLEGIO DE LA LOCALIDAD. TIENE DIES AÑOS DE TENER EL NEGOCIO. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y COMPRA MAS PAN VARIADO COMO: PICOS, RIN, SIMPLE, DE HOG DOT, PAN DULCE,ESPIGAS, CATEDRAL .ETC. PARA QUE UN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. AUXILIADORA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LES BRINDAN LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Auxiliadora, 55, is a native of Leon.  She is a single mother with grown children who is known for being hardworking and responsible, and she has a desire for personal success. Through her business, Auxiliadora has managed to reach many of her goals, such as: making her business grow, improving her house, and most importantly, having financial independence.  Through her work, Auxiliadora is able to support herself.  Thanks to her desire for personal success, she has a business selling bread from place to place and from her house.  She also takes regular orders from the customers of a grocery store, and she sells in the town and in a kiosk of a local school.  She's had this business for 10 years.  

Auxiliadora will use this loan to invest in working capital by purchasing a variety of bread such as picos (a traditional Nicaraguan pastry), corn rings, soft bread, hot dog buns, sweet bread, wheat bread, bundt cake, etc.  This way she can have more income in the near future.  

Auxiliadora thanks the Kiva lenders for the assistance they are providing so that she can have a decent means of work.

loans.use: to buy bread to sell

loans.name: Alexis Elizondro

texts.es: Don Alexis trabaja en su finca en la cual se desarrolla la actividad de cría de cabras, con el propósito de implementar el sistema de rotación para mejora de pastos, solicita un préstamo de mil dólares ($1,000), para la compra de materiales necesarios para la construcción de dicho sistema.
texts.en: Alexis works on his plantation where he makes a living by raising goats. With the goal of implementing the rotation system to improve his pastures, he is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase the necessary materials to construct that system.

loans.use: to buy posts to outline his plantation

loans.name: Beloved Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Finda is a 42-year-old businesswoman. She is a member of Beloved Solidarity Group, which belongs to three women. (See group picture; Finda is in the middle).

Finda is married and has two children, age 22 and 15. They are both going to school. She has been in the drinks business for the past 10 years and opens her business six days a week from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m.

She established her business to help support her children in school. She pays school fees, buys learning material, and provides food from the profit she gets from the business.

Finda and her group members need a total of 3,000,000 SLL, of which Finda is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL, which she will use to buy an additional 10 crates of soft drinks, 20 bundles of pure water, and five crates of assorted bottled drinks to add to her business. She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family.

In the future, Finda plans to generate more money to provide for her children's university education. She believes educating her children to university level will improve the lives of her family.

Finda and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy an additional 10 crates of soft drinks, 20 bundles of pure water, and five crates of assorted bottled drinks for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy potatoes, yams, yucca, and corn at wholesale prices

loans.name: Gabriela Teodolinda

texts.es:
Gabriela es joven de 28 años de edad, es casada pero aún no cuenta con hijos, ella vive en una comunidad denominada aldea Chocola.
Gabriela es un ejemplo a seguir, porque afortunadamente logro graduarse a pesar de la difícil situación económica que su país enfrenta, ella dese hace  seis años trabaja como maestra en una de las escuelas que se ubica en su comunidad, con esta labor contribuye con la educación y la superación de su comunidad. Gabriela viendo las necesidades que su familia tiene a decidido solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de láminas para remodelar el techo de su casa.
El gran sueño de Gabriela es contar con un título universitario para darle a su familia lo mejor.
texts.en:
Gabriela, 28, is married but does not yet have children.  She lives in a community named Chocola village.  Gabriela is an example to follow, because fortunately she managed to graduate in spite of the difficult financial situation that her country faces.  For 6 years, she has worked as a teacher in one of the schools in her community.  With this work, she contributes to the education and success of her community.  

Seeing the needs of her family, Gabriela decided to request a loan to buy sheets of corrugated metal to replace the roof of her house.  Gabriela's greatest dream is to have a university degree so that she could give her family the best.

loans.use: to buy metal roofing material

loans.name: Florentina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Florentina, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, está casada desde que tenía 20 años de edad, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y también trabaja con ganado junto a su esposa, tienen 2 hijos y ambos estudian. 

Florentina, es ama de casa, pero también se dedica a cuidar ganado y desde pequeña se ha dedicado a esta actividad, sus padres le enseñaron este trabajo como forma de apoyo para ellos.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar una vaca lechera, para el consumo de la familia, anteriormente tenía una pero la vendió porque necesitaba el dinero.

El sueño de Florentina es, seguir trabajando y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Florintina, 33 years old, studied until eighth grade. She has been married since she was 20 years old. Her husband works in agriculture, and also works with livestock along with his wife. They have two children who both study.

Florentina is a housewife, but also works raising livestock and has done so since she was small. Her parents taught her this work as a manner of support for them.

The loan will be used to buy a milk cow for the family's consumption. Previously, they had one, but sold it because they needed the money.

Florentina's dream is to continue working and avail her family of a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es: Cristóbal trabajador, honesto perseverante son las cualidades que lo caracterizan como uno de los mejores tienderos de su comunidad, Cristóbal cuenta que con el crédito anterior le fue muy bien, pues gracias a ello logro comprar los productos para su tienda, a Dios gracias esta inversión mejoro sus ingresos, más sin embargo con este avance él no  está conforme y nuevamente solicita un préstamo para aprovechar una oportunidad que a él ahora se le presenta, que es la compra de una cuerda de terreno para cultivo, pues él también se dedica a al cultivo de café y banano con la compra de este terreno Cristóbal espera aumentar su cultivo en los próximos meses . Cristóbal espera poder contar con este crédito para seguir prosperando para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Cristóbal. Hard-working, honest and persevering are qualities that would describe one of the best store owners in his community. Cristóbal says that his previous loan went very well as thanks to it he managed to buy product for his store. And thanks to God this investment increased his revenues. Although he is still not content with this progress and is once more requesting a loan to take advantage of an opportunity that has presented itself. Which is buying a cuerda (a local land measure) of land to cultivate, as he also works growing coffee and bananas. With the purchase of this land Cristóbal hopes to expand his crops in the upcoming months. Cristóbal hopes to be able to count on this loan to continue to proper for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to grow on.

loans.name: Ana Ines

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer residente de la zona de Montería, una empresaria independiente que inicio un negocio de alquiler de videojuegos por necesidad económica y en gran parte por lo difícil que es emplearse en este municipio.

La empresaria es madre de dos pequeños de 7 y 9 años de edad, vive con su pareja y se siente feliz y motivada de que su negocio represente el progreso de su familia y sea la puerta hacia nuevas oportunidades.

Ana ha tenido muy buena demanda por parte de sus clientes, en varias ocasiones tiene que esperar más de una hora para usar una consola, por ello quiere realizar un esfuerzo para ampliar su cobertura, por ende necesita un apoyo económico para la compra de un tv y una consola Xbox.

Su sueño a largo plazo es comprar una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Ana is a woman who lives in the Montería area. She is an independent entrepreneur who started a video game rental business out of necessity and mainly due to the difficulty of finding employment in this municipality.

This entrepreneur is the mother of two small children aged 7 and 9 years old. She lives with her partner. She feels happy and motivated that her business represents progress for her family and acts as the door to new opportunities.

Ana has experienced good demand from her customers who at various times have had to wait for more than an hour for a console. So she wants to make an effort to increase her coverage. In the end she needs economic support to buy a TV and an Xbox console

Her long term dream is to buy her own house.

loans.use: to buy an Xbox console and a TV to expand her coverage.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 41 years old, married, with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like rice, sardines, noodles, eggs, milk, sugar, etc. to sell.

Gina has borrowed and paid 30 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from funeral homes.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like rice, sardines, noodles, eggs, milk, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jose Felicito

texts.es:
Felicito, de 33 años de edad, es una persona honesta y respetable por los miembros de su comunidad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casado y junto a su esposa ha procreado dos hijos.

Felicito, desde muy pequeño cultiva la tierra junto a su padre, tiene más de 10 años de cultivar sus propios granos, actualmente siembra 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y también cultiva 7,000 metros cuadrados de sandia; él trabaja muy fuerte porque de esa forma lleva el sustento a su familia y tiene los ingresos para mandar a su hijo a la escuela. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar abono y pagar mano de obra para cultivar maíz, de esa manera puede generar ingresos y poder cubrir los gasto de la familia.

Felicito, tiene como objetivo seguir cultivando la tierra para llevar el sustento a su familia y tener los ingresos necesarios para darle el estudio a sus hijos y hacerle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Felicito, 33 years old, is a person who is honest and respected by members of his community. He studied until secondary school. He is married, and together with his wife has two children. From the time he was small, Felicito farmed the land together with his father. He has more than ten years experience growing his own grains, in reality sowing 14,000 square meters of corn and also cultivating 7,000 square meters of watermelon. He works very hard in order to sustain his family and have the funds to send his son to school.

He needs the loan to buy fertilizer and pay laborers to grow corn. In this way, he can generate income to be able to cover the costs of his family. Felicito's goal is to continue farming the land to provide for his family, have the income necessary to let his children study, and make improvements to their home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay laborers to grow corn.

loans.name: Xojolá 9 Group

texts.es:
Catarina (la primera del lado izquierdo en la foto) es una mujer de 41 años de edad, es feliz mente casada, con una linda familia de3 hijos de las edades entre 10 y 22 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de la aldea Xojola.
Catarina para el sustento de su familia se dedica al cultivo y venta de café, con esta labor ya lleva quince años de ejercerlo, gracias a su esmero  y dedicación que le pone a su trabajo de campo es una de las productoras de café más reconocida en su región. Catarina a pesar de todos sus esfuerzos no le es posible darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, pero gracias a su liderazgo ha logrado que un grupo de mujeres se organizaran para solicitar un préstamo y cubrir las necesidades que tienen, Catarina con el préstamo comprara fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para su cultivo de café.
El gran sueño de Catarina es comprar cinco cuerdas de café para aumentar su cultivo.
texts.en:
Catarina, (first on the left in the photo) is a 41-year-old woman who is happily married, with a beautiful family of three children between the ages of ten and twenty-two. This humble family lives in a community of the village of Xojolá

In order to provide for her family, Catarina grows and sells coffee, and thanks to the care and dedication that she puts into working her fields, she is one of the best known coffee producers in the region.

In spite of all her efforts, it's not possible for Catarina to maintain her coffee crop, but thanks to her leadership, she has been able to organize a group of women in order to request a loan and cover the needs that they have. With the loan, Catarina will purchase fertilizer, and pay workers for her coffee crop.

Catarina's great dream is to purchase five cuerdas [a traditional unit of land measurement] of coffee in order to expand her crop.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, and pay workers.

loans.name: Mushgoa Multipurpose Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in this photo is Teresia. She is 49 years old, married, and blessed with two children. Teresia is a vegetable farmer who plants potatoes, carrots, and cabbages. She also operates a greengrocer. Teresia joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the trainings, especially those in enterprise development.

Teresia is requesting a Kiva loan to buy more vegetables and add stock to her grocery. She will use her loan to meet customer demands. She is grateful to Kiva lenders for their financial support. Teresia promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for her greengrocer

loans.name: Albino

texts.pt:
O Sr. Albino tem 34 anos de idade, casado maritalmente, sem filhos, porém, vive com a esposa, 02 enteados e 02 sobrinhos que estão na sua responsabilidade. trabalha como segurança numa empresa e, com o empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção, nomeadamente: cimento, varoes, estribos, blocos, pedra, area para dar continuidade na construçao da sua obra.
 Ele sonha em concluir a sua casa, melhorar as condiçoes habitacionais, contarair o matrimónio e comprar uma viatura pese embora o salário nao cobre com todas as despesas. Seu desafio é reembolsar o empréstimo o mais rápido possivel.
texts.en:
Albino is 34 years old. He has no children of his own, but he lives with his partner, 2 stepsons and 2 nephews that he supports. He works as a security guard for a company and he wants to use this loan to buy construction materials such as cement, beams, steps, bricks, stone to continue building his home.
His dream is to finish the construction works, improve the conditions on every room, get married officially and buy a vehicle, but at the moment his salary doesn't cover all his expenses. His goal is to repay this loan as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, beams, steps, bricks, stone to continue building his home.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “mujeres trabajadoras” y está conformado por 06 socios responsables. Elizabeth  de 20 años de edad es soltera. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa lo cual lo realiza desde hace más de 02 años. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su calidad de vida gracias al préstamo podrá implementar más su negocio. Su último crédito lo destinará para  la compra de ropa de temporada otoño invierno su mayor deseo es poder ampliar su negocio. El grupo “mujeres trabajadoras” agradece a las personas de kiva por hacer posible éste crédito. Elizabeth es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo color blanco con celeste.
texts.en:
This is a group of "Mujeres Trabajadoras" ("Hardworking Women") and is made up of six responsible members. Elizabeth is 20 years old and is single. She works selling clothing, which she has done for more than two years. With much effort, she has managed to improve her quality of life.

Thanks to the loan, she will be able to further develop her business. Her last loan went to buying clothing for the winter/fall season. Her greatest wish is to be able to expand her business. The group "Mujeres Trabajadoras" ("Hardworking Women") thanks the people of Kiva for making this loan possible.

Elizabeth is the first person on the left and dressed in white and blue.

loans.use: buy clothing for the fall/winter season

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
The person in photo is called Margret. She is 26 years old, married, and blessed with four children. She is a farmer. Margret joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 and received training in business management and recordkeeping. She also got knowledge about how to start an enterprise. 

Margret is applying for a Kiva loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to improve her farm production. Her loan will let her be in a position to provide school fees for her children and to improve her living standards. Margret is thankful to Kiva lenders for their financial support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds for her farm

loans.name: Nurshakul

texts.ru: Нуршакуль, 57 лет, замужем, есть взрослый сын. У Нуршакуль среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Нуршакуль, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 2 овцы. На 15,0 Га земли, где выращивает ячмень и клевер для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 13,700 сом (KGS). Супруг предоставляет услуги трактора местному населению. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и топлива для обработки почвы. Доходы от кредита Нуршакуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Nurshakul is 57 years old and married and has an adult son. She has a high school education, and earns a basic income for her family as a farmer and livestock farmer. Thanks to her diligent work Nurshakul currently has two cows and two sheep on her farm. On her 15 hectare land she grows barley and clover for profit. Her monthly income is around 13,700 KGS. Her husband provides tractor services for the local population. In order to further grow her business, Nurshakul turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase calves and fuel for cultivating her land. Nurshakul plans to invest the income she earns in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase some calves and fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tomatoes, chicken, onions, rice, sugar, cornmeal, flour and vegetable charcoal to sell

loans.name: Wilter

texts.en:
Wilter is 32 years old. She is married to Shem and supports one child. Wilter is a small-scale farmer. 

Wilter is requesting a 25,000 KES loan from Visionfund Kenya to buy certified fertilizer and herbicides for her crops. She hopes to improve her yields. Wilter will use the profits from her loan to repay her loan and expand her farm. In the future, she hopes to be financially stable and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy certified fertilizer and herbicides for her crops

loans.name: Asylkan

texts.ru: Асылкан, 48 лет, замужем, есть 3 детей. У Асылкан- высшее образование, она работает бухгалтером, дополнительно 20 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Асылкан очень любит свою деятельность, на земельной доле 1,50 ГА она выращивает картофель и фасоль. Также в хозяйстве есть 18 овец и 4 коровы. Накопления Асылкан старается вкладывать в образование и воспитание детей, а также в развитие бизнеса. Асылкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сомов (KGS) на покупку 2 телят и покупку сельтры для обработки почвы. Благодаря кредиту, Асылкан сможет откладывать доходы от бизнеса на дальнейшее его развитие.
texts.en: Asylkan is 48 years old and married with three children. She has a higher education and works as a bookkeeper. In addition, for the last 20 years she has worked as a farmer and livestock farmer. Asylkan loves her work. On her 1.5 hectare plot she grows potatoes and beans. She also has 18 sheep and four cows on her farm. Asylkan tries to invest her earnings in her children's care and education, as well as the development of her business. Asylkan has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase two calves and fertilizer for cultivating her land. Thanks to this loan, Asylkan will be able to further invest the income she makes in her business.

loans.use: to buy two calves and fertilizer for cultivating her land.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 58 years old, and she is married, with three children.   She works very hard to provide for them.

Fe runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like beverages, eggs, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

She has been in this business for 20 years now. In the future, Fe would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like beverages, eggs, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Henry Omar

texts.es:
Omar, de 53 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, actualmente viven con sus cuatro hijos, dos de ellos estudia.

Omar, se dedica a prestar servicio de transporte desde hace más de cinco años, aparte de esto también se dedica a la agricultura, su recorrido diario es de cinco kilómetros y trabaja todos los días, su hijo le ayuda a manejar el vehículo y él cobra el pasaje. 

El crédito lo necesita para darle mantenimiento al vehículo, porque tienen que repararlo y pintarlo, con lo cual pretende tener mejores ingresos para él y su familia.

Omar, sueña con comprar otro vehículo para trabajar mejor y generar más ingresos para su familia, también quiere que sus hijos estudien y puedan prepararse para que vivan mejor y se superen.
texts.en:
Omar, age 53, studied until third grade. He's married, and his wife is a housekeeper. Currently, they live with their four children, of whom two are studying.

Omar has been providing a transportation service for more than five years, and in addition, he also works in agriculture. He covers a distance of five kilometers daily, and he works every day. His son helps him to drive the vehicle, and he collects the fare.

He needs the loan in order to maintain the vehicle, as they need to repair and paint it. With this, he hopes to have a better income for himself and his family.

Omar dreams of purchasing another vehicle in order to do better work and generate more income for his family, and he also wants his children to study and be able to prepare themselves, so that they may live better and become successful.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle because it needs to be repaired and painted.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia Sonia se sigue dedicando al trabajo en un hotel,la socia es una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un equipo de sonido para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sonia continues working at her job in a hotel.

She is a very enterprising and hardworking woman, who wants to provide for her family by means of this business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase a stereo for her house.

She is happy about the loan, and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase a stereo for her house.

loans.name: Joana

texts.pt:
A Sra. Joana tem 43 anos de idade, casada, mãe de dois filhos que frequentam o ensino secundário. Para além dos seus filhos não sustenta mais ninguém.
Com o empréstimo, vai comprar capulanas, lençóis, cadeiras, duvetes e outros utensílios para revender.
 Ela sonha em melhorar as condições habitacionais e da dieta alimentar. Neste momento enfrenta dificuldades financeiras, porem, o desafio e reembolsar o empréstimo dentro de prazo acordado.
texts.en:
Joana is 43 years old. She is married with two children who attend high school. She doesn't support anyone else besides her children.
She will use this loan to buy capulanas, head scarves, chairs, quilts and other items to sell.
Her dream is to improve her home conditions and her nutritional diet. She has financial difficulties at the moment, but her goal is to repay this loan on the set schedule.

loans.use: to buy capulanas, head scarves, chairs, quilts and other items to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman, with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  She is 44 years old, and three of her children are in school.

Rosemarie has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shirts and pants.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shirts and pants

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana is 44 years old.  She is married and has five children who are in school.

Bibiana is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies for her livestock.

Bibiana has been in this business for 27 years now.  She has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her pig raising..

In the future, Bibiana would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer viuda de 48 años de edad, quedó como madre cabeza de familia a cargo de sus dos hijos, para mantenerlos y brindarles estudio tiene un negocio donde oferta mercancía como: productos de papelería, artesanías accesorios y cosméticos.  
Diana realiza está actividad todos los días de la semana con mucha amabilidad y cordialidad, al tener que ocuparse de todos los gastos de la familia, la deja con poco margen de dinero para invertir en el crecimiento de su negocio y este no ha podido despegar dado que vende siempre el mismo número de mercancías, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para aumentar su inventario  y de paso tener un negocio nuevo de venta de alimentos que le permita generar mayores ingresos para que la calidad de vida de su familia mejore.
Por ello Diana pide su apoyo, un aliento económico que traerá mucho progreso y grandes beneficios para ella como empresaria y en general para su familia.
texts.en:
Diana is a 48-year-old widow. She remained as mother, head of the family, in charge of her two children to provide for them and allow them to study. She has a business where she has on offer mechendise such as: paper products, crafts, accessories, and cosmetics.

Diana very amicably and cordially does this every day of the week. Upon having to concern herself with all the family's spending, she leaves a little margin of money to invest in the growth of her business, and this hasn't been able to get off the ground given that she always sells the same amount of merchandise. For that, she is requesting a loan to supplement her inventory and through this have a new business selling food, allowing her to generate greater income such that her family's quality of life improves.

For that, Diana requests your help, an economic breath that will bring much progress and great benefits to her as a businesswoman and in general for her family.

loans.use: supplement her inventory of crafts and personal-use products and begin the sale of food.

loans.name: Altynbu

texts.ru: Алтынбу, 44 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У нее - высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Алтынбу работает учителем в школе, также занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 12,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Алтынбу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 4 овцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 22,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Алтынбу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Алтынбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Altynbu is 44 years old and married with three children. She has a higher education and for her primary source of income she works as a schoolteacher. In addition, she has been working as a livestock farmer for the past 20 years. She started out with cattle she bought for 12,000 KGS. Thanks to her diligent work, Altynbu currently has two cows and four sheep. Her monthly income is 22,000 KGS. In order to further develop her farm, Altynbu turned to Bai Tushum bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase calves and sheep to increase her herd. Altynbu plans to invest her income from this loan in further increasing her herd.

loans.use: to buy calves and lambs in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man, with six children. He describes himself to be goal-oriented. 

He operates a retail business where he sells motorcycle spare parts. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a good area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of motorcycle spare parts. His business goal is to be a big supplier within five years. 

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.  His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: buy more stock of motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Kasojo Preparatory School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda!  This is Maurice.  He is the head teacher of Kasojo Preparatory School, a mixed school in rural Hima in Kasese, with 500 students. 

Kasojo Preparatory School has requested a loan to cover installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children.  Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. 

The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Kasojo Preparatory School will repay its loan from school fees, which it collects each term.  Maurice ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Aizirek

texts.ru: Айзирек, 19 лет, не замужем, детей нет, живет с родителями. У нее среднее образование, целеустремленна, жизнерадостна и трудолюбива девушка. В качестве дохода для своей семьи Айзирек занимается животноводством и полеводством, родители помогают по хозяйству. Благодаря упорному труду Айзирек и ее семьи, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы, 10 овец. Для содержания скота имеются все условия. Также Айзирек на земельной доле мерою 3,0 Га выращивает картофель, кукурузу, табак для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 13,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития хозяйства, Айзирек обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота и обработку почвы. Доходы от кредита Айзирек планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en: Aizirek is 19 years old and lives with her parents. She is not married and has no children. She has a high school education and is an ambitious, cheerful and hardworking girl. Aizirek works as a farmer and livestock farmer to earn income for her family. Her parents help her on the farm. Thanks to the diligent work of Aizirek and her family, they currently have four cows and 10 sheep on the farm. They have all the necessary provisions to support the livestock. On their 3 hectare plot Aizirek grows potatoes, corn and tobacco for profit. Her monthly income is 13,000 KGS. In order to further grow her farm, Aizirek turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 KGS to purchase livestock and cultivate her land. Aizirek plans to use the income she earns to further develop her business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock and to cultivate her land.

loans.name: Jlg-013(A)-Parali Group

texts.en:
Malathi hails from Kulithalai in rural Tamil Nadu. She works as a daily wage labourer in agriculture. She has four members in her family, including two children. Her monthly saving is onlly Rs. 1,800. 

She has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. Malathi's family is among millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. They are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites. 

Joining hands with Jeyalakshmi and Periyakkal (whose families all face a lack of sanitation facilities), Malathi has formed a group and is hoping to address this issue. The group requires a micro-loan of Rs. 42,000 to construct toilets at their places. 

A toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for Malathi and her family. It will also mean they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. So, together, they seek a loan of Rs. 42,000 to build toilets at home. 

As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve in health, they will be able to save on medical expenses. Your loan will provide all three families access to improved hygiene and a better way of life.

loans.use: To fund the installation of toilets in their homes

loans.name: Arlin

texts.en:
Arlin is 43 years old, married, and has six children.  Four children are in school.

Arlin is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines.   She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Arlin has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Arlin would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es:
Juana, de 41 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, todo su vida se ha dedicado a los oficios doméstico, estuvo acompañada y tuvo dos hijos en esa relación, hace 9 años se separó de su pareja, debido a problemas personales y desde entonces ha trabajado duro para poder sacar a sus dos hijos adelante, hoy en día su primer hijo ya está acompañado y su segundo hijo está estudiando bachillerato. 

Juana, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a vender tortillas, de ese pequeño negocio a podido pagar la educación de sus hijos.

El dinero del crédito lo necesita para comprar maíz y reparar algunas partes dañadas en el lugar donde vender las tortillas. 

Juana, planea con seguir trabajando en el negocio de tortillas, también desea vender pupusas y tener un cafetín; y por supuesto sueña con ver a su hijo convertido en profesional.
texts.en:
Juana, age 41, is a hardworking woman and a fighter, who has been a housekeeper all her life.

She lived with her partner, and had two children from this relationship. She separated from her partner nine years ago, owing to personal problems, and since then, she has worked hard to be able to raise her children. Now, her first son is already living with his partner, and her second son is studying in secondary school.

Juana has been selling tortillas for five years, and with this small business she has been able to pay for her children's education.

She needs the loan in order to purchase corn, and to repair some damaged sections in the stall where she sells the tortillas.

Juana plans to keep working in the tortilla business, and she also wants to sell pupusas [stuffed tortillas] and have a little café. And of course, she dreams of seeing her son become a professional.

loans.use: to purchase corn, and to repair some of the damaged sections in the stall where she sells tortillas.

loans.name: Kanchaiym

texts.ru: Канчайым, 59 лет, замужем, есть 4 детей. У нее неоконченное высшее образование, сейчас на пенсии, с 1993 года в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть корова, 10 овец, лошадь. На 1,50 га выращивает картофель и фасоль для реализации. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения объемов реализации молока, 2 телят, часть средств направит на полеводство. Канчайым является лидером группы "Чат-Базар", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их 3. Доходы от кредита Канчайым планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства, а также она хочет накопить средства на покупку земельного участка.
texts.en: Kanchaiym is 59 years old and married with four children. She went to university but did not finish her degree. Now she is retired, and since 1993 has been farming in order to supplement her income. On her farm she has cows, 10 sheep, and a horse. On her 1.5 hectare plot she grows potatoes and beans for profit. In order to further grow her farm, she turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase a cow to increase her milk output as well as two calves; a portion of the loan will also be used for cultivating the land. Kanchaiym is the leader of the "Chat-Bazar" group which includes two other members in addition to Kanchaiym. Kanchaiym plans to use the income she earns for the further development of her farm and also to save up to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy one dairy cow and two calves, and to cultivate her land.

loans.name: Cathrine

texts.en:
Cathrine wishes to thank Kiva and their lenders for the previous loan that enabled her buy fertilizer and dairy feed. This increased her production, and she earned more income that she used to meet her family's basic needs

She is asking for a  Kiva loan to buy more cereals and add stock to her cereals store. She believes this will enable her increase sales and earn more money to enable her continue supporting her family.

loans.use: To buy cereals and add stock to her cereals store.

loans.name: Beatriz Amparo

texts.es:
Beatriz es una mujer soltera de 35 años de edad, una mujer emprendedora que siempre le ha gustado trabajar como independiente, actualmente tiene un negocio de confección a terceros y su actividad la aprendió gracias a una clases que tomó y la experiencia que adquirió trabajando como operaria en empresas.
