La Decisión de ser independiente, tiene mucho que ver con una incapacidad que le imposibilita desempeñar otro tipo de trabajos, pero ella como toda una valiente guerrera se levanta todos los días, se sienta 8 horas en su máquina para producir y ganar el sustento de su hogar.
Actualmente Beatriz presenta dos dificultades, la falta de insumos y necesita unos repuestos para reparar su máquina de confección, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de los repuestos necesarios e insumos como broches, hilos, adornos.
Su principal sueño es salir adelante y en un futuro ojala no muy lejano comprar una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 35 years old and single. She is an enterprising woman who has always liked to work independently. She currently has a business sewing for third party contracts. She learned her work from classes she took and the experience she got working as an operator at factories.

Her decision to be independent had a lot to do with a disability that did not allow her to do other types of work. As a valiant warrior, she gets up every day, sits at her machine for eight hours to sew, and earns a living for her household.

Currently, Beatriz faces two difficulties: a lack of supplies and needing parts to repair her sewing machine, so she is requesting a loan to purchase the necessary parts and supplies like fasteners, thread, and decorations.

Her main dream is to move forward and in the not too far future, hopefully purchase her own home.

loans.use: to purchase parts for her sewing machine as well as supplies to do her work.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a married and has five children. 

He operates a business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.  His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for his transportation business.

loans.name: Gloria Lucia

texts.es:
Gloria anteriormente era un ama de casa que tenía como función despachar a su pareja e hijos y realizar los quehaceres del hogar, se sentía mal ya que ella quería producir su propio capital y apoyar a su esposo ya que en su casa hacía falta dinero, gracias a su madre aprendió a ser una comerciante y ahora sin descuidar su familia vende productos como ropa, calzado, cosméticos por catálogo.
Trabaja de la siguiente manera; muestra su mercancía por medio de la revista, apunta el pedido en el transcurso de los días lo lleva a la puerta de la casa y la forma de pago es por cuotas.
Está forma de la ha traído buenos beneficios pero a su vez se hace difícil recoger cartera, pero su actividad económica le permite ayudar en los gastos del hogar.
Gloria quiere solicitar un apoyo económico para cubrir un pedido grande que tiene, como todavía no es tiempo de recoger cartera se quedó sin capital, y este préstamo le permitirá cumplir con el pedido y ampliar su capital de trabajo para futuros pedidos.
texts.en:
Gloria used to be a housewife who took care of her partner and children and did the housework. She felt bad because she wanted to earn her own money and support her husband, since their household did not have enough money. Thanks to her mother, she learned to be a saleswoman and now she cares for her family and sells products like clothing, shoes, and cosmetics by catalog.

She works in the following way: she shows her merchandise in the catalog, records the orders, and delivers them to the door of the house when they arrive. She receives her payments in installments. This work has brought her many benefits, but for her, it is often difficult to collect money. Her work has allowed her to help with the household expenses.

Gloria is requesting a loan to cover a large order that she has, since it is not time to collect money and she is without capital. This loan will allow her to complete the order and expand her working capital for future orders.

loans.use: to cover an order for clothing, personal products, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Hima Green Hill School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Emmanuel. He is the head teacher at Hima Green Hill School, a mixed school in the rural area of Hima in Kasese with 400 students. 

Hima Green Hill School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Hima Green Hill School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Emmanuel ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is very proud of being a farmer. She keeps three cows for dairy. She is on a small piece of land but with a lot of activities on it. Her plan is to become a big farmer some day. Ruth is excited at the prospect of having clean cooking fuel that will not only be safer for her to cook with, but save her a lot of time every day! Please help her to fulfill her dream.

loans.use: to buy a biodigester for clean cooking fuel.

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en:
Zakir is 22 years old and he is from Agjabadi and is a merchant. Zakir is a hardworking and disciplined person. He wants to work on his father's land as a farmer. But it isn’t suitable for growing plants due to a lack of water.

He needs to install an irrigation system. For that he needs funds to be able to turn that ground into suitable land. Zakir is hoping Kiva lenders will show their support to him.

loans.use: to install an irrigation system to make land viable for agriculture

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman with 1 child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a cyber café where she offers internet browsing services and printing. She has been involved in this business for 1 year and her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high competition.

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy printing paper and materials to renovate the cyber café. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy printing paper and materials to renovate her cyber café.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself to be faithful. He operates a barber shop and has been involved in this business for 10 years. His primary customers are locals.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be power outages. He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy barber shop items and open another branch. His business goal is to have a company within 5 years.

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: with barber shop items and to open another branch.

loans.name: Yeison Erney

texts.es:
Yeison es un hombre de 27 años de edad que dedica todos los días de la semana a trabajar y crecer en familia y como empresa, se dedica a prestar sus servicios como oficial de obra, su principal dificultad es el desplazamiento ya que en muchas ocasiones sale demasiado costoso, otra de sus preocupaciones es la falta de herramienta.
Yeison trabaja por su familia, por su madre, llevarle el alimento, que ella no tenga que desgastarse trabajando, ya que tiene un hijo mayor de edad que vela por su cuidado.
Este trabajador empresario ha estado juntando ahorros para comprare herramienta y una motocicleta pero no ha completado el dinero, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para completar el monto que necesita para comprar una moto y una máquina cortadora de oxígeno.
texts.en:
Yeison is a 27 year old man who works every day of the week to help his family and grow his business. He works as a contractor, his main difficulty is to get to places because in many occasions it is very expensive. He also worries because of the lack of tools.

Yeison works for his family, for his mother, to provide her with food so that she does not wear herself out working since she has an adult son who takes care of her.

This entrepreneur has been saving to purchase tools and a motorcycle but he does not have enough money. For this reason he is requesting a loan, to complete the funds he needs to buy a motorcycle and an oxygen welding machine.

loans.use: to purchase an oxygen welding machine and a motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Feliciana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Feliciana es una madre de familia de 54 años de edad que a lo largo ha sabido luchar y sacar adelante a sus 5 hijos, una persona emprendedora verraca que tiene como prioridad su familia, peor no olvida que es una persona humilde y necesita trabajar para poder mantenerla.
Feliciana trabaja ofertando servicios de alquiler de lavadores, aparte que tiene una chaza donde vende snacks, dos actividades con las que genera el sustento y el alimento que diariamente sirve en la mesa a sus hijos.
Hoy esta empresaria con hambre de gloria, de salir adelante, mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de 2 lavadoras con las que ampliara su cobertura y surtido para su carro, dulces, frituras, chocolates, caramelos etc.
texts.en:
Feliciana is the 54-year-old mother of a family who throughout the years has known how to strive and raise her five children. She is an incredible entrepreneurial person who has her family as a priority, but she doesn't forget that she is a humble person and needs to work in order to be able to support it.

Feliciana offers washing machine rental services. In addition, she has a snack cart where she sells snacks. With these two businesses, she generates the sustenance and the food that she serves to her children every day at the table.

Today she is an entrepreneur with a hunger for glory, for getting ahead, for improving the conditions of her house. She wants to apply for a loan for the purchase of two washing machines, with which she will expand her coverage, and a stock of sweets, fried snacks, chocolates, caramels, etc. for her cart.

loans.use: to buy two washing machines to improve her service

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 59 years old, and married with three children.

Teresa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like feed, eggs, canned goods, and other groceries.

Teresa has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns income from buying and selling firewood.

Teresa aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like feed, eggs, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Mwainja

texts.en:
Mwainja is a single mother of 2 children who are both attending primary school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development.
She practices vegetable farming. She also sells clothes and she is taking a Kiva loan to buy more clothes so as to add stock to her clothes selling business for increased income. This will enable her to provide better food and clothing to her family.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and add stock to her clothes selling business for increased income, to provide better food and clothing for her family.

loans.name: Kajala Rani

texts.en:
Kajala is a 53-year-old widow who lives with her two sons in their own mud and straw-made house at Falakata, West Bengal. Unfortunately, she lost her husband. Due to poverty, she could not provide education to her sons. Her sons are engaged in carpentry work and a vegetable business. Kajala is illiterate, but can sign her name only.

Kajala is a good cultivator. She has a lot of experience in growing different types of grains and seasonal vegetables. After finishing her household work, Kajala does different activities in the fields such as cleaning, collecting grains, fertilizing, and more. She sells the harvested crops to the local market. The income is insufficient to bear the expenses of her family. So, she has decided to cultivate paddy. As it is the staple food of the local people, the crop has a very good demand.

Thus, she has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase supplies like fertilizer, seeds, and other farm supplies to start paddy cultivation and maintain her crops. Her future plans are to improve and expand her business with the profit she earns from this cultivation.

Kajala conveys her thanks to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Thama Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand is George. He is blessed with seven children. George runs a food café. Having undergone Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial management, he is equipped with knowledge and skills on business management. 

George is taking a loan from Kiva to boost the café business by buying more food stuffs. He plans to use the profit generated from his enterprise to pay school fees for his children.

He is grateful to Kiva lenders for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs that will boost the cafe business and enable him pay school fees.

loans.name: Thama Self Help Group

texts.en:
Mary, raising her hand in the photo, is a member of Thama Self Help group. She is married and blessed with four children. Two of her children are in primary school while one is in secondary school. 

She raises poultry and grows maize, potatoes and beans on her farm in Nakuru. Mary is taking a loan to purchase farm supplies like fertilizer and chicken feed for her business which she has been operating for eleven years. 

With this loan, she hopes that her business will generate profit to increase her level of income. This will enable her to be in a position to provide basic necessities for her children which includes food and education. 

Mary is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies like fertilizer and chicken feed.

loans.name: Jancinta

texts.en:
Jancinta is 25 years old, married and a mother of one child. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from the trainings, especially enterprise development. 

She practices vegetable farming.  She also operates a hardware store and is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy cement to resell. This will increase sales hence create more income to provide better clothing and food for her family.

Jancinta is happy with Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.  She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more cement for her hardware store.

loans.name: Jlg-007-Veeravalli Group

texts.en:
The sanitation crisis in India is a result of poor infrastructure and lack of education. Vairamani belongs to Kulithalai, in rural Tamil Nadu. She works as a daily wage labourer in the agriculture sector. She has four members of her family including two children. Her monthly saving is Rs. 2,050 only. She has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. Vairamani’s family is one of the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Without access to a toilet, they have to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields and hence are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites. 

Joining hands with Saritha and Adhilakshmi, whose families face similar problems due to a lack of sanitation facilities, Vairamani has formed a group of three members and is hoping to address this issue. Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for Vairamani, Saritha and Adhilakshmi and their families. It will also mean that they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. So, together, they seek a loan of Rs. 42,000 to build a toilet at home. As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve their health, they will be able to save on medical expenses. Your loan will provide all three families access to improved hygiene and a better way of life.

loans.use: To install a toilet in her home.

loans.name: Sobirjon

texts.en:
Sobirjon is a bright and gentle man. He was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1985. He is married and has two children and is a constructor. He gets orders and serves clients houses, with seven years of experience in this field. He gets regular orders each time.

His family members got sick. He is responsible to feed and take care of them. He appealed to IMON and Kiva lenders asking financial support to buy medicines for the treatment of his family members. He hopes to be understood and supported.

loans.use: to buy medicines for the treatment of his family members.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as honest. 

She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. Her business goal is to have a big grocery within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 35-year-old married woman with four children in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rose has a charcoal business in the Philippines. Rose requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now has requested another loan to further build her business.

Rose has been in this business for six years. In the future, Rose would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Bwera S. School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Milton. He is the head teacher of Bwera S. School, a mixed school in the rural area of Bwera in Kasese with 1,200 students. 

Bwera S. School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1,000 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Bwera S. School will repay its loan from its school fees, collected each term. Milton ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Claudia Jannet

texts.es: Claudia es una empresaria de 35 años de edad con una interesante idea de negocios, ella tiene una heladería, pero con un sentido y direccionamiento muy bello, no quiere vender helados, prefiere decir que vende momentos, momentos de felicidad, de encuentros, de amoríos, esa es su estrategia la cual quiere impulsar con publicidad, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para invertir en su idea de negocio y transformar su heladería en lo que pretende.
texts.en: Claudia is an entrepreneur of 35 with an interesting business idea. She has an ice cream shop, but with a very beautiful sensitivity and direction, she doesn't want to sell ice cream -- she prefers to say that she sell good times: moments of happiness, of meetings, of infatuation. This is her strategy, which she wants to boost with advertising, for which she wants to apply for a loan to invest in her business idea and transform her ice cream shop into what she seeks.

loans.use: to buy advertising to promote her ice cream shop as a seller of happiness and good times

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 53 years old, married and has three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2015 to access financial management and enterprise development training. Since then Margaret has been able to acquire these skills and she has been able to grow her business by seeking new market and improving her yields. She does mixed farming which enables her meet her daily basic needs.

She is applying for a loan to enable her purchase seedlings, fertilizers and pesticides which will improve productivity in her farm. This will see an increase in her income and she will be able to utilize the idle land in her farm by adding more crops which will be a boost in her income. A portion of the income will be re-invested in the business and the rest in improving their day to day living and getting a better education for her children.

She is thankful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay back promptly.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for better productivity, thus enabling her to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Alice, 54 years old and a mother of five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to learn new skills on how to manage finances for her business. She does dairy farming and is borrowing a Kiva loan to reconstruct the cowshed. She anticipates with the cow more secure and healthier, it will give higher levels of milk production.

She hopes her Kiva loan will enable her to provide for the basic needs for her family such as food and clothing.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their support.

loans.use: To construct a cow shed for better security and production.

loans.name: Tujipange Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Mercy, a member of Tujipange women's group in Nakuru County. She is 22 years old, married and blessed with two children. Mercy joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014.

Mercy farms maize, beans, and vegetable and raises poultry. HIH EA enterprise training has enabled her to manage her enterprise well, hence earning a higher profit. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and chicken feed that will improve the quality and quantity of her yields, thus maximizing her profit. Income from this enterprise will help her take care of her family's basic needs such as education and medical care.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and chicken feed.

loans.name: Rekharani

texts.en:
Rekharani, a 50-year-old woman, lives in a small village in Kandi, Murshidabad district in West Bengal. She is blessed with three children (a son and two daughters). She lives with her husband and son in a semi-concrete house. Her daughters got married. Rekharani is a housewife, and her husband is a farmer by profession.

Her husband’s income is quite inadequate for the family, so Rekharani decided to start a small milk-selling business for additional income. Because of growing expenses, it has become necessary for her to increase the family's income. In her local area, there is a huge demand for cows’ milk, and it is a lucrative business as well. So, to avail herself of the opportunity, Rekharani seeks a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase a dairy cow and fodder.

She is very hopeful that this business will support her to earn extra income and help her to strengthen her family's economy. She can also sell cow dung cake, which is used as fuel in the rural areas, for earning more profit. With this, she dreams to build a concrete house in the future.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and fodder to start her new business.

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi  Luz Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jehová es mi luz, coordinado por Milagro, de 40 años, desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, este negocio lo obtuvo con el dinero ahorrado de la venta de cosechas. Ella está casada y con 3 hijos, de edades de 20 y 19 años estudiantes universitarios y su hija menor de 9 años quien cursa la primaria. Con el crédito otorgado comprara pantalones, blusas, boxers, brazieres y faldas para ofrecer a su estimada clientes. 
Los demás miembros del grupo son Angelica de 23 años tiene una pulpería en su hogar. Marta de 50 años vende frutas y Miguel de 40 años tiene una pulpería. Con el crédito abastecerán sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group "Jehová es mi Luz" (Jehovah is my light) is coordinated by Milagro, who is 40 years old. For eight years she has been selling clothing. She began this business with the money she had saved from selling her crops. She is married and has three children, ages 20 and 19, who are university students, and her youngest daughter, age 9, who is in primary school. 

With the loan granted, she will buy pants, blouses, boxers, brassieres, and skirts to offer to her valued customers.

The other members of the group are Angelica, age 23, who has a grocery store in her home, Marta, who is 50 and sells fruits, and Miguel, age 40, who has a grocery store. With the loan, they will stock their businesses.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, boxers, brassieres, and skirts to sell

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is a married woman. She has two children. 

She operates a retail business where she sells fuel. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are motorcycle riders. 

She will use the Kes 90,000 loan to buy more stock of paraffin, petrol, and diesel. Her business goal is to have a fully fledged petrol station within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of paraffin, petrol, and diesel.

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en:
Loyce is a Kiva borrower. She has four children. She describes herself to be honest. 

She operates a retail business where she sell fish and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are loyal. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more fish, tomatoes, and potatoes. Her business goal is to be a supplier of fish within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more fish, tomatoes, and potatoes.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be determined. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Margie is 41 years old and has two children who are in school.

Margie has a ready to wear business in the Philippines. Margie requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shirts, pants, etc..

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now has requested another loan to further build her business.

Margie has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Margie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shirts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Paul, 43 years old, married and a father of five children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014. He took enterprise and financial training that has enabled him to start his own enterprises. He does dairy farming and rears poultry to earn a living and is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy animal feed and chicks to boost his business. He hopes to get more returns that will enable him pay school fees for his children and provide for their basic needs.

He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and chicks.

loans.name: Clinton

texts.en:
Clinton was born and grew up in Trinidad and Tobago and came to San Diego for school through a soccer scholarship. While in college, he got a job digging irrigation ditches for a private owner of three houses to earn money for college. During this time, he lived with a host family who introduced him to the real estate business in San Diego and the social responsibility of making a profit.

Four years later, after studying real estate, his first real estate deal came from one of the houses he worked on. In 2004, he entered the real estate market as a sales agent, became a real estate broker in 2007, and eventually a partner in a real estate company. When the 2008 real estate market crashed, Clinton decided to return to school as a business student. He graduated with a Bachelor’s Degree in International Business in 2012, and then in 2013 completed his Master’s Degree.

Now that Clinton has completed his education, he felt it was time to get back into the real estate industry. His wife Breonne will also be helping him run the business. She began her real estate career in 1998 as an administrative assistant for a top real estate agent in California, and spent a majority of her career in Mortgage Financing.

Clinton and his wife will operate as real estate agents representing first-time home buyers with an emphasis on millennials and those of the Christian faith. The business will also provide notary services as needed.

Clinton will use his $2,000 Kiva loan to print marketing materials such as business cards and flyers, and for additional hard costs related to starting his business. He has already developed a functional website to attract business and will be marketing through a local church’s marketing company for increased exposure.

loans.use: to print marketing materials such as business cards and flyers, and for additional hard costs related to starting his business.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred lives in Hoima Uganda. He is married with 4 children and only 1 attends school. 

He deals in spare parts for bicycles a long side mechanics and drinks. He hopes to develop and expand his business the more. He will use the loan facility to buy bicycle tyres for sell.

loans.use: to buy bicycle tyres for selling.

loans.name: Jlg-007(A)-Veeravalli Group

texts.en:
The sanitation crisis in India is a result of poor infrastructure and a lack of education. Prema belongs to Kulithalai, in rural Tamil Nadu. She works as a daily wage labourer in the agriculture sector. She has three members in her family including a child. Her monthly saving is Rs. 1,350 only. She has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. Prema’s family is one of the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk a kilometer's distance to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. They, especially their women and daughters, are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites. 

Joining hands with Maragatham, and Banumathi whose families face similar problems due to a lack of sanitation facilities, she has formed a group of three members and is hoping to address this issue. Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for Prema, Maragatham & Banumathi and their families. It will also mean that they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. So, together, they seek a loan of Rs. 42,000 to build a toilet at home. As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve in health, they will be able to save on medical expenses. Your loan will provide all three families access to improved hygiene and a better way of life.

loans.use: To construct toilets and improve sanitation facilities in their homes.

loans.name: Jlg-004-Rethinampillaipudhur Group

texts.en:
Vijaya has formed a self-help group with her friends in the rural part of Karur district,Tamil Nadu. All four members of the group are daily wage labourers, working hard to support their families, and save diligently. 

The group leader, Vijaya, has three adult members in her family and saves only Rs. 1,000 per month. Her savings are not adequate for her to access basic necessities like toilets in her home. Her family has to trek long distances at dawn to use the fields to relieve themselves. Due to this lack of sanitation facilities, her family members are at risk of infection and often fall ill, spending around Rs. 500 of their savings on medical expenses each month. The women and daughters in their family are exposed to the additional risk of molestation. 

Taking matters into their own hands, Vijaya and her group want to build toilets for themselves in their own homes. They seek a loan of Rs. 56,000 to cover the cost of raw materials and labor for constructing these toilets. Your loan will help these four hardworking rural Indian families to access basic sanitation, and consequently, safety, improved health, medical savings, and improved productivity.

loans.use: To fund the installation of toilets in their homes

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
Sebastián es un hombre de 28 años de edad que actualmente se encuentra sin trabajo, este hombre desea convertirse en profesional pues su sueño es montar una empresa de producción de pulpas, cuenta con un conocimiento básico, pero aún le falta demasiado por aprender, por ello con el apoyo de sus padres, con mucho entusiasmo e ilusión, Sebastián quiere solicitar un apoyo económico para realizar el estudio de una técnica en cocina y repostería, que se dará en la corporación Interactuar.

En esta técnica adquirida el conocimiento que necesita para poder iniciar el negocio que tanto ha deseado y con este generar una excelente calidad de vida a sus familiares que tanto lo han apoyado.
texts.en:
Sebastián is a 28 year old man who is currently unemployed. This man would like to become a professional. His dream is to start a business to produce pulp. He has the basic knowledge but he still has a lot to learn. For this reason, with the support of his parents and with a great deal of enthusiasm, Sebastián is requesting financial help to study cooking and baking techniques offered by the "Interactuar" corporation.

With this course he will receive the knowledge he needs to start the business he has wanted so much and with it, provide an excellent quality of life for his family who has supported him so much.

loans.use: pay a course to study cooking and baking techniques with the idea of opening a business.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Most people in Kenya believe in studying hard so that they can secure a formal job, but this is not the case for Roseline.

She left her job to become a small farmer. She decided that she will be independent and contribute to her community by practicing mixed farming. Roseline is married and blessed with eight lovely children who she refers to as “my heart beat.” 

Her primary sources of income are selling milk, farming poultry, and some personal business that she does to supplement her meager income. Deciding to practice poultry farming for Roseline was not difficult. She saw her parents’ rear poultry. 

For the past five years, Roseline has been earning a decent income from poultry farming. However, the demand is overwhelming and she wants to increase her supply, but the biggest challenge is lack of funds. She is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. 

Poultry farming has become one of the most important aspects of agriculture in Kenya because it creates business opportunity for entrepreneurs and it’s a business that can never dry up. Poultry farming is a less strenuous activity that is profitable. Many poultry farmers find a sense of fulfillment having hens all over their homestead. The hens lay eggs that can be consumed or sold. If taken seriously, poultry farming has the potential of being a big business because the demand for poultry products is always high. 

With your loan, Roseline is going to make more income that will enable her to take care of her family's expenses. As the times keep getting harder, Roseline is doing all she can do to ensure that her family's basic needs are met.

With your contribution, this mother will invest in a better future for her family.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Madhabi

texts.en:
Thirty-seven-year-old Madhabi is a humble housewife from Purba Magurmari village, under Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She lives with her husband and their only son. Madhabi's greatest motivation in life is to provide her son with good education, the opportunity that she did not get in her young age. She dropped out of school after eighth grade. However, she can't always supply her son with his educational needs with the meager income her husband earns. Her husband runs a small cycle-repairing shop.

Madhabi's son, 14-year-old Dibakar, is a student of average intelligence who reads in grade eight in Gossairhat K.M.H.S. (XII). Madhabi has been a very supportive mother and wife and shows great interest in bringing up her son with good, formal education. Like all other mothers, she also wishes her only son to become successful in his future educational and professional life. As their income is fixed within limits, it is difficult for her to pay annual fees and provide study materials for her son at one time, especially at the beginning of a new session.

So, Madhabi is requesting an education loan from BJS. With the Kiva loan, she will pay all the educational fees for her son. She will also purchase the study materials, school uniforms, and a bicycle for her son.

Madhabi is very happy about the loan. Her financial pressures are now diminished. So, she and her son Dibakar (in the photo) are very much grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to bear all the education-related costs of her son.

loans.name: Sandhya

texts.en:
Sandhya is a 47-year-old married woman from Kandi. She lives with her three children (two sons and a daughter) in the village of Nandi Baneswar. Her husband has left her, and she took the whole responsibility for the family. Her elder son works in a small private company, and younger son reads in grade 10.

With the growing cost of daily essential commodities, it is difficult for her elder son to bear all the household expenses and give the family all the basic needs in terms of food or health. Moreover, to bear the education expenses of his brother creates a burden on him. So, Sandhya decided to start a business of selling milk to the people of her locality to contribute to her family's income. She wants to sell cattle byproducts like cow dung, which is used as fuel in the remote region, to generate an extra amount of profit. So, she has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase another dairy cow.

She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her because the family’s income will increase and can ensure financial stability in her family to lead a decent life. She aspires to give a better education to her younger son with the profit generated from her business.

She conveys her thanks to BJS and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Beli

texts.en:
Beli is a 35-year-old rural woman who lives in a small village of Kandi, West Bengal. She is the mother of two sons; one of them reads in grade ten, and the other one is a toddler now.

Her husband works in a small company and is responsible to fulfill the needs of all the family members. Beli has been running her own beauty parlor, and she also contributes her income to manage the household expenses. She has been running her beauty parlor for the last three years.

Currently, she needs to buy different types of good-quality cosmetics and other modern accessories for her beauty parlor to attract more customers, but due to financial constraints, she is not able to buy these items for her business. Thus, Beli has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy the relevant cosmetics and beauty salon accessories so that she can provide better services to her customers.

It will also be helpful for her to earn the maximum profit to fulfill the needs of her family and expand her business as well. Beli hopes she will be able to make enough savings for her family to lead a secure life.

Beli is very grateful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to buy different types of good-quality cosmetics and beauty salon accessories for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Gulkaiyr

texts.ru: Гулкайыр, 38 лет, замужем, есть 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, с 2000 года в качестве дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть корова, 10 овец, лошадь. На 3,15 га выращивает картофель для реализации. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений для обработки почвы и выращивания экологически чистых овощей, часть средств направит на приобретение скота. Гулкайыр является участником группы "Чат-Базар", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их 3. Доходы от кредита Гулкайыр будет использовать для развития своего хозяйства, а также она хочет накопить средства на покупку ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Gulkaiyr is 38, married, and the mother of three children. She has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture since 2000, thus providing a source of income for her family. She has one cow, ten sheep and one horse on her farm. She also grows potatoes for resale on 3.15 hectares of land. In order to further grow her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 70,000 som (KGS). This loan will help her to buy some fertilizers to cultivate her land and grow organic vegetables. She will also use part of her money to buy some livestock.

Gulkaiyr is a member of the "Chat-Bazar" group which comprises two additional members, so a total of three people. She will use the earnings from her loan to develop her activity and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to continue to cultivate her land and grow organic vegetables, and to buy a few head of livestock.

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es: Diana es una madre luchadora, emprendedora, trabajadora, una fiel representante de la mujer del campo, una persona pujante que trabaja por mejorar y mantener su familia. Diana es madre de 3 hijos de 13, 9, 11 años de edad, tiene un cultivo de caña, su principal problema es el clima, la sequía que hay en el momento ha representado un fuerte inconveniente y la única manera de contrarrestarlo es con insumos agrícolas, para los cuales no tiene dinero, es por ello que necesita un apoyo económico para la compra de abonos, con este producto, podrá seguir sosteniendo está dificultad climática.
texts.en:
Diana is a striving mother, entrepreneur, hard worker, and loyal representative of rural women. She is a vibrant person who works to improve and support her family. Diana is the mother of three children ages 9, 11, and 13.

She has a cane crop and her main problem is the weather. The drought that is taking place is a great inconvenience. The only way to counteract this is with agricultural inputs, for which she does not have money. Because of this, she needs economic assistance to buy fertilizers. With this product she will be able to bear through this difficult weather.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, which will allow her to counteract the effects of harsh weather on her crops

loans.name: Erlis David

texts.es:
Erlis es un empresario de 30 años de edad, residente del municipio de Momil, una persona que trabaja diariamente en su negocio de cría de ganado porcino, el alto costos de insumos, alimentos, vitaminas y vacunas, sumado a la falta de capital hacen que su negocio se dificulte.

Empezó su negocio en el año 2014, por necesidad económica y gracias en gran parte a un amigo que lo guío por el camino del emprendimiento y le tendió la mano cuando más lo necesitaba.

Ahora luego de sobrevivir el primer año como independiente, Erlis ya analizo sus posibilidades en el mercado y necesita ponerse a punto con la competencia, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de lechones, vitaminas, alimento de engorde y vacunas, este empuje económico le permitirá tener las herramientas necesarias para convertirse en una empresa más sería y competitiva en el mercado.
texts.en:
Erlis is a 30 year old entrepreneur resident of the Momil municipality. He is a person who works daily in his business raising pigs. The high cost of supplies, food, vitamins and vaccines, in addition to the lack of funds puts his business in trouble.

He started his business in 2014 because of economic necessity and mainly thanks to a friend who guided him in the business and helped him when he most needed. Now, after surviving the first year independently, Erlis analyzed his possibilities in the market and he needs to compete. For this reason he requests the loan to purchase pigs, vitamins, feed to fatten them and vaccines. This financial help will allow him to have the necessary tools to have a more serious and competitive business in the market.

loans.use: buy pigs, vitamins, feed to fatten them and vaccines, to be more competitive in the market.

loans.name: William Alberto

texts.es:
William es un hombre de 28 años de edad que trabaja por mejorar sus condiciones de vida, por tener el dinero para enviar a sus muchachos a la escuela, por capacitarlos e inculcarles una mentalidad de estudio, que aspiren a una universidad y sean una generación que revolucione en su hogar y en su municipio.
Ese joven padre de familia, trabaja como independiente criando cerdos, una actividad que desempeña con mucho orgullo ya que dicha profesión le permita alimentar y educar su familia.

Para mejorar su negocio e ir cumpliendo su palabra con sus hijos William tiene que ingeniárselas para mejorar sus ingresos, lo mejor que puede hacer es potenciar su negocio y tener mayor cantidad de animales para llegar a buenos acuerdos, razón por la cual quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de cerdos, alimento de engorde, vitaminas y vacunas.
texts.en:
William is a 28 year old man who works to improve his quality of life. He wants to have money to send his kids to school and instill in them a studious mentality so that they strive to go to college and become the generation that revolutionizes his home and his city.

This young father works independently raising pigs. This is a job that he carries out proudly because this profession allows him to feed and educate his family.

To improve his business and fulfill his promise to his children, William has to think of ways to increase his income. The best thing he can do is to boost his business and have a greater amount of animals so that he can have good deals. Because of this, he is requesting a loan to buy pigs, fodder, vitamins, and vaccines.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, fodder, vitamins, and vaccines to improve his business and generate a higher income.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan is married with two children. He was running his piggery business.He has been doing this for more than seven  years and he earns well from this activity. Recently, Jonathan took a new loan from GDMPC  to purchase feeds in order to produce a good quality of pigs and be able to sell it in the market that will result a greater income. Jonathan  finds ways to save money to improve the living condition and  in order to give his children a better education. He wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for his pigs

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is widowed, 73 years of age, and lives in Malaubang, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental together with her two kids. Rosalinda is operating a sari-sari store to earn a living. She has been in this business for 25 years and she earns 6,000 PHP every month. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase supplementary goods for her general store. She joined GDMPC in 2012. In the future, Rosalinda will use her income to support her two kids in their studies until they finish college and in their daily needs. Rosalinda wishes that her business would be more progressive.

loans.use: To purchase supplementary goods for her general store.

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna works hard to support her family. Luna is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Luna has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Luna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 49 years old and has six children. Wilma is married and has four children who are in school.

Wilma is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Wilma requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Wilma has been farming vegetables for 5 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Elesa

texts.en:
Elesa is 45 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Elesa works very hard to provide for them.

Elesa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, bread, beverages, canned goods, school supplies and other groceries.

Elesa has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as  rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Elesa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, bread, beverages, canned goods, school supplies and other groceries

loans.name: Doloris

texts.en:
Doloris is 47 years old and married with four children.

Doloris works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Doloris has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from tailoring.

Doloris aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Saeeda

texts.en:
Saeeda is 38 years old and a responsible mother of 5 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, where her husband has been running his own butcher business for the past 5 years. Saeeda's husband needs to purchase different types of meats e.g beef, mutton, chicken etc for his business purpose. But due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase them.

To fulfill the needs of her husband, Saeeda has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will help her husband to buy this merchandise. That will be good for him to earn more income and this income will support him to fulfill his family's needs
Saeeda is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's butcher business

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans, 27 years old is married and supports one child. He is a small scale farmer and has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Visionfund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and to supplement his farming activity.

He plans to use the gained profits to repay his loan and expand his farming activity. He hopes to improve family health care as well as living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and to supplement his farming activity.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en: Analie has been running a general store for many long years earning well to sustain their living. She had sustained the business and with her generated income, she was able to pay her previous loan used for the business successfully. Improving her business is easier with her access to GDMPC. Recently, she took a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional profit generated by the business, to improve and expand her business

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Munkunyu School

texts.en:
This is Naome. She is the Head teacher of Munkunyu School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Munkunyu in Kasese with 1000 students.

Munkunyu School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1000 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Munkunyu School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Naome ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 42 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Anita is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to purchase additional farm fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Anita has been farming rice for 6 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening and buy and sell rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional farm fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a single woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Susan is 46 years old and has three children are currently in school.

Susan has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish, sacks of salt, net and other materials for her dried fish making business.

Susan has been in this business for 1 year. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish, sacks of salt, net and other materials for her dried fish making business

loans.name: Seak

texts.en:
Seak, is a farmer living in Achen village with his wife and 3 children. Beside farming, he goes fishing in fish season to earn extra money for his family. Seak wants to expand his business with 3 hectares big land and making his family living in comfortable condition. However, his house has no reliable energy source. He has to go to charge a car battery every 2 or 3 days for daily usage. Sometime because of busyness he doesn’t have time to charge battery. The whole family is in pitch black condition for the whole day.

Therefore, he is applying for a Kiva loan to buy high quality home solar energy. After using solar home energy, he believes his family condition would be better and safer. He also can save time and money on utilities.

loans.use: to pay for a solar power home system.

location.town: Achen Village, Kampong Cham Commune, Sambo Distric

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more stock of for her general shop thus enabling her to improve the living standards for her familty.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a married man with 7 children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a farm where he grows maize and has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a fertile area and his primary customers are locals.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be seasonal changes. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs and increase productivity.

loans.use: buy farm inputs and increase productivity.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself to be outgoing. He operates a retail business where he sells motorcycle spare parts and he has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals.

He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of motorcycle spare parts. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Juliet is 49 years old and has two children who are in school.

Juliet has a food vending business in the Philippines. Juliet requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Juliet has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Juliet would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jlg-012-Panikkampatti Group

texts.en:
Lalitha is a 30-year-old daily wage labourer who toils to sustain her small family of 4. She lives in Kulithalai in the rural part of Karur, Tamil Nadu. Lalitha has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. Lalitha's family is one of the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Joining hands with 3 others whose families all face similar problems due to a lack of sanitation facilities, Lalitha has formed a group with 3 other women and is hoping to address this issue. Without access to a toilet, their families walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. This puts them at risk of infection, molestation or attack, and even insect or animal bites.

Seeking to improve their situation, they seek a loan of Rs. 5600 to build toilets in their homes. As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve in health, they will be able to save on medical expenses. Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for Lalitha and family. It will also mean they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. Your loan will help these 4 hardworking rural Indian families to access basic sanitation, and consequently, safety, improved health, medical savings, and improved productivity.

loans.use: to construct toilets and improve sanitation facilities in their homes

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Mabel is 23 years old and is 1st of four children in the family. Her mother Maribel a member of NWTF, supports the family through her food vending business in the Philippines.

Mabel is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education and is currently on her 3rd year of this 4-year course.

Maribel is borrowing PHP 7000 to pay tuition fees of her daughter Mabel for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

Mabel plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to help pay her daughter's tuition fees for a B. Sc. in Elementary Education

loans.name: Wilberto

texts.es:
Wilberto es un joven soltero de 19 años de edad, residente de la zona de Momil, un departamento con altos índices de pobreza y en donde sus habitantes esperan tener oportunidades para mantener a los suyos.
Por su parte Wilberto tiene un negocio de cría de cerdos, uno que empezó empíricamente y por necesidad económica, con dicho negocio ha ido solventando sus problemas de dinero y poco a poco ha salido adelante.
Debido a la falta de capital no ha podido crecer como empresa, ya que sus responsabilidades y el alto costo de los insumos y animales no se lo permiten, es por esta razón que quiere acudir a un apoyo económico para la compra de cerdos, alimento de engorde,  vacunas y vitaminas.
Su mayor deseo es mejorar las condiciones de su familia y trabajar fuerte y honestamente para salir de la pobreza.
texts.en:
Wilberto is a young man of 19, single and a resident of the Momil area, a department with high rates of poverty and where its inhabitants hope to have opportunities for supporting their families.

For his part, Wilberto has a business raising pigs, one he started by learning from doing and due to economic necessity. With this business he has gradually dealt with his money problems and little by little has moved forward in life. 

Due to lack of working capital he has not been able to see his business grow, as his responsibilities and the high cost of supplies have not allowed him to do so. This is the reason he wants to apply for financial support to buy pigs, feed for them, vaccines and vitamins.

His greatest desire is to improve his family's living conditions and to work hard and honestly in order to leave poverty behind.

loans.use: to buy pigs, feed for fattening them, vaccines and vitamins for improving his business.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a smallholder farmer who lives and works on a small farmland in the Kitale area of Kenya. She makes a living doing dairy, crop and horticultural farming. She enjoys her job as a farmer because it provides food, income, and a livelihood for her family. Besides farming being a means of securing the basic necessities for life, she finds self-respect and fulfillment knowing that what she does feeds her nation. In the area of Kenya where Damaris operates, there is a huge deficit in terms of access to financial products and services. For years, Damaris has had yields and incomes that are far below what they could be because she can't afford quality agricultural inputs.

Juhudi Kilimo partnered with Kiva to provide financial services to smallholders around Kenya. Through this partnership, financial services are now available to farmers like Damaris. She is seeking a loan to buy important agricultural inputs ahead of the planting season. These farm inputs include seeds, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides. Your loan will enable her to improve her production through use of quality farm inputs. This intervention will help her fill the increasing demand for food in the market and, in the process, generate more income to repay the loan debt and elevate the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
The person featured in the picture is Elizabeth, 44 years old, married, with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2015 to access financial management and enterprise development training. Since then she has been able to acquire new skills and she has been able to grow her business by seeking new market and improving her yields.

She has also learnt the art of adding value to her milk and this has greatly increased her income in the dairy farming. Elizabeth is applying for a loan to enable her purchase seedlings, fertilizers, pesticides and animal feeds which will improve productivity in her dairy enterprise. This will see
an increase in her income which will be re-invested in the business and the rest in improving her living standards and getting better education for her children and also catering for their basic needs.
She is thankful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay back promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as animal feeds, seedlings and fertilizer. This will boost production hence more income and enable her to pay school fees for her children among others.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is the mother of six children. When she was asked to give a word that describes herself, she said, “Industrious.”

For the past four years Ruth has sold used clothing to earn an income. She sells them to locals in a busy location. She says her biggest challenge is not having enough clothes to sell.

Ruth has applied for a 20,000 KES loan through Kiva's field partner SMEP to buy more clothes to sell. She hopes that she will have a better life in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Zhanar

texts.ru: Жанар, 39 лет, замужем, есть 3 сыновей и дочь. Жанар на протяжении многих лет занимается разведением скота и полеводством, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 2 коровы, 2 лошади и 2 овцы, также выращивает люцерну и ячмень на 3,25 Га земли. Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS) на покупку корма для скота. Кредитные средства позволят Жанар приобрести корм, сохранив поголовье скота. Будущие доходы она направит на развитие бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en: Zhanar is 39 and married with three sons and a daughter. She has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture for many years, and currently has two cows, two horses and two sheep as well as 3.25 hectares of land where she grows alfalfa and barley. She has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 75,000 KGS to purchase livestock feed. The loan amount will allow her to purchase feed and therefore to maintain her number of animals. She will put future income toward developing her business and renovating her house.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Blanca Otilia

texts.es:
Blanca junto con su pareja no solo formaron una unión amorosa, lograron montar un negocio de reciclaje y ambos laboran los 7 días de la semana para posicionarlo y hacer que este perdure en el tiempo, Blanca es madre de dos hijos, uno adolescente y otro menor de edad, sus más de 20 años en el mercado le dan el aval de ser una empresaria sería y comprometida con su función como administradora y como madre de casa, puesto que la empresa ha representado un crecimiento exponencial y mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de ella y su familia.
Blanca solicita un pequeño monto de capital para realizar algunas adecuaciones a su negocio ya que estas han sido muy golpeadas con el pasar de los años. 
Uno de ellos son los depósitos donde colocan los productos, requiere pintura y una cerca para delimitar el producto recaudado.
texts.en:
Blanca, along with her partner, not only formed a loving union, but they also managed to set up a recycling business. Both work 7 days a week to position the business, and make sure that it endures over time. Blanca is a mother of two children, one an adolescent and one a young child. 

Her more than 20 years in the market have giver her the guarantee of being a serious entrepreneur, committed to her role as a manager and as a mother. The business has shown exponential growth and improved the quality of life for Blanca and her family.

Blanca requests a small loan to complete some adjustments for her business, because things have been worn with the passing of the years. One of these adjustments is in the deposit where products are stored; it needs painting and a fence to separate the collected product.

loans.use: with local improvements; she needs to reconstruct the deposit area, some paint, and a fence to mark off products.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a married man with two children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a retail business where he sells animal feeds and agrovet products. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are farmers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient storage space. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of animal feeds and agrovet products. He hopes that in the future he will have improved living standards. This is his sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of animal feeds and agrovet products.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman with four children. She describes herself as focused. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt:
O Sr. José tem 32 anos de idade casado, pai de quatro filhos dos quais três estudam e um é menor de idade.
Tem uma ferragem no quintal da sua casa, vende diversos tipos de material de canalização eléctrica e de água. Com este financiamento de 15.000,00mts vai comprar tubos, cabos eléctricos, varões, cimentos e outro material comercializável para reforçar o seu negócio. Sonha em ampliar o negócio para fornecer o material de canalização a muitos clientes e o desfio é trabalhar mais de forma rentável.
texts.en:
José is 32 years old. He is married with four children, three of them are in school and the last one is a small child.
He runs a hardware store out of his home where he sells a variety of water and electrical piping material. He will use this loan to buy piping, electrical cables, posts, concrete and other materials to make his business stronger.
His dream is to expand this business and provide more customers with piping material, so this goal is to work harder to make his business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy piping, electrical cables, posts,  concrete and other materials to expand this business
